story:
Plant a Coconut. Save a Beach in Paradise.

Sponsor the planting of a coconut seedling to reduce beach erosion on the white sand beach of Gili Air atoll. One of three islands in the Gili archipelago off the coast of Lombok, Indonesia.

  • Eroding beaches are destroying the coastline and eco-bungalows which support the island's 1,000 inhabitants and their school, medical clinic and eco-tourism.
  • Garbage removal to the mainland and a recycling program will stem the pits of garbage which are poisoning at the atoll's water table.
  • Documenting the coastal erosion and expanding garbage pits on all three islands of the Gili archipelago will assist in further action in 2015.
  • Supporting eco-tourism in paradise will keep Gili Air an idyllic island for hopefully years to come. www.ProtectGiliAir.org documents the possible eco-development of Gili Air - an atoll with no cars or motor scooters, just horse carts and bikes.

A Coconut Seedling With Your Name On It

  • $10 plants a coconut seedling reducing beach erosion. We'll write your name on it, photograph it and post it on www.facebook.com/plantacoconut. 
  • $15 pays one worker one day to bag garbage and then ship it to the mainland via boat for disposal. Pays for garbage bags, gloves, transfer of garbage to the beach by horse cart and proper mainland disposal. We'll post photos of all the workers and bagged garbage on www.facebook.com/plantacoconut. 
  • $20 goes toward the purchase a of quadcopter drone to video the coastal erosion and pollution on all three islands - Gil Air, Gili Tarwangan and Gili Meno. In 2015, we hope to do even more. Watch the videos we'll post on Facebook: www.facebook.com/plantacoconut.

Let's Not Pave Over Paradise

This white sand and swaying coconut tree paradise has backpacker eco-tourism, dive shops, and snorkling boat rides amongst amazing turtles and giant clams. There's no cars or motorbikes on the island. Just horse carts, goats and chickens with paths and bikes. Walk around the island in an hour or so, or get lost in the light temperate jungle in the interior.

  • Solar power already supplies clean energy
  • The dynamiting of the coral reefs have been halted and are being regrown by BioRock
  • Overfishing continues including the decimation of manta rays for Chinese markets

There's lots to do!

Join Gili Air Beach Cleanup, June 2014

Join us in paradise for this year's beach cleanup and coconut planting on June 15th to 17th on the west end of Gili Air near Safari Beach Bar www.facebook.com/SafariBeachBarGiliAir and Salabose Cottages www.facebook.com/SalaboseCottagesGiliAir

  • Tell your friends about our Indigogo request
  • Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/plantacoconut
  • Visit www.plantacoconut.org/
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the message!
  • Make a real difference by planting a single coconut or more

story:
WHAT ARE WE ALL ABOUT?

Hello everyone, my name is Maria and I'm the co-founder of BabooDeals.

BabooDeals is pretty awesome! We sell consumer goods at up to 90% OFF the retail price. Saving people TONS of money! We buy back all unwanted merchandise: such as customer returns, overstock and shelf pulls from some of the largest retailers in North America. In doing so, we help eliminate massive landfills and toxins that can cause cancerous effects. Since our launch BabooDeals has helped the environment by creating a secondary market for unwanted merchandise. Not only does this help our environment but also some people in need.

 

Help us protect our environment by re-using, reducing and recycling used consumer goods.

Did you know that all your returned goods, or overstock merchandise could all end up in a landfill somewhere? After it ends up in landfill the next thing to happen sadly is seep into our drinking water.

At BabooDeals we make sure that this doesn't happen.

Why invest in our cause and business?

  • We put unwanted used/overstock consumer goods into the hands of someone that needs them
  • We protect our environment, and our children’s future
  • We reduce waste, encourage recycling, and help animals live longer

Imagine all the customer returns at your local Wal-Mart, what about Target or  Home Depot? The list goes on.. Now imagine in your entire State or Province.. How about nationwide?  This results in millions of metric tons of waste every year that can be reused, recycled, remanufactured, refurbished and resold to someone.


WHAT CAN YOU DO FOR US AND WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN?

We need at least $25,000 or more to buy more of these unwanted products. We will expand and grow our cause/business and also increase our purchasing power. By buying in large volumes we keep our prices low for resale.

Most of the money will be used to fund more purchases from these retailers. Once we purchase this stock we will store it at our facility - NOT a landfill, and begin re-distribution.

By investing in us = you help our world be a greener place while getting some cool perks along with your contribution. Every contribution helps! As little as $2.00 or up to $2500.00 we can all help each other!


The Impact

This project will allow us to minimize landfills, buy products at lower costs and offer them at lower prices. Just imagine the changes we can make!

 

Some of the Hazardous materials found in the Electronics waste include:

  • Americium which is a radioactive substance known to be cancerous
  • Mercury which can cause memory loss, reduced fertility, and worst of all ... death
  • Sulfur which can be very painful and causes liver, kidney, and heart damage. And those are just a few.. There are at least 10 more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey if you're not ready to contribute financially we can still use your help:

  • Like us on FaceBook (www.facebook.com/baboodeals)
  • Follow us on Twitter (www.twitter.com/baboodeals)
  • Tell your family, friends and co-workers about us.
  • Buy goods from us at up to 90% off.
  • Educate others on how Electronic waste affects all of us!

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL GO A LONG WAY!

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

story:
Why?

Without proper allocation of funding to research Cannabis’ uses and side effects, the plant will continue to hold the same social and legal stigmas as heroin and cocaine.  This is more based on the limited capability for taxation and regulation than any inherent pitfalls of Cannabis use.  The benefits of medicinal Cannabis—which has been shown to positively affect patients suffering from cancer, dementia, diabetes, epilepsy, glaucoma, and Tourette syndrome—will never be fully explored. We also feel that Cannabis, as a plant, should be treated as such and that a private citizen should be able to grow and possess this plant within reasonable amounts the same as one grows and possesses herbs like ginseng or lavender.

How?

The Plant A Seed Tour is an effort to offset the challenges brought about by Cannabis’ unlawful classification.  It is the story of William "Palito Blanco" Mueller, along with Ken, Shirley, and Dakota of the Locke family, cyclists who are passionate about raising awareness for medicinal and therapeutic Cannabis use, as they embark on a grueling 4,200 mile journey across the U.S. from St. Augustine, Florida to San Fransisco, California, and later across the entire country of Uruguay.  The tour’s purpose is to raise money that will go directly towards Cannabis research, education, and awareness in the U.S., as well as around the globe.  You can follow the tour in the various YouTube videos, which will be posted in a video journal as they complete the tour, and you can follow the journey on his blog (www.plantaseed.community).   

The Route From St. Augustine, FL to San Fransisco, CA:


The Route Across Uruguay:

How can you help?

You can help by sponsoring the tour itself, and by supporting the cause of Cannabis education.  All bikes were funded by the tour's participants.  The following is a list of items William, Ken, Shirley, and Dakota will need to complete their journey:

  • Garmin Video Camera 
  • Spare tubes 
  • Patch kit 
  • Pump 
  • Helmet mirror 
  • Compression Strap 
  • Cycle Multitool 
  • Spare Spokes (6) 
  • Spoke Wrench 
  • Zip Ties 
  • Spar Tire 
  • Chain Tool 
  • Replacement chain links 
  • Lubricant 
  • Brake and derailleur cables 
  • Spare Components 
  • Light Weight Sleeping Bag 
  • Sleeping Pad 
  • Light Weight Tent
  • Tour Name Jerseys (4) 
  • Padded Bike Shorts (3) 
  • Cycle Gloves 
  • Clipless Cycle Shoes
  • Cycle Socks 
  • Wind/ Rain Jacket 
  • Wind/Rain Pants 
  • Insulation layers for cold weather 
  • Visibility Vest 
  • Sun Glasses 
  • First Aid Kit 
  • Chamois Cream 
  • Quick Dry Towels 
  • Performance Drinks 
  • Maps 
  • Toiletries 
  • Solar Charger 
  • Striker Taser Flash Light
  • Modest Food Rations 
  • Tarp 
  • Cooking Stove 
  • Cook Ware 
  • Duct Tape 
  • Air Fare 
  • Feeling of Accomplishment (Priceless)

Extra funding is to account for taxation, so that each funding need will be met.

What you will see:

You will see the expansion of Cannabis studies, and know that you took part in the decriminalization of the plant.  This campaign is more than another protest for legalization, however, it is a movement to inform the world about Cannabis. You will be a part of the Plant A Seed Community.  When the benefits of the plant are widespread, you will know that together we have elevated the quality of life for everyone.

story:
Our story

Sometime early in 2013, we happened to read about some entrepreneurs using scrap tyres to make footwear. We thought it was a neat idea and could be replicated in India as well. When we started working on this initiative, we had no idea of how sandals are manufactured; neither of us had any background in the footwear industry. So we visited the localities where the cobbler community resides and started interacting with a few cobblers. During such interactions, we became aware of the various issues that these cobblers were plagued with. Life is daily struggle for most of them. Hence we took a conscious decision to use profits from this venture towards improving the living conditions of our cobblers and provide them with access to better healthcare and education for their children.

What We Need

Having designed, manufactured and sold a few hundred sandals we now understand the intricacies involved in the manufacturing of a sandal with soles made of scrap tyres. Our goal is to aggressively market our products, both in the domestic and international markets. Additionally we also need working space to manufacture and store our sandals. Currently the cobblers work from their own homes, but given the space constraints, it becomes difficult to execute large orders. We need the funds, to scale up our operations, and to increase our marketing efforts. Additionally the funds will also help us manage our cash flows.

Our estimated funds requirements are US $ 18000 (Approx in Indian Rs 1,000,000). While we hope to raise this amount, we would still continue with our operations and marketing plans.

What you get

As a token of appreciation for your contribution we would offer you a range of perks, from listing in our Hall of Fame contributor’s list on our website to a complimentary sandal of your choice, based on your contribution.

Other ways you can help

While we understand that you may not be in a position to make a financial contribution at this moment, you can definitely help us in spreading the work about our venture as well as this campaign.

-  Tell your friends about our venture and the campaign

-  Follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Paaduks and share our page with your friends

-  If you know any retailer/dealer who you think would be interested in purchasing our products, help us connect with them.


Check out some of our products:      

 

For more pictures please visit our website at www.paaduks.com

Thanks for visiting our page and taking interest in our work. Your support means a lot to us. A small contribution from your side would go a long way in helping us increase our outreach and more importantly, in bringing prosperity to the lives of our cobblers.

We also request you to take a few seconds to spread the word about Paaduks and our campaign. Please share the page using one or more of the options above.

Thanks.

Team Paaduks.

story:
[The video above is the first in a series of short videos showing what's growing at our urban farm this year, because potential funders asked to see what I've done so far, even though it's not directly related to the IPCC in Cuba.  View the rest of the series at YouTube.  Enjoy!]

Hi!  I'm Ben Stallings, of Interdependent Web Urban Farm.  I got my permaculture design certification in 2010, and since then I've been teaching basic introductory classes and working on my own site as well as some friends' and neighbors' sites here in Emporia, Kansas.  This year I'm raising 75 crops for market on less than a tenth of an acre, and I've got three satellite sites around town, with the potential for more this fall.  I've gotten a lot of mileage out of my design certification class, but I've been waiting for the right opportunity to pursue further training.

For years I've been hearing about the exciting progress that's been made in Cuba since they lost their access to cheap fossil fuels in the early '90s.  From what I've heard, I believe Cuba gives us a glimpse into a possible sustainable future, if the rest of the world can turn our backs on fossil fuels.  I'd love to see for myself what's going on there, but of course it's illegal for an American citizen to visit Cuba except on business.

So imagine my excitement when I learned that the 11th biennial International Permaculture Convergence will be held in Havana!  This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for me to see what's happening in Cuba while extending my knowlege and connections in the world of permaculture.  It will be an amazing and life-changing week, and you can not only make it happen for me, I'm giving you the chance to secure your own part of that experience for yourselves.

Now, it's not going to be a cheap trip.  I don't have the option of couchsurfing or hitchhiking or cutting corners; I have to book my trip to Cuba through an agency that takes care of all the arrangements, and I have to get to Cancún before I even meet up with them.  I'm looking at a minimum of $4,000 for this nine-day trip.  That's why I need your help.

But what can I offer you in return?  Well, souvenirs, of course... I can't bring back cigars or rum, and space will be limited in my suitcase, but I'll send you a postcard, and I'll take requests from larger donors for artworks, books, and music, and if I can find them I'll get them to you in time for Christmas.  But more importantly I'd like to offer you the benefit of what I learn while touring Cuba and attending the Permaculture Convergence.

If you contribute $25 or more, I'll share with you a series of presentations about everything I've learned on the trip, either in person or over the net, and I'll answer any questions you have about it.  If you contribute $100 or more, I'll give you an equivalent discount on my permaculture design services for your own property.  Contribute $1000 or more, and I'll personally make it happen.

I'm setting this campaign up so that if I don't reach my full goal of $4000, the funds will still go toward the trip... I'll just have to pay the rest out of pocket.  But if I exceed the goal, I'll have enough design work through your discounts to keep on doing what I love for months after the trip!

So this isn't just about sending me on some kind of vacation or business trip, it's an investment in a sustainable future for all of us.  I'm going to bring back the knowledge and share it with you, to help make your own property self-sustaining while building my business to be self-sustaining.

If what I've said doesn't sound like a good fit for you, but you know someone who might be interested, please pass this video along to them.  Thank you for listening and for helping to make a better world possible for all of us.

story:
Our Story

We are a group of believers. We believe in the importance of nature, the challenges we have to face, the vast range of possibilities we have to make choices, our ability to make the right choices and do good for ourselves and for our planet. We believe that we can change the world and save the planet even if only with a first step...

One of the things we are most passionate about are bicycles! Therefore we decided to start a project which would help people recognize all the positive effects of cycling while encouraging them to commit to support bicycle mobility.

The international team of initiators is made up of SportKreativWerkstatt GmbH, the European Cyclists' Federation, AZIMUT, ispo Munich and forum Nachhaltig Wirtschaften (media partner). 

All of us know believers who want to make a positive change in our world. We want to unite these people and join their power to maximize the global effect and strengthen bicycle mobility worldwide!

Together we stated our basic reasoning and our objectives in a communique titled "Cycling is Sustainability". In order to reach maximum effect with it, we plan to bring it to the UN Earth Summit Rio+20 in June 2012 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to attract the attention of heads of state, politicians and other important decision-makers.

 

Our Vision: A future in which the potential of cycling to foster sustainable development has been recognized and measures implemented accordingly to achieve: clean air, free movement, healthy people, regional economies, democracy in mobility, balanced global development.


The Impact

Our message to the world: Fostering bicycle traffic means forstering sustainable development! We want to raise awareness to the potential of cycling for sustainable development. What is the best place to do so? A place in which important decision-makers and influencial people come together: The UN Earth Summit Rio+20 in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. We  plan to bring our communiquÃ© "Cycling is Sustainability" to Rio together with the list of international supporters for our cause and seek commitment and active dedication to strengthen bicycle mobility by putting it on the political agenda.

In order to achieve maximum effect we organize a global action day on June 17th, where our partners and supporters are going to have bicycle related events worldwide. Together we want to show the already existing global support for cycling during our action day while at the same time encouraging more active commitment.


Our Mission: With this initiative we want to support a successful Earth Summit, seek broad commitment, achieve maximum impact and high visibility while delivering a meaningful message to the world.


What We Need & What You Get

No matter how much money we can raise for this initative we will be present in Rio de Janeiro from June 20th till 22nd and try to present our communiquÃ© "Cycling is Sustainability" with the maximum impact possible!

The more financial support we have the better and bigger we can go. We plan to organize a public event in Rio, and different bicycle related events worldwide on our global action day on June 17th. Therefore we need support: time, committment and money. We plan to support our international partners (people and NGOs organizing the bicycle events) to the best of our abilities, even on a financial level. So if you want to make sure that events will be organized in your region/country help by making a donation! 


The ammount of money we are trying to collect has a symbolic character: 25.046$ which is the earth's circumference in miles. Join the ride and help to strengthen bicycle mobility in order to foster sustainable development!

 

Our Action: we want to raise awareness to the importance of fostering bicycle traffic! Therefore we aim to spread this message and our basic reasoning behind it through our communiquÃ© "Cycling is Sustainability". You can support it by signing it online and by telling people you know about it.


As a special perk and little thank you we would like to have you directely involved and receive your personal postcard greeting from Rio!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can support us and our campaign in many different ways:


  • donate money at indiegogo
  • like us on Facebook
  • support our ideas by signing our communiquÃ© "Cycling is Sustainability" on our homepage:        www.global-ride-to-rio.org
  • tell your friends about us and help spread our message: Fostering bicycle mobility means fostering sustainable development!
  • join our global action day June 17th, 2012 and organize bicycle related events in your city
  • and CYCLE!

story:
We’re Verde Urbano, a entrepreneurship initiative that proposes attitude changes and environmental awareness in the citizens and works to generate alternatives to understand how people can interact and grow the city in harmony with nature.

We want to transform the cities into green cities and we’ve decided to use the walls as our main resource.

The plan is to transform the unused walls into useful walls, transforming them into interaction spaces with citizens, stimulating environmental awareness and generating green positive impact in the city with the delivery of plants.

With your donations we will build five green walls and bring them life. With these walls we will be able to deliver a message to generate environmental awareness to 500 people. Also, we will make replica manuals so you can take the project anywhere in the world, generating a global citizen network with people who care about the environment.


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET:

  • Our goal is to achieve $8.500, money that will be used to make five green walls. Each of the walls costs $800, including a free plant delivery to citizens who want to interact with the initiative.

  • $2.000 will be used in the design, execution and distribution of replica manuals, so the initiative can be replicated anywhere in the world, making the urban green network of stakeholders, grow.

  • $400 will be used for the webpage (Hosting, design, codes)

  • $700 will be used for working, administrative expenses and contingencies of the project.

The rest of the money will be designated to our rewards delivery and to generating more projects made by Verde Urbano Colombia team so that we can keep impacting environmental issues in cities.

If we don’t get completely funded, we will do the green walls in proportion to the amount of money we get.


THE IMPACT

Building more walls that are part of buildings, parking lots, shopping malls, subway stations and other places is inevitable for a city, and this activity generates about 50% of air pollution in urban areas and we know the city growth won't stop.

Verde Urbano has decided to find alternatives and different ways to offset pollution caused by cities and we saw a lot of unused built areas in the streets, parks or bridges that we call ‘’useless walls’’; we believe this is the opportunity to stop looking forward and to look up, where the walls can have life.

The plan is to transform a ‘’useless wall’’ into a useful space, transforming it into a green wall through co-created and collective action, generating environmental awareness in citizen, offsetting pollution for each plant funded and also creating a global network of stakeholders.

The walls we want to change are in Medellín, Colombia. In our country there are no seasons because of the geographical location and this allows the plant to grow all year round and the weather won’t alter the wellbeing of a plant.

The green wall will have a question mark shape; this is a expectative strategy for citizens with the catchword: IF THE WALLS COULD TALK? For this, each plant will have a message from its backer with an idea, thought or thank you note speaking about some environmental issue. This message will be received by the citizen who decided to take out the plant and plant it somewhere.

This is where If the walls could talk? becomes an experience not only to the citizen but also for the backer, because the wall won't just simply be a wall becoming a useful wall, but a wall with life and ideas from and for the people.

In Verde Urbano we believe its important to find different ways to evolve with the city, find alternatives to have more healthy cities, work towards environmentally sustainability and have every wall be used as a contribution to grow with the city, the citizen and the nature.

SOME OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

1.- If you like the project, help us promoting it through social media networks. We want to have a stakeholders network who want to support, back it and replicate this idea. You can use your own Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or even your blog with the hashtag #YSiLasParedesHablaran or #IfWallsCouldTalk; this will help us to know how much people is getting involved into the project.

2.- If you are in Medellín, you can be part of this iniciative with the donation of plants to make more green walls, remember the more plants we get, the more impact we can generate on people and the environment in the city.

3.- Once again, if you are in Medellin and you want this iniciative to take life in your school, university, building or neighborhood you can contact us and we could make your wall one of the chosen to green the city. You just have to give us the wall or the space and your time if you want to make the wall with us.


Lets make more useful walls, green and with stories to tell.
Lets make the walls talk!
Support the iniciative in your media making the hashtag and follow us:


Thank You!

Verde Urbano Team

(Daniela, Gabriela, Gustavo and Jorge) .

story:
The App lets you design your very own forest like if it was a simulation game. But this time it gets real.

It provides you with an interface to create your forestsand interact with them. 

You will be able to use it to check on your forest via satellite image and order extensions if you want to grow further.

It also calculates the carbon footprint of your daily activities and the CO2 that your forest captures, giving you the opportunity to become carbon neutral.

Notice you pay ONCE, and the forest is YOURS, so you can visit it.

Well, we have worked really hard to make it easy for you, so EVERY ONE of us can become environmental heroes without having to leave their towns or cities and go live in the wild! :)

There is lots of information on this very page, including specific details of the first forest, how the App will work or even our shared forest model.

It is your choice how much you know about how Reforestum works behind the scenes.

Of course you get a forest of a size according to your pledge.

Get t-shirts for our environmental heroes, guided visits to the forest with all our engineers, personalized commemorative plates and even a weekend in the natural park including a dinner with our team.

Our highest reward will allow you to choose the name of our next location.

We offer the exclusive opportunity to become a beta tester of the App and help us to improve it with your feedback.

Each forest is built by a community of members. Each member earns badges named after mythological heroes. By being an early member of Génesis you earn an additional badge, you will become a "forest founder". So you are getting 2 badges. The later, can be only earned during this campaign (And the previous one in Kickstarter).

Average car (per year): 5.1 tones; A year of emails: 135 kg; New York to London (per person): 610 kg; New York to LA (per person): 438 kg; Ironing a shirt (per year): 7.8 kg; Watching 28" TV per year: 140 kg; A year of toilet roll: 75 kg; Laundry (yearly): 440 kg; Year of cellphone calls (1 hr per day): 1,250 kg; To make a laptop 200 kg; A year of coffee: 210 kg; average world citizen (yearly): 7 tones.

We already lunched a Kickstarter campaign from the 15th of January to the 15th of February an we got 132% funded (41.130€). We were selling the first shares of the first forest, Génesis. Through it, we raised enough money to build the first phase of our App.  

Since then, we have received many messages from people asking us to become members. We still have more than half of Génesis surface available for you, so we decided to open a second campaign meanwhile we finish building the App. 

Through this campaign you can get the badge to become a founder member of Génesis. And we can collect enough money to build the second phase of the App (the native version for iOs and Android).

You can ask us anytime, we will be happy to answer your questions.

We have also built a website providing you a beta version of the App and more well presented information. It includes a FAQ's section (At the very end of this page).

Well, we have deforested so much land and released so much CO2 into the atmosphere that the amounts of carbon in it caused global warming. 

Even if all of us all of a sudden, would live using solar electricity, we still have to fix our atmosphere and cool down the planet. 

Watch this video if you want to know: A few cool things about forests; Our motivation to start the project; And why Reforestum is needed in the world.

 

 

There are three straightforward ways to create, own and manage a forest:

  • By a given surface area.
  • By a given budget.
  • By offsetting the carbon footprint of a given item such as a flight, driving a car, taking a taxi, using electricity, sending an email, etc.

Reforestum measures the carbon footprint of your daily activities, offering you the possibility to become carbon neutral by planning and developing your own forests.

You can manage, track, expand or even offer a forest as a gift. All using your computer, tablet or smartphone.

You can offset, one-off, any of your individual actions such as taking a flight, taking a taxi, driving your car or even your electric bill. We also provide a periodic subscription in order to reduce your carbon footprint on a monthly basis.   

There are a number of possibilities, for example, your communications, groceries, electricity, natural gas or petrol consumption. 

Share your forests with your family, friends and colleagues to help us bring about environmental awareness!

Even though we are an international team, we believed that it would be best to start at home, in Spain. We know the markets, the people, the climate, the land, the flora and fauna, the language and the local laws, which gives us a head start.

We have chosen a piece of land that occupies 4,6 hectares (11.36 acres). It is located close to the natural park of "Picos de Europa".The land has a 10% slope and has a beautiful gully. At the moment it is covered with shrubs and has about 15 oak trees in it that are about 15 years old.  

This is the first patch of forest that was stolen from the mountain and that we are going to reforest. Sorry for the bad quality of the take.

We will be preparing the land and starting to plant the trees in March 2017, planting will last about 3 weeks. We will plant 1.100 trees per hectare with native species: 50% pine trees, 30% oak trees, and 20% with a selection of native species. All of them using certified seedlings, which are genetically adapted to the region and therefore have a high rate of success (It also implies a smaller carbon footprint). 

Complete species list: Scots Pine (Pinus Sylvestris), Sessile Oak (Quercus Petraea), Pyrenean Oak (Quercus Pyrenaica), Cherry Tree (Prunus Avium), Rowan Tree (Sorbus Aucuparia), Largeleaf Linden (Tilia Plathyphyllos), Walnut Tree (Juglans), Downy Birch (Betula Alba), Common Hazel (Corylus Avellana), European Crab Apple (Malus Sylvestris), Common Whitebeam (Sorbus Aria), Common Hawthorn (Crataegus Monogyna), Narrow-Leafed Ash (Fraxinus Angustifolia)  

Reforestum is a global project, it concerns all of us. Therefore, next locations we will be looking at will be: the Amazon, South East Asia, Zambia and North America.

The raised funds will be used to build the digital platform that will support the project, connecting all our members (environmental heroes) with their forests and reunite them in the Reforestum community. 

The App will host many features such as our forest/carbon calculator (already available in beta version) or the monthly subscriptions system.  

We already have a beta version of the Web App working, you can visit it by clicking on the next image.

 

 

Nature has its own Rhythm and we can’t force it.  

Depending on climate, there are normally two windows in which we can plant trees: Before the spring. Only in places with an adequate amount of rain. Right at the beginning of autumn.  

Reforestum will plant its first forest before the spring of 2017. We’ll plant at least 1 to 4 hectares depending on the success of this crowdfunding campaign.  

At the end of the campaign, all backers will receive a code to sign up to our platform and start tracking their forest.

  

There are so many good reasons why someone would want to own a forest. You can buy a forest simply because you love nature, because you think more forests are needed in the world, because you think it is an amazing gift to offer, because you think is a great inheritance for your family or obviously because you want to help stop climate change.

Either way, whatever the reason, we will probably love it!

We would like to explain to you where our motivation came from to create Reforestum through a simple example.

Let’s say I buy a car for my family. During its estimated lifetime (approx. 10 years/300.000 kms) this car will expel 50 tons of CO2 into the atmosphere.

That’s quite a heavy carbon footprint for one car!

Quite the environmental disaster. The good news is that today that is fixable through Reforestum.

It suffices to plant 5 trees! They will grow and capture 50 tons (*) of CO2 in a few years. Your car will be carbon neutral. Problem solved, couldn’t be easier!

We live in a fast world and we can’t change that. The most of us can’t afford to grow our own food, build our own houses or fix our own cars, we delegate some of our duties to experts. Now you can also hand over your responsibility to us to help stop climate change.

And there are many more reasons why we think the world needs massive reforestation.

Here are a few: The trees that we will plant together will have the purpose of capturing CO2 and releasing oxygen, calling rain, fixing the soil, refilling and protecting the water table, reestablishing biodiversity, recovering ecosystems and ultimately regulating climate.

Reforestum forests are build on private land that is shared by all Reforestum members. There are a few reasons why we have chosen this model.

It’s priority is to ensure the forests protection and its well being.

Reforestum forests are created with the idea that the forests are natural sanctuaries that need to be protected, we are committed to safeguarding their longevity.

When a member purchases a share, a formal contract will be signed. The contract will be amended for subsequent forest extensions for the same location.

Member’s shares cannot be sold or transferred in order to avoid speculation and protect the forest’s best interest.

We believe that the idea of a hero has to be redefined in the 21st century.  

It is no longer about a single hero fighting in a battle like David and Goliath. But rather like thousands of Davids fighting for the same cause and with one goal in mind: Ensuring a safe and abundant future for the earth and it’s future generations.  

If we all stand together, as a horde of David's, with the same goal in mind, how could we not defeat Goliath?

How else could we reward you for your support of the project? Of course, all rewards will result in owning a forest.

So you can create your own forest today. Isn’t that awesome!

We have made a selection of the most badass heroes in mythology in order to designate our rewards. We value the effort that each one of our supporters have contributed to stop climate change through Reforestum.

 

Diego Sanz is the founder of Reforestum. Expert software engineer, he is extremely passionate about environment and sustainability. Permaculturist and yogui. He envisions a human world in balance with nature.

Michele Thomas is the voice of Reforestum. A phisiotherapist and equine osteopath, speaks four languages fluently. She is very aware about the deforestation issues that her home land, Zambia, is facing. We plan to open a forest location there very soon.

                                                                                                                                            

Juan Carlos Maldonado is an extremely experienced forestal engineer from Spain. He has already reforested more than 7.000 hectares in his 20 years of experience. He is also an expert in the area where we are creating Génesis, which he and his team will be developing this March.

Javier Porcar is a very talented forestal engineer. He shows great motivation and is really good with numbers and statistics. Javier is in charge of the carbon calculations, estimations and measurements of our forests.

Without Alice’s help and infinite generosity this campaign couldn’t have happened. She has the honor of owning the first shares in our first forest site: Génesis.  

MON is an extremely creative design studio located in Spain. It´s formed by Manu Salviejo and Marcos Abad. They`re responsible for the Reforestum logo and the awesome graphics in this Kickstarter campaign.

The fabulous Significa team, from Portugal, are responsible for the design and implementation of our website and future App.  

Rui Sereno is the new business head of Significa. If you have a design problem, better call Rui.  

Pedro Brandão is an excellent creative designer with great ideas, amazing attention to detail and fabulous taste.  

Frederico Jesus is the creator of the awesome animations in our campaign video. A great illustrator and animator.  

According to rigorous scientific studies published by NASA and WHO (Among many others), there is a 97% scientific consensus that climate change is real and is a threat to our survival. And all of us can already see its effects around us.

If you still have any doubt, we strongly encourage you to inform yourselves by watching Leonardo DiCaprio’s documentary “Before the Flood”. It has great value, as it helps us to understand what we are facing and that we must spread the word about the necessity to do something about it.

2016 has been a year of sad records. According to the W.M.O. (World Meteorological Organization) 2016 has been the hottest year in history since records began. The levels of CO2 in the atmosphere are the highest in history. We must act today! This is a call to action for all of us.

Just because it is theoretically possible to capture carbon and therefore in a way fix what we have broken. 

Reforestum is no way something to allow people to get comfortable and behave in an irresponsible and wasteful way.  

This project is a way to right the wrongs of the past and to try and correct our necessary daily actions. 

This project must not be an excuse for humankind to keep behaving in a destructive manner. We must stop extracting and burning fossil fuels and we must stop using nuclear power to assure the continuity of life -as we know it- on this planet.  

We have so much to fix, let's start somewhere! As we all know, trees take time to grow in order to be able their amazing and tireless work.

Technology is powerful and the more we progress and innovate, the more powerful we get as a species. That power has put as in a dangerous place because we require lots of energy and we haven’t manage so far to extract that energy in a clean way.

However we strongly believe that the solution is not to stop using technology but learning to use it in a mot efficient and responsible way. To use technology and not to be used by technology.

Let’s put technology in our side, let’s use it to create, to come closer to each other and to come more connected to nature. Let’s use the power we have to reforest the world.

 (*) Estimated average values. May vary depends on many local variables and conditions.

 

Risks and challenges

The building of the web application is guaranteed by the founder of Reforestum. Diego Sanz is a software engineer with 13 years of experience building and managing Web Applications for international companies such as banks, telecommunication companies and the European Commission.

In terms of the creation of our forests; We know that when working with nature you need to take into consideration many variables and there is always going to be some uncertainty, and there are some risks involved. We are proud to have amongst our team members an extremely experienced and successful Forestal Engineer. We are choosing to plant our very first forest in a safe location where the soil is of good quality and the rain is guaranteed in order to minimise possible risks. 
Our forest designs focus on maximizing longevity, biodiversity and obviously the amount of captured carbon.

We have, of course, developed a solid legal policy to safeguard our members and their forests.

 

FAQs

Yes, definitely, very real. Check out the whole campaign description and go to our website for additional information.

We have 2 forest engineers in our team. Also, a whole team of workers works for them in the area. Following our low carbon agenda, we hire local! Check out our team section to know more about our engineers.

When deciding the strategy to follow, we have to take into consideration a few factors:

- The most important good, above the private interest of any member, are the forests and to assure its well being and longevity. Remember that Reforestum aims to act collectively to solve a global problem. Each member matters as much as the community and the common good does. 
- We must to be able to extend the share of any member without any kind of "collision" and with maximum flexibility. 
- In order to avoid that any member could claim control over a sector, or even the whole forest, there will be limitations on the percentage that a member might own.

After establishing this conditions, there is only one strategy that is able to meet the given requirements:

The total surface of each forest is divided in sectors of around (*) 1.000 square meters. 
When you purchase a forest, a percentage of that sector is assigned to you. 
When you extend your forest, that percentage will be enlarged. 
You can own a maximum of 80% of a sector. Then you might own shares in different sectors.

NOTE: Depending on the forest, each sector will have more or less trees.. In Génesis, by average, there will be 100 trees in a sector.

This strategy allows us the accomplish several things: 
- Independently of your purchasing power, you can become an environmental hero because you will be the co-owner of (at least) one sector. 
- Therefore, no matter how many shares you hold, you can walk around the forest. And more specifically within your sector, with a feeling of fulfillment and joy knowing you helped plant all those trees and you co-own them.

Reforestum aims that anyone, no matter its budget, no matter if you came from a rich country or not, you can become an environmental hero. So if a kid of 15 years old in Congo wants to owe 0,2 square meters, he/she can do it. And he/she can go and visit (now or in 30 years) that sector of the forest; And very proudly say: "I owe this forest, a part of this forest is mine and I am making a difference. I am helping the planet". As you see, Reforestum is about the power of little actions, even though, some people will have the will and the potential to owe bigger pieces of forest. All of us matter.

* It might vary depending on specific characteristics of the land, mainly slope and the shape of its contour.

We aim to offer you a service in which you can delegate in experts. Each climate, soil and region has specific and unique characteristics. A forest must behave as a whole system. So we can say that for this specific moment and forest, the members will not be able to choose species. Please have a look to the corresponding section in our KS page where we provide the whole list of species we are going to plant.

In the future, when we have more available locations, we will offer you a wider spectrum of options, then you will be able to choose several forest in different countries with a wide catalog of species, and you will be able to diversify your forests.

Further than that we will implement a service in which we can assist you to design a forest, including many parameters, such as species. However such service needs to be developed and it will imply that the final cost of purchasing a forest will be noticeably more expensive. As a tree, we need to grow strong before facing that phase.

Yes, There will be a public list.

This is a way to be transparent and guarantee the members unique ownership of the forests.

Of course, each member will decided its level of privacy.

Meanwhile some members might choose to show their names and profile pictures, others might choose to show an avatar and nickname; And others may want to be completely anonymous, in which case only a code will be shown.

Our forest engineers have established a schedule to take car of the forest along the time.

The first 25 years of maintenance and taxes over the land, is included in the price per sqm that your are pledging in the campaign.

As you might know, the members acquire an agreement with Reforestum for the ownership of the forest that have no limitation in time.

As you might also know, our members pay only once for their forest, so, what happens after 25 years?

We are designing the forests to be self sustainable, as any natural forest is. However, our governments, as opposed to nature, decided to charge us taxes.

So, how is the maintenance (Including taxes) is going to be afforded after that period of time?

Well, the forest will produce a yield. We are going to plant many nut trees, getting agreements with local farmers to harvest honey, and getting agreements with local hall towns.

However, no one on earth can say with 100% of certainty how the markets or the taxes will be 25 in advance. Therefore, we have a plan B. In the remote case non of the former possibilities happen to be enough, we will cut down as many trees are needed. We plan that cutting 1 to 3 trees in one hectare, and selling the timber, will be more than enough to keep all running for, at least, 10 years more.

Last question, what happens if the forest produces more yield than the cost is?

We will share the profit with the members in a form of credits that they will be able to use to extend their forests.
story_txt:
The App lets you design your very own forest like if it was a simulation game. But this time it gets real.It provides you with an interface to create your forestsand interact with them. You will be able to use it to check on your forest via satellite image and order extensions if you want to grow further.It also calculates the carbon footprint of your daily activities and the CO2 that your forest captures, giving you the opportunity to become carbon neutral.Notice you pay ONCE, and the forest is YOURS, so you can visit it.Well, we have worked really hard to make it easy for you, so EVERY ONE of us can become environmental heroes without having to leave their towns or cities and go live in the wild! :)There is lots of information on this very page, including specific details of the first forest, how the App will work or even our shared forest model.It is your choice how much you know about how Reforestum works behind the scenes.Of course you get a forest of a size according to your pledge.Get t-shirts for our environmental heroes, guided visits to the forest with all our engineers, personalized commemorative plates and even a weekend in the natural park including a dinner with our team.Our highest reward will allow you to choose the name of our next location.We offer the exclusive opportunity to become a beta tester of the App and help us to improve it with your feedback.Each forest is built by a community of members. Each member earns badges named after mythological heroes. By being an early member of Génesis you earn an additional badge, you will become a "forest founder". So you are getting 2 badges. The later, can be only earned during this campaign (And the previous one in Kickstarter).Average car (per year): 5.1 tones; A year of emails: 135 kg; New York to London (per person): 610 kg; New York to LA (per person): 438 kg; Ironing a shirt (per year): 7.8 kg; Watching 28" TV per year: 140 kg; A year of toilet roll: 75 kg; Laundry (yearly): 440 kg; Year of cellphone calls (1 hr per day): 1,250 kg; To make a laptop 200 kg; A year of coffee: 210 kg; average world citizen (yearly): 7 tones.We already lunched a Kickstarter campaign from the 15th of January to the 15th of February an we got 132% funded (41.130€). We were selling the first shares of the first forest, Génesis. Through it, we raised enough money to build the first phase of our App.  Since then, we have received many messages from people asking us to become members. We still have more than half of Génesis surface available for you, so we decided to open a second campaign meanwhile we finish building the App. Through this campaign you can get the badge to become a founder member of Génesis. And we can collect enough money to build the second phase of the App (the native version for iOs and Android).You can ask us anytime, we will be happy to answer your questions.We have also built a website providing you a beta version of the App and more well presented information. It includes a FAQ's section (At the very end of this page).Well, we have deforested so much land and released so much CO2 into the atmosphere that the amounts of carbon in it caused global warming. Even if all of us all of a sudden, would live using solar electricity, we still have to fix our atmosphere and cool down the planet. Watch this video if you want to know: A few cool things about forests; Our motivation to start the project; And why Reforestum is needed in the world.  There are three straightforward ways to create, own and manage a forest:
By a given surface area.
By a given budget.
By offsetting the carbon footprint of a given item such as a flight, driving a car, taking a taxi, using electricity, sending an email, etc.
Reforestum measures the carbon footprint of your daily activities, offering you the possibility to become carbon neutral by planning and developing your own forests.You can manage, track, expand or even offer a forest as a gift. All using your computer, tablet or smartphone.You can offset, one-off, any of your individual actions such as taking a flight, taking a taxi, driving your car or even your electric bill. We also provide a periodic subscription in order to reduce your carbon footprint on a monthly basis.   There are a number of possibilities, for example, your communications, groceries, electricity, natural gas or petrol consumption. Share your forests with your family, friends and colleagues to help us bring about environmental awareness!Even though we are an international team, we believed that it would be best to start at home, in Spain. We know the markets, the people, the climate, the land, the flora and fauna, the language and the local laws, which gives us a head start.We have chosen a piece of land that occupies 4,6 hectares (11.36 acres). It is located close to the natural park of "Picos de Europa".The land has a 10% slope and has a beautiful gully. At the moment it is covered with shrubs and has about 15 oak trees in it that are about 15 years old.  This is the first patch of forest that was stolen from the mountain and that we are going to reforest. Sorry for the bad quality of the take.We will be preparing the land and starting to plant the trees in March 2017, planting will last about 3 weeks. We will plant 1.100 trees per hectare with native species: 50% pine trees, 30% oak trees, and 20% with a selection of native species. All of them using certified seedlings, which are genetically adapted to the region and therefore have a high rate of success (It also implies a smaller carbon footprint). Complete species list: Scots Pine (Pinus Sylvestris), Sessile Oak (Quercus Petraea), Pyrenean Oak (Quercus Pyrenaica), Cherry Tree (Prunus Avium), Rowan Tree (Sorbus Aucuparia), Largeleaf Linden (Tilia Plathyphyllos), Walnut Tree (Juglans), Downy Birch (Betula Alba), Common Hazel (Corylus Avellana), European Crab Apple (Malus Sylvestris), Common Whitebeam (Sorbus Aria), Common Hawthorn (Crataegus Monogyna), Narrow-Leafed Ash (Fraxinus Angustifolia)  Reforestum is a global project, it concerns all of us. Therefore, next locations we will be looking at will be: the Amazon, South East Asia, Zambia and North America.The raised funds will be used to build the digital platform that will support the project, connecting all our members (environmental heroes) with their forests and reunite them in the Reforestum community. The App will host many features such as our forest/carbon calculator (already available in beta version) or the monthly subscriptions system.  We already have a beta version of the Web App working, you can visit it by clicking on the next image.  Nature has its own Rhythm and we can’t force it.  Depending on climate, there are normally two windows in which we can plant trees: Before the spring. Only in places with an adequate amount of rain. Right at the beginning of autumn.  Reforestum will plant its first forest before the spring of 2017. We’ll plant at least 1 to 4 hectares depending on the success of this crowdfunding campaign.  At the end of the campaign, all backers will receive a code to sign up to our platform and start tracking their forest.  There are so many good reasons why someone would want to own a forest. You can buy a forest simply because you love nature, because you think more forests are needed in the world, because you think it is an amazing gift to offer, because you think is a great inheritance for your family or obviously because you want to help stop climate change.Either way, whatever the reason, we will probably love it!We would like to explain to you where our motivation came from to create Reforestum through a simple example.Let’s say I buy a car for my family. During its estimated lifetime (approx. 10 years/300.000 kms) this car will expel 50 tons of CO2 into the atmosphere.That’s quite a heavy carbon footprint for one car!Quite the environmental disaster. The good news is that today that is fixable through Reforestum.It suffices to plant 5 trees! They will grow and capture 50 tons (*) of CO2 in a few years. Your car will be carbon neutral. Problem solved, couldn’t be easier!We live in a fast world and we can’t change that. The most of us can’t afford to grow our own food, build our own houses or fix our own cars, we delegate some of our duties to experts. Now you can also hand over your responsibility to us to help stop climate change.And there are many more reasons why we think the world needs massive reforestation.Here are a few: The trees that we will plant together will have the purpose of capturing CO2 and releasing oxygen, calling rain, fixing the soil, refilling and protecting the water table, reestablishing biodiversity, recovering ecosystems and ultimately regulating climate.Reforestum forests are build on private land that is shared by all Reforestum members. There are a few reasons why we have chosen this model.It’s priority is to ensure the forests protection and its well being.Reforestum forests are created with the idea that the forests are natural sanctuaries that need to be protected, we are committed to safeguarding their longevity.When a member purchases a share, a formal contract will be signed. The contract will be amended for subsequent forest extensions for the same location.Member’s shares cannot be sold or transferred in order to avoid speculation and protect the forest’s best interest.We believe that the idea of a hero has to be redefined in the 21st century.  It is no longer about a single hero fighting in a battle like David and Goliath. But rather like thousands of Davids fighting for the same cause and with one goal in mind: Ensuring a safe and abundant future for the earth and it’s future generations.  If we all stand together, as a horde of David's, with the same goal in mind, how could we not defeat Goliath?How else could we reward you for your support of the project? Of course, all rewards will result in owning a forest.So you can create your own forest today. Isn’t that awesome!We have made a selection of the most badass heroes in mythology in order to designate our rewards. We value the effort that each one of our supporters have contributed to stop climate change through Reforestum. Diego Sanz is the founder of Reforestum. Expert software engineer, he is extremely passionate about environment and sustainability. Permaculturist and yogui. He envisions a human world in balance with nature.Michele Thomas is the voice of Reforestum. A phisiotherapist and equine osteopath, speaks four languages fluently. She is very aware about the deforestation issues that her home land, Zambia, is facing. We plan to open a forest location there very soon.                                                                                                                                            Juan Carlos Maldonado is an extremely experienced forestal engineer from Spain. He has already reforested more than 7.000 hectares in his 20 years of experience. He is also an expert in the area where we are creating Génesis, which he and his team will be developing this March.Javier Porcar is a very talented forestal engineer. He shows great motivation and is really good with numbers and statistics. Javier is in charge of the carbon calculations, estimations and measurements of our forests.Without Alice’s help and infinite generosity this campaign couldn’t have happened. She has the honor of owning the first shares in our first forest site: Génesis.  MON is an extremely creative design studio located in Spain. It´s formed by Manu Salviejo and Marcos Abad. They`re responsible for the Reforestum logo and the awesome graphics in this Kickstarter campaign.The fabulous Significa team, from Portugal, are responsible for the design and implementation of our website and future App.  Rui Sereno is the new business head of Significa. If you have a design problem, better call Rui.  Pedro Brandão is an excellent creative designer with great ideas, amazing attention to detail and fabulous taste.  Frederico Jesus is the creator of the awesome animations in our campaign video. A great illustrator and animator.  According to rigorous scientific studies published by NASA and WHO (Among many others), there is a 97% scientific consensus that climate change is real and is a threat to our survival. And all of us can already see its effects around us.If you still have any doubt, we strongly encourage you to inform yourselves by watching Leonardo DiCaprio’s documentary “Before the Flood”. It has great value, as it helps us to understand what we are facing and that we must spread the word about the necessity to do something about it.2016 has been a year of sad records. According to the W.M.O. (World Meteorological Organization) 2016 has been the hottest year in history since records began. The levels of CO2 in the atmosphere are the highest in history. We must act today! This is a call to action for all of us.Just because it is theoretically possible to capture carbon and therefore in a way fix what we have broken. Reforestum is no way something to allow people to get comfortable and behave in an irresponsible and wasteful way.  This project is a way to right the wrongs of the past and to try and correct our necessary daily actions. This project must not be an excuse for humankind to keep behaving in a destructive manner. We must stop extracting and burning fossil fuels and we must stop using nuclear power to assure the continuity of life -as we know it- on this planet.  We have so much to fix, let's start somewhere! As we all know, trees take time to grow in order to be able their amazing and tireless work.Technology is powerful and the more we progress and innovate, the more powerful we get as a species. That power has put as in a dangerous place because we require lots of energy and we haven’t manage so far to extract that energy in a clean way.However we strongly believe that the solution is not to stop using technology but learning to use it in a mot efficient and responsible way. To use technology and not to be used by technology.Let’s put technology in our side, let’s use it to create, to come closer to each other and to come more connected to nature. Let’s use the power we have to reforest the world. (*) Estimated average values. May vary depends on many local variables and conditions. Risks and challengesThe building of the web application is guaranteed by the founder of Reforestum. Diego Sanz is a software engineer with 13 years of experience building and managing Web Applications for international companies such as banks, telecommunication companies and the European Commission.In terms of the creation of our forests; We know that when working with nature you need to take into consideration many variables and there is always going to be some uncertainty, and there are some risks involved. We are proud to have amongst our team members an extremely experienced and successful Forestal Engineer. We are choosing to plant our very first forest in a safe location where the soil is of good quality and the rain is guaranteed in order to minimise possible risks. Our forest designs focus on maximizing longevity, biodiversity and obviously the amount of captured carbon.We have, of course, developed a solid legal policy to safeguard our members and their forests. FAQsYes, definitely, very real. Check out the whole campaign description and go to our website for additional information.We have 2 forest engineers in our team. Also, a whole team of workers works for them in the area. Following our low carbon agenda, we hire local! Check out our team section to know more about our engineers.When deciding the strategy to follow, we have to take into consideration a few factors:- The most important good, above the private interest of any member, are the forests and to assure its well being and longevity. Remember that Reforestum aims to act collectively to solve a global problem. Each member matters as much as the community and the common good does. - We must to be able to extend the share of any member without any kind of "collision" and with maximum flexibility. - In order to avoid that any member could claim control over a sector, or even the whole forest, there will be limitations on the percentage that a member might own.After establishing this conditions, there is only one strategy that is able to meet the given requirements:The total surface of each forest is divided in sectors of around (*) 1.000 square meters. When you purchase a forest, a percentage of that sector is assigned to you. When you extend your forest, that percentage will be enlarged. You can own a maximum of 80% of a sector. Then you might own shares in different sectors.NOTE: Depending on the forest, each sector will have more or less trees.. In Génesis, by average, there will be 100 trees in a sector.This strategy allows us the accomplish several things: - Independently of your purchasing power, you can become an environmental hero because you will be the co-owner of (at least) one sector. - Therefore, no matter how many shares you hold, you can walk around the forest. And more specifically within your sector, with a feeling of fulfillment and joy knowing you helped plant all those trees and you co-own them.Reforestum aims that anyone, no matter its budget, no matter if you came from a rich country or not, you can become an environmental hero. So if a kid of 15 years old in Congo wants to owe 0,2 square meters, he/she can do it. And he/she can go and visit (now or in 30 years) that sector of the forest; And very proudly say: "I owe this forest, a part of this forest is mine and I am making a difference. I am helping the planet". As you see, Reforestum is about the power of little actions, even though, some people will have the will and the potential to owe bigger pieces of forest. All of us matter.* It might vary depending on specific characteristics of the land, mainly slope and the shape of its contour.We aim to offer you a service in which you can delegate in experts. So we can say that for this specific moment and forest, the members will not be able to choose species. Please have a look to the corresponding section in our KS page where we provide the whole list of species we are going to plant.In the future, when we have more available locations, we will offer you a wider spectrum of options, then you will be able to choose several forest in different countries with a wide catalog of species, and you will be able to diversify your forests.Further than that we will implement a service in which we can assist you to design a forest, including many parameters, such as species. story:
Want to say "hi"? Reach out to Energant by using this contact form.



K2 by Energant


We are a passionate team of students and engineers at the University of California, Berkeley who have engineered one of the first low-cost cook stoves in the world that can convert heat into electricity, with an added bonus of utilizing crop or household waste. Our cook stove will address problems in developing countries related to smoke-induced illness, a global killer accounting for more deaths than HIV and malaria COMBINED, environmental degradation, and a lack of electricity.


  • Grand Prize Winner and People's Choice Award - ENvision at UC Berkeley 2013
  • Clinton Global Initiative University Commitment Maker - 2014
  • Social Venture Competition Winner - The Resolution Project 2014
  • Honorable Mention - Big Ideas@Berkeley 2014
  • Finalist at the Innovation Marketplace at TechCon 2014 (hosted by USAID and UC Berkeley’s Development Impact Lab)

K2 is an updated version of KleanCook that will make an even greater contribution and impact. Here is our story.

Our Story

A few months ago we ran a pilot study with our first generation stove (KleanCook) in the Philippines and were met with huge appreciation and acceptance. Our cook stove worked, and people loved it.


During that time we realized that almost everyone we’ve seen used trash in their cooking fires. We later learned that this is a prevalent practice in many other developing countries. Trash, including plastics, was everywhere and burned well.

Unfortunately, the reality is that people will always be burning their trash for heating and cooking in many parts of the world, whether for cultural or traditional reasons. We are approaching the global waste problem by letting users know that, hey, trash isn’t the best, but we have something that can burn it cleanly for you.

The Global Issue

We’ve seen many parts of the world that have made us very grateful for what we have. We have come together to engineer solutions to world problems and are asking for your help. We can't do this alone and want to give you the chance to know you’ve helped to make change happen. Addressing the needs of people in developing countries is challenging, yet so rewarding to both the giver and receiver. We want to spread that magic to you.

Any questions? Reach out to Energant by using this contact form.

Great idea, but how does this all work again?

The technology and mechanics behind K2:



We can't do this alone!

With your help, we will be able to distribute K2 and test it with families.  Your contribution will also allow us to purchase equipment and materials for running additional pilot studies as well as improve the design even more so that it can be as user friendly as possible.  We are an early stage company and are asking for your help to get us off the ground.  


For all of you who support us, we love you and are so grateful for your time and consideration! We want to show you our appreciation with our various perks:

You can reach out to Energant by using this contact form.

The Impact

Your contribution helps these people who are, essentially, people. They’re like you and me - they have aspirations, they have people they love, and they have a drive to take care of those they love. They need to keep healthy and have the ability to give their loved ones the best living situation they can - whether it’s an education, clean water, or nutritious food. However, with the environment they grew up in, it’s not entirely possible. 

K2 goes beyond its pure function and direct benefit. Besides bringing electricity, cleaner air, and a cleaner environment, your contribution has long-standing and far-reaching impact.


Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contributions are only one way to give your support. Don’t worry if you can’t help out financially. We appreciate that you’ve even checked out our page!

You can actually make a huge contribution doing a couple of simple things:

  • Recommend us to your friends or family.
  • Have a social media shout-out.
  • Recommend to us some resources we could check out.
Thank you so much again for checking out our page! If you have any questions or feedback, please reach out to us by using this contact form.
