*** Cliquez ICI pour la version en français de la vidéo et du texte ***


We are developing an affordable home heating and cooling system that uses only renewable energy sources and achieves amazing cost savings.


WHY YOU SHOULD CARE

The cost of heating and cooling is increasing much faster than inflation for both electric based heating/cooling and fossil fuel based heating such as with natural gas. For instance, in Ontario, the cost to heat and cool our homes with electricity has been increasing by 12-15% each year in the last few years. This trend is expected to continue for the foreseeable future. Natural gas had a few good years recently but increased dramatically in April 2014 for residents of Ontario (+40%) and is also expected to continue increasing faster than inflation.

The longer we use sources of energy that are not sustainable, the more we will pay for it personally (to heat and cool our homes) and environmentally with global warming’s devastating effects.

We need to do something about it today, while we can still make a difference.


THE PROBLEM

There are no affordable green options for home owners living in locations where the temperature reaches below 0 degree Celsius.


THE SOLUTION

After two and half years of research & development, we are proud to have developed an innovative heating and cooling system that can reduce the cost to heat and cool a home by up to 80% (depending on various parameters like the location, orientation, etc.). The best part is that our system is truly affordable for all home owners since:

  • There are no upfront costs
  • The monthly savings are higher than the monthly cost for our system
  • Savings start from day 1 (no more waiting for a payback then savings)

 

THE SYSTEM

Our system uses gravel to increase the efficiency of a heat pump, which looks like an Air Conditioning unit but can both heat and cool your home. Thanks to the gravel, the heat pump can work all year round, even in climates where the temperature dips below zero degrees Celsius. Gravel is a great storage medium with excellent heat retention properties. It is durable, widely available, and has a low cost. The gravel reservoir is preferable installed under the foundations during construction, and thus does not reduce available space such as a basement.

Here is how the system works:

During the winter cycle (see below), gravel air is heated during the day as is passes through solar air heating panels.


The warm air is blown into the gravel and is used as needed. At night (or during the day), when the inside temperature starts to fall, the heat pump is activated as needed to transfer the stored heat from the gravel to the house. This warms up the house, and cools down the gravel. The cycle starts over the next day.


During the summer cycle (see below), fresh outside air is blown into the gravel at night, cooling it down; during the day the heat pump is activated as needed and uses the cooled gravel, making the heat pump run more efficiently. This cools the house, and warms up the gravel. The cycle starts over the next night.



Our system also offers lots of other benefits. For more information about it you can visit our website at www.thermasolaris.com and/or contact us atfounders@thermasolaris.com


WHY WE ARE CROWDFUNDING

After our successful simulations and physical lab testing done last year at the Brunsfield Centre, University of Ottawa (see picture below), we are now at a critical stage where we need your financial support to build, test, and have 3rd party validation of a small scale prototype.


In the past 6 months, we’ve found a location for our Small Scale Prototype, established academic partners in Ottawa (Carleton University and La Cité) and have found sources of financing to take care of about $66,000 of the funds needed for this $76,000 project. We are seeking your help to raise the remaining $11,000 (including Indiegogo fees) needed to ensure this project is a success.


WHAT WE PLAN TO DO WITH THE MONEY

Our plan after crowdfunding is to build and test the small scale prototype. Then, once we are satisfied with the results, we plan to raise capital from strategic partners or Angel Investors in order to grow the business at a faster pace. Our goal is to start selling our system by the end of 2015.

Your contributions will be used to pay for the two heating and cooling systems that will be installed in the two small structures that will be built at La Cité.

If we are left with some excess cash at the end of this project, it will go towards funding the full scale prototype we have already secured for the spring of 2015 (more information in the next section).

Below is the budget and planned schedule for this project:



OUR STRETCH GOALS

Stretch goal #1: with $46k ($11k + $35k) we will leverage the money with a government program (1:1 match) to fund the full scale prototype that we have already secured for the spring of 2015. The full scale prototype unit will be installed in a model home in Ottawa, Ontario, and be open for visits from the public.

Stretch goal #2: with $126k we will develop one add-on to enhance our system (more information will be available if we reach the $46,000 stretch goal…)


ABOUT US

Therma Solaris is an Ottawa (Ontario) based start-up co-founded by Nicolas de Bony (CEO), Patrick Trahan (COO), and Charles Trahan (CTO) in October 2011.



FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

*** We will add the most frequent questions we receive in this section ***

  • I would like to contribute but can’t or don’t want to do it online. Is there another option? There are many other options, such as cash and checks for people in the Ottawa-Gatineau area. Contact us: www.thermasolaris.com/contact-us/

  • Where can I find more information about Therma Solaris and the product you are developing? You can find more information about us at www.thermasolaris.com/about-us/ , and about the product at www.thermasolaris.com/our-product/

  • What is the best way to contact you if I have any questions? There are many ways to reach us (online form, e-mail, and social media) which you can find at www.thermasolaris.com/contact-us/

  • What will happen if you do not reach your goal? We have organized everything so for this project to be a success for us and our partners. Therefore we have chosen the flexible funding option since we can still use the money donated and can find the remaining portion of funding somewhere else (including more costly financing options such as taking a loan).


CLOSING REMARKS

We would like to thank you in advance for contributing to the success of this project, for supporting us and what we stand for, and for validating that there is a market for these types of innovative heating and cooling systems.

Please share this campaign with your friends, family, colleagues, and networks to help us raise enough for this project to be a success.

Here are the links to our social media and website:

- Website: www.thermasolaris.com

- Twitter (@ThermaSolaris): https://twitter.com/ThermaSolaris

- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Therma-Solaris/396747780454787

- LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/therma-solaris

- Google+: https://plus.google.com/101331905048865605162/posts

story:
Can you imagine coming home to your house and all of your belongings destroyed by a fire? Losing your pets in the meantime? Or even having to escape the dangers of fire by jumping out your second story window?

Four families are dealing with the aftermath of this very situation. A tragic fire destroyed a 4-unit home in East Aurora, NY on Thurs., Feb. 6, 2014. Although everyone was safe (with exception to a second story tenant that had to jump to safety), they lost all of their belongings and a few beloved pets.

Please put yourself in their shoes and imagine the fear, sadness and shock that you would now be facing. In the true Buffalo Neighborly spirit… any little bit contributed will be an immense help for these four families. We will split the total earnings in four, so each can have a little something to get back on their feet with.

If you’re unable to help monetarily, please consider sharing this with your friends/family/etc. that may be interested in contributing.

Thank you so much!

Buffalo News coverage

East Aurora Advertiser coverage

story:
CCH Global Consulting projects will have real world impacts.

Super Storm Sandy clean ups, to get families back into their homes lost during Sandy.

Dolphins and Manatees saved from pollution created algae blooms, all over Florida.

Providing clean water! From Alaska and Canada to all over the world. Saving human lives by providing clean water solutions to small villages where children die every day due to a lack of clean drinking water.

Providing clean water here at home. Removal of harmful Nitrates and Nitrates from fertilizers that have found there way into our water supplies.

Cleaning up hazardous situations, such as the Deep Water Horizon oil spill, West Virginia river contamination, to wastewater treatment issues.

These are just a few of the of the many areas we can effect and change the human condition. We can SAVE LIVES! We just need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $250,000.00 for testing and expansion. We have already done all our preliminary testing and have achieved many approvals. Now we need to get these out to the right people to save lives!

  • Staffing. Your funding will go to creating jobs here at home. CCH prides itself on putting Veterans back to work, as we are a Veteran owned company.
  • Promotion., Getting these products into the hands of the people who can make the most difference.
  • Final Testing. Completing the required testing for agencies to approve the use of these products on a large scale.
  • Expanding throughout the world. Currently we are represented in 13 states. We need to expand into remaining states and other countries.

The Impact

The impact we will have on humanity as a whole is emense. Imagine cities being able to provide clean water from toxins they couldn't control before. E-coli being able to be eliminated at our beaches. Clean drinking water to those that don't have it. Industrial clean ups of polluted areas.

Please Visit www.cchglobalconsulting.com and our projects pages to see our success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute. Please spread the word. Every little bit puts us one step closer. Every person who knows is one more that can make a difference.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogog tools to help spread the word.

story:
"No social justice movement in history has been successful without the strategic use of nonviolent direct action. There comes a moment in every struggle when the power of everyday people needs to be felt.. That moment... can be a transformative moment for the community and for the struggle itself.  We see our purpose as increasing the capacity for vision, creativity and strategy in direct actions ... with the intention of changing history."

-The Ruckus Society: Action Speaks Louder Than Words


Imagine Bretton Woods 3.0 . . .

. . . a room filled with people from around the globe, a powerful and diverse group of change makers like those who brought us the Rally for Unity in Paris, the People's Climate March in New York City, democratic elections in Senegal, renewable energy in Germany and Denmark, a $15 per hour minimum wage in Seattle, guarantees of the Rights of Nature in Ecuador and Bolivia, and Black Lives Matter in Ferguson Missouri.


The Bretton Wooods 3.0 summit will connect local, national and international civil society leaders with with new thought leaders around the world who are successfully taking action to create economic, environmental, and social justice.  

Your donation today will be used for a preliminary planning meeting for the Bretton Woods 3.0 summit in 2016. 

Your contribution is tax-deductible.  Our organization, the Center for Emergent Diplomacy (CED), is a 501 (c) 3 social-profit organization (a more accurate term than "non-profit.")  The $55,000 we raise will pay for expenses for 15 key activists who can't afford to travel to join other invitees at our planning meeting early in 2015.  Attendees at that meeting will finalize plans for the global Bretton Woods 3.0 Summit in 2016.


Imagine Bretton Woods 3.0 . . .

Imagine the power that can be unleashed as these successful grass-roots organizers and thought leaders share ideas--a blend of modern and ancient wisdom-- and develop strategies and action plans that connect direct action campaigns around the world.

Imagine if delegates find ways to combine their energy and networks so that their individual movements become one powerful global movement that confronts the failing global economic system that is consuming our planet.

That is what Bretton Woods 3.0 is designed to do.


  

TEDX- Dr.Merle Lefkoff talks about Bretton Woods 3.0


Bretton Woods 3.0: 

Mobilizing for A New Compassionate Economy

The Center for Emergent Diplomacy will convene a global economic summit in Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA, on May 18-28, 2016, called Bretton Woods 3.0. Its purpose is to connect and coordinate the most urgent social movements of the 21st century. A coordinated global movement will push worldwide economic reform to the forefront of the global political agenda.

Bretton Woods 3.0 will provide a unique opportunity for an unprecedented diversity of the most effective new thinkers and activists from around the world to come together, plan and coordinate social action campaigns.  Their task will be to design a coherent, coordinated action plan to put pressure on policy makers to implement new economic policies, policies that will create a more just and sustainable world.

Thank you for being generous with your gift and for helping us make a difference.

story:
Hej!


Oroar du dig också för klimatförändringarna? Och för att omställningen till ett hållbart samhälle går för långsamt? I år är det valår. Kom med du också och hjälp till att påverka politikerna. Stöd folkets Klimatriksdag 2014! Den 6-7-8 juni samlas vi i Norrköping och tar fram en rad kraftfulla men fullt genomförbara förslag, som vi sedan kommer att tvinga politikerna att ta ställning till!

Vår gemensamma värdegrund

"Vi tar varningarna från FN's klimatpanel på största allvar och utgår från alla människors lika värde och rättigheter".

Alla som delar den är välkomna att vara med.

Varför en riksdag?

Idén är inte ny - den är 120 år gammal.
Lika låst som klimatfrågan är idag var rösträttsfrågan i slutet av 1800-talet. För att pressa på hölls en FOLKRIKSDAG 1893, med resultatet att den allmänna rösträtten definitivt blev fastslagen som folkets krav.

Det gick för 120 år sedan - och det går att göra idag.

Bröd bakar dock inte sig självt, blommor pollinerar sig inte själva och DU kan hjälpa till att göra detta praktiskt möjligt! Pengarna från denna insamling kommer att gå till att avlöna en person som bemannar ett kansli de sista 6 veckorna innan riksdagen. Det kommer att behövas!

Stort TACK för alla gåvor, stora som små!!

Vad vi behöver och vad du får

En heltidsanställd kommer att kosta 35000 i månaden - 25000 i månaden före skatt
+ arbetsgivaravgift. För sex veckor kommer vi alltså att behöva 52000 kr.

Perks: 300 kr eller mer - vi skickar den här bilden, utskriven på fint papper och signerad av konstnären själv!


Om vi inte når målet, så kommer pengarna att gå till att bekosta en kanslist för den tid

vi klarar av att täcka ekonomiskt!

Resultat

Du bidrar till demokratin, och en bättre värld. Världen ändras inte främst av stora ledare, även om det är dem som vi kommer ihåg; utan av många människor som organiserar sig och tillsammans jobbar mot högre mål. Vår förhoppning är att vi kan ge politikerna en förståelse för att de har ett brett folkligt stöd för att ta itu med klimatproblemet.


Andra sätt att hjälpa till

Känner du att det inte är läge att donera pengar, men ändå vill hjälp till, så kolla in
den här sidan: http://klimatriksdag2014.se/sa-engagerar-du-dig/

Pengarna från denna insamling kommer att gå till att avlöna en person som bemannar ett kansli de sista 6 veckorna innan riksdagen. Det kommer att behövas! Stort TACK för alla gåvor, stora som små!!Vad vi behöver och vad du får
En heltidsanställd kommer att kosta 35000 i månaden - 25000 i månaden före skatt + arbetsgivaravgift. För sex veckor kommer vi alltså att behöva 52000 kr.Perks: 300 kr eller mer - vi skickar den här bilden, utskriven på fint papper och signerad av konstnären själv!Om vi inte når målet, så kommer pengarna att gå till att bekosta en kanslist för den tid vi klarar av att täcka ekonomiskt!Resultat
Du bidrar till demokratin, och en bättre värld. Världen ändras inte främst av stora ledare, även om det är dem som vi kommer ihåg; utan av många människor som organiserar sig och tillsammans jobbar mot högre mål. Vår förhoppning är att vi kan ge politikerna en förståelse för att de har ett brett folkligt stöd för att ta itu med klimatproblemet.Andra sätt att hjälpa till
Känner du att det inte är läge att donera pengar, men ändå vill hjälp till, så kolla in den här sidan: http://klimatriksdag2014.se/sa-engagerar-du-dig/

story:
The world's problem is our problem:

Roughly a third of world's food production is thrown away every year.

This is a  horribly large percentage considering the countless people seriously suffering from food shortage. Calculating per household, this comes down to 600$-750$ worth of groceries each year, as much as a small family vacation or food for several months (depending on local prices)!

We should not need to tell you this, but most likely it also happens in your home! Think about every time you buy something in bulk because it is cheaper or you cook too much and keep it in the fridge until you're not sure whether it's still good or not and you throw it out just to be sure.

Best-before -or worse- sell-before dates are indirect and inaccurate. They are mere guarantee certificates from the producers for a certain feature of the food, for example creaminess in yoghurt. Most food is still safe to eat and perfectly tasty after the best-before date.

There is the other side: What if you transport your groceries in a warm car or they stay out of the fridge a few hours or a night? You don't know whether your food still safe to eat! 

 

I bet you don't remember your last case of food poisoning!

Many cases go undisclosed because people think the rumbling is 'just a stomach ache' or that they are 'sensitive', but it's unpleasant and sometimes embarassing anyways. I think I don't have to tell you about the more severe cases caused by meat or eggs that were less than at their best.

 

There is a solution!

As Scientists, our goal is to develop a detection and report system in the form of a easy-to-use sticker that tells you whether your food is still safe to eat, independently from date or time, by direct measurement and a color indicator.

>>Don't worry, the sticker will be smaller than that!

The food-safe (safe to ingest) bacteria are contained in a compartment of the sticker in their hibernated form and the activation fluid in the second compartment. By thoroughly bending or massaging the sticker like a glow stick you will break the inside compartment and activate the sticker. When you put it close to your food, for example in the same plastic bag or box it will change it's colour when the food is not edible anymore.

We are trying our best to make the sticker re-useable. Because meat has the most energy consuming production process of all foods, we focus on meat spoilage detection for the first prototype as for proof of principle.

Apart from the protective hightech polymer mesh that stabilizes the outer layer of the sticker, the bacteria cannot survive outside of the sticker, which makes the system safe to use. The plastic will be a membrane which is transmissive for gasses but not fluids, so nothing can escape.

The design of the Biological process for this is the hardest part because we will work with a special strain of food-safe bacteria in which we will implement a complex Biosensensing system, a reporter system and a safety-switch. All these parts will be standardized (interchangeable, safe and easy-to use) so others can  pick up our research and develop our idea further.

We will not earn any money with this, it is purely about taking a successful first step in research and building a prototype!

 

We need you!

We are an interdisciplinary team of eleven science students from Groningen University and this summer we will develop a biological Food Spoilage Detection System. We will do this in the course of the worldwide non-profit Synthetic Biology contest iGEM organized by MIT (Massachusetts Insititute of Technology).

Food waste and Food Safety are globally important issues and so we are proud to be able to represent many nationalities in our team. We are young scientists from The Netherlands, Indonesia, Poland, Germany, Ukraine and the USA.

Most of us have different academic backgrounds which help us to gain different points of view and develop our product optimally using both broad and in-depth knowledge. We use our skills in the fields of Molecular Biology, Microbiology, Chemistry, Medical Biology, Engineering, Programming and Mathematical Modeling as well as Design and Marketing to raise awareness of Food Waste and Food Safety and develop our product as far as possible.

Our website is still in beta, it will look better very soon!

 

What We Need

We are already being sponsored by our University, which provided lab facilities and machinery. Some research companies partly sponsor travelling costs to symposia and things like printing costs. In previous years there were big funds which covered for more than 15000$ of research costs but they stopped funding Undergraduate Researchers when the Economic Crisis started.

We still need money for laboratory disposables, chemicals and test kits which are not payed for by the University.  Yet they are crucial for safe and hygienical work in the laboratory.

Also we need to order primers and enzymes for our genetical constructs. This synthetic DNA and proteins can be ordered on the internet and unfortunately are quite expensive. They are the building blocks and tools for building our Biological Machine, the Spoilage Detector.

 

What you get

The warm feeling of helping us towards a great goal

The opportunity to let lots of people see your effort on our website, our posters, on our shirts and social networks and hear about it during our presentations

An unique piece of art which will remind you or others of your good deed and our gratitude

 

 

The Impact

 

Research is not the only thing keeping us busy!

Together with local artists we designed and made unique Bio-Art paintings from colourful, living bacteria found in your everyday environment. They were exhibited at The Night of Art and Science (click for video) and new ones will be exhibited at various other festivals in the region.

Those Bacterial Beauties surprised many people as you usually don't see your little neighbors in all their glory without using a microscope.

We are organizing a Summer School for talented High School students who want to see real science at work and join us in our lab during this summer. There will be lectures and practical sessions but also individual projects concerning food waste and Biological Safety and hygiene.

In collaboration with SciencelinX (click here) we will develop a Standard Educational Kit for use in High Schools to teach recent biological methods and more realistic views about this field of science apart from from the good old dissecting frogs and fishes!

All previous iGEM teams from the University of Groningen reached their goals and won Gold Medals during iGEM Research World Championships in the field of Synthetic Biology (click for previous iGEM Groningen websites). They pushed the boundaries between Science and Society towards increased awareness and understanding.

We get great scientific support from our supervisors and other research groups at the faculty. There is always somebody who listens to our questions and problems and has answers, tips and alternative ideas.

Considering all of this we are confident that we will achieve our goals this year and develop both a viable prototype of the Food Spoilage Detector and a campain that raises awareness of food spoilage to a level of public acknowledgement.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, please spread the word in any way!

  • Like and re-post our facebook page and twitter

    > follow @FoodWarden

  • Send the link to this page to anybody who could be interested

    ( indigogo.com/FoodWarden )

  • Contact us about questions or suggestions via team@igemgroningen.com

  • Think about food spoilage in your home and try to waste less

 

Thank you sincerely for your attention!

story:
Wouldn't you like to point to a piece of public art and say, I helped make that happen!

My name is Bert Jackson.  I am  a visual artist and sculptor based in Oakville, Ontario, Canada.  We are proposing a public sculpture that is important to our community and will be of interest globally.  We want to place a life sized sculpture of polar bears on an ice flow in Coronation Park in Oakville.  We are calling the piece "Raft of the Polar Bears."  

Coronation Park on Lake Ontario is the site of the largest charity polar bear dip in Canada.  It was started 27 years ago by the Courage brothers.  It has raised almost a million dollars for some really worthy causes around the world.  

A life sized mock up of the piece was displayed on Jan !st this year by myself and my creative team.  We were overwhelmed by the positive response.  

The project has been endorsed by the Mayor, the Council, and the staff of the Town of Oakville.  It just needs the funding.  

First, the piece will be a year round reminder of the polar bear dip.  Second, it's a fun piece.  After all, who is not charmed by seeing these beautiful and majestic creatures.  Thirdly, the polar bear has become a symbol of environmental awareness and concern.  "Raft of the Polar Bears"  would draw attention to these global issues.

We hope to grab the imagination of future generations of environmentalists.  Let's face it; we should all be environmentialists.  We're all in it together.  

Now, thanks to the genius of crowd funding, you can make this your project too. 

Thanks for listening.  Thanks for considering the project.  Thanks for contributng.  Do it now.  Tell all your friends you did.  

Bert and Creative team

story:
Hello from Los Angeles! My name is John Zavalney and I am proud to be a Climate Presenter. I’m also a science teacher, having spent more than 20 years working in the L.A. public school system and now serving as a science expert at the San Pedro Science Center. I love what I do!


I would like to ask for your help to defeat climate deniers and reveal the truth about the climate crisis.


I became interested in climate change through my role as a science educator and became especially motivated to make a difference when I participated in a taping of a presentation by Al Gore that was shown in An Inconvenient Truth. After the documentary was released, I was selected and personally trained by Mr. Gore to deliver the same climate slideshow presentation to people within my network.


Over the years I’ve given the slideshow presentation innumerable times, yet one really stands out. I gave a presentation at my alma mater West Liberty State College (now University) in West Virginia. In a coal mining state like West Virginia, I was a little nervous to talk about the need to transition off of dirty coal and illustrate the environmental damage done by the mountaintop leveling that takes place in the southern part of the state. I received a very positive response and actually got my first standing ovation. This presentation gave me more confidence to give presentations outside my usual comfort zone of preaching to the choir around Los Angeles and in classrooms.


People often ask me what my motivation is to spend so much time educating people about the climate crisis. That’s easy – my motivation is the youth of today. I have seen young people learn, get excited and get involved in making the world around them a better place. To see the light bulb go on when a student understands and gets it, that’s my motivation. I have been privileged to work with some of the most amazing, motivated young people in the world. They are why I keep doing what I’m doing.


On September 15, I’ll be participating in the 24 Hours of Reality event, created by The Climate Reality Project and Al Gore. 24 Climate Presenters from around the world, one in every time zone, will deliver a new slideshow from Mr. Gore that focuses on the link between extreme weather and climate change.


I’ll be presenting this slideshow in Boulder, Colorado, home of 7 federally funded research facilities including the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR). With world-class research underway on a wide range of topics, Boulder is a focal point for climate and weather-related scientific research today.


I hope you’ll “tune” in. The slideshow is fantastic and I can’t wait to share it.   


Why I’m asking:

Since 2006, Al Gore has trained more than 3,000 volunteer activists like me from around the world to deliver updated versions of the slideshow featured in An Inconvenient Truth. These Climate Presenters have delivered more than 70,000 climate presentations and reached a global audience in excess of 7.3 million people!


Climate Presenters are on the front-lines, educating people around the world at a peer-to-peer level every day about the science and impacts of climate change, and they are helping us expand the global movement of people working together to solve the climate crisis. 


I’d like to ask for your contribution of $25 or more to support Climate Reality’s efforts to continue to train Climate Presenters. With your gift, you’ll help Climate Presenters like me give presentations all over the world, building a movement of people who care about climate change. Plus, your donation will be tax-deductible if it is made via PayPal. 


More about me:

Education is my life. In addition to being a Climate Presenter with The Climate Reality Project, I’ve also been involved in a variety of environmental education programs.  I received an American Teacher Award as one of the top three science teachers in the country and was awarded the Global Leadership Award in Education by the Jane Goodall Institute. I also run a 3 ½ acre urban garden that showcases food sustainability. 


More information about the 24 Hours of Reality event, from The Climate Reality Project:

Spanning 24 hours, 24 time zones and 13 languages, 24 Hours of Reality features a new multimedia presentation from Vice President Al Gore that will make the reality of climate change impossible to ignore. This new presentation will be delivered by Vice President Gore and an elite corps of Climate Presenters from around the world, including Evan Williams from the U.K.


Beginning in Mexico City on September 14 and proceeding westward around the globe, 24 Hours of Reality will offer a snapshot of the global climate crisis from Tonga to Cape Verde, Auckland to Rio, Jakarta to London. With one event scheduled in each time zone at 7 p.m. local time, the entire 24 hours will be streamed live online and will include commentary from scientists, elected leaders, business leaders, celebrities and activists.


Other ways you can help:

Join us for 24 Hours of Reality! Visit our website and RSVP on Facebook to show the world what can change in a day.

story:
Hi, my name is Jennifer and I need a bathroom.

Less than an hour from Seattle is the beautiful Snoqualmie River. Every summer over 26,000 people come out to enjoy its beauty, bathe in its coolness and float its currents and yet there is no toilet.

This campaign is simple- raise the funds needed for a permanent vault toilet for the river access site.

How much do you value a toilet? $5, $10, $20? How much do you value a clean river to swim and float in? Name your price and Pony up for a Potty!

Rally for a Restroom!
Jump for a John!
Cash for a Commode!
Fund a Flusher!


What We Need & What You Get

The vault toilet will be purchased and installed by CXT company. It will cost $16,000 for a one hole toilet (it is $29,000 for two hole) plus $2,000 for permitting.

Please check out the cool and bathroom-appropriate perks you can get with your contribution, but remember to ask yourself, can you really put a price on a potty?

The Impact

In the Northwest we pride ourselves on our green forests, pure air and clean streams, but those things don’t just happen on their own. A beautiful natural world, immediately adjacent to urban centers requires immense effort. Please join the many forward thinking individuals that have paved the way for our region and put your time and money where it counts!

Risks & Challenges

State agencies struggle today to get the funds they need to build and maintain our public spaces.  For 23 years the Mountains to Sound Greenway Trust has been working side by side with the public agencies to help fill the gaps and give support where needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Over 26,000 people use this river area each year- if just half of them gave $2 we’d make our goal so please tell your friend, neighbor, social media community. Just a little will go a long ways if we have enough folks. Please use the share tools to get the word out.

story:
What do I need fundraising for?

I have been chosen as one of the members of the Antarctic Youth Ambassador Programme to attend the International Antarctic Expedition.The mission is to engage people to take responsibility, be sustainable, and know that now is the time for action in policy development.

I am dreaming of being able to see Antarctica’s pure and untouched nature with my own eyes and truly feel how vulnerable our planet is. Having experienced this, I want to pass this feeling on to the rest of the world through my writing in order to activate people around the world to work together towards a healthy earth. Please help me raise enough money to make this possible.

 

Who am I?

My name is Bella Papadopoulou Dobrowolska and I am an environmental journalist. A couple of years back I randomly read a quote that got stuck in my mind. The quote was simple and yet so powerful to me and it said ”if you can imagine it, you can make it”.

It is easy to dream away about a clean and healthy planet but I don’t want to stop at the imagination part, I want to actually make it happen. In 2010 I studied Environmental journalism in Australia and after that I have been traveling around the world in order to be involved in various environmental and sustainable projects. Up until today I have been part of all in between observing how the native islanders in Fiji respond to the raising of the water level, to installation of water filters in poor communities.

Being a journalist I have been working hard on raising attention and awareness regarding various environmental problems because I am certain of the fact that a major part of this global environmental issue is simply the lack of knowledge about it.

I am running a news site called ”Ecology Now” where I publish articles in this exact matter. In the meantime I am traveling to countries around the world talking about the global impacts on our environment, our home, to children in schools and other institutions.

 

Why should you sponsor me?

But to be passionate about the environment is not always enough in order to make a change. I believe that the most important qualities needed in a ”world-changer” are two: communication and stubbornness. To be able to get your message through is easy, to actually make it heard is an art. An art that I have learned to master after many years of journalistic behaviour. Being fluent in 6 different languages (Swedish, Greek, Polish, English, Spanish and Portuguese) has made it easier to reach out to a wider audience as well.

In order to achieve great things people need to gather, share and combine their abilities to create a strong and solid group that can create and act. As a part of this team of 2041, I believe that my comminication skills and my international access to press as a journalist will be in great favour and contribution.

 

What will you get back!

We are living in hectic times where the lack of time is a crucial issue for all of us. This is why I want to dedicate all of mine in order to make changes – even if they are small – that will benefit on everyone’s behalf.

Today, it is very important to take care of the environment, especially for businesses. By sponsoring me, a young person that is commited to protecting the valnurable Antarctica, it definately shows that the bussiness cares about the environment, the society and that it supports active youngsters. I am currently seeking sponsorship for the expedition of amounts of $1,000.00 or more as the expedition costs $20,000! In return for sponsorship You would have Your companys logo placed on the expedition website and facebook page, as well as promoted via twitter as well as appear on all of the photos and a documentary film that will be shown in the international press by Robert Swan (OBE) that is very well known and respected in international media. This high res image will be provided to you to use in all marketing materials and on your website to further demonstrate that the company is supportive and caring of solving environmental issues.

Antarctica holds 90% of the world’s ice and 70% of the world’s fresh water. This is why it is in everyone’s interest to protect it.

Human activities in Antarctica are governed by an international agreement known as the Antarctic Treaty System, established in 1959. This unique international agreement ensures that Antarctica is used for peaceful purposes only and that the environment is protected. Currently there is a moratorium in place that bans drilling or mining in Antarctica called the Environmental Protocol, established in 1991. This document can be reviewed after the 50-year anniversary in 2041. With all the changes in the world today, it is crucial to make sure that this agreement will be re-voted in order to keep Antarctica protected from political interests. 

 

What will your contribution pay for?

The Expedition Fee includes:

  • Three nights pre-expedition hotel accommodation with breakfast
  • All shore landings per the daily program
  • Leadership throughout the voyage by our experienced Expedition Leader, including shore landings and other activities
  • Formal and informal presentations by our Expedition Team and guest speakers as scheduled
  • Photographic journal and HD film on a 2041 jump drive documenting the voyage including presentations by speakers and Robert Swan
  • Comprehensive pre-departure materials, including a map and informative Antarctic Reader.
  • All miscellaneous service taxes and port charges throughout the program

 

What happens when I come back from Antarctica? 

I am currently living in a small town in the northeast of Brazil called Itacaré. While the tourism has kicked in pretty well here, there is still large part of the community living in poor neighborhoods of the nearby “favela”.

When I come back from Antarctica I would like to start a project to introduce these families to solar cooking. The location of this part of town is located on a hill and all of the houses have flat and sun-exposed rooftops. Bahia, which is the state where Itacaré lies in, is a place where the sun hardly ever hides behind the clouds so I want to take advantage of this by introducing solar cooking to the community.

“Feijoada” is a traditional Brazilian dish that is eaten everyday for lunch and is mainly made up of beans, something that take a long time to cook and waists a lot of gas and energy in order to be prepared. In Itacaré there is a voluntary organization called “Ponho Forte” where children in between the ages of 4-18 take place in various educational activities. Together with this NGO I would like to teach these children about why it is important to be sustainable and they loved the idea.

Having made the educational part of this, I want each and every student to make their own solar cooking-device (such as an oven made out of mirrors or turn a tinfoil-covered umbrella into a place to cook their beans on). I will spend 1-2 months focusing on the educating part and the philosophy behind solar cooking before making the workshop because I believe that it is very important to make these children aware of the impacts of energy wasting in order for them to make the devices with full consciousness. I aim to include around 100 students in this project, which will mean that 100 households will make solar cooking as part of their daily food preparation. I am certain of the fact that this in time will encourage many others to solar cook as well, especially as they will have a chance to save money on gas and electricity.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

  • You can ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools
  • You can recycle and try to live in a sustainable way

story:
The efforts to restore Kalangalo CFR will greatly benefit the surrounding community by providing them with an assortment of medicinal herbs and improve the much needed climate for their agricultural activities. In addition; restoration will once again provide a home for wildlife that existed before the ruthless encroachers started destroying the forest. 


 Unfortunately, some of the encroachers who continue to destroy the forest do not belong to the surrounding community thus the need to increase on the surveillance to curb their activities.

Our goal is to raise $ 40,000 (US) and the funds raised through the campaign will go towards buying and planting more seedlings (55%), securing the Forest reserve area (20%) and restoring the sand mined areas (25%).




If any of our donors ever have a chance of travelling to Uganda, we promise to give them a free tour of the area. Please, spread the word about our campaign. Tell a friend to tell a friend as we embark on this great cause of restoring nature.

Please, feel free to visit our website- www.bewl.org or our facebook page labelled as Bakitara.

Perks

Batique

Ladies Bag


Beaded bangles

Wooden Animals

story:
90% of Kenyans use firewood and charcoal to cook, resulting in deforestation, climate warming, and deaths. 

GreenChar is transforming Kenya through its eco-friendly and smokeless charcoal briquettes that curb deforestation, reduce CO₂-related emissions, and save lives. 

Kindly see below for information on the following: (I) GreenChar's story, (II) the current social problem, (III) GreenChar's solution, (IV) notable awards and recognition, (V) the impact of your donation, and (VI) what you can do to help. 


I. The Story

Household air pollution caused by cooking with firewood and charcoal is the greatest health risk in the world after high blood pressure, tobacco, and alcohol. 

Last December, 18 year-old Tom Osborn founded GreenChar. Tired of lighting the family cookstove everyday and seeing his mother take in a slow poison while cooking, he started making charcoal briquettes from agricultural wastes for women like his mother and children like him in Kenya. 

With the mission to provide affordable clean energy solutions to Kenyans, Tom and his amazing team are ready to take GreenChar to the next level and usher in the new era of clean kitchens for Kenyan households.

II. The Problem

90% of Kenyan households like Tom's use wood fuels (charcoal and firewood) to cook. Indoor air pollution from these wood fuels has resulted in :

  • 4.3 million deaths each year
  • 70% of black-carbon emissions, the second leading cause of climate warming
  • Continuous deforestation at a rate of 130,000 acres of forest cover per year
  • Unhealthy, unclean kitchens, which make cooking an unenjoyable experience

More people die from incremental, ongoing inhalation of smoke from their own homes than from malaria, tuberculosis, and HIV/AIDS combined.

III. Our Solution

GreenChar is a social enterprise that provides clean charcoal briquettes made from revitalized agricultural wastes and distributes clean cookstoves.

GreenChar's charcoal briquettes are :

  • Eco Friendly - curbs deforestation by using revitalized agricultural wastes
  • High Energy - can be used to cook a wide variety of foods
  • Smokeless - reduces the risk of harmful respiratory diseases 
  • Long lasting - reduces overall fuel costs for ordinary Kenyan families 
GreenChar distributes clean cookstoves that optimize the efficiency of the briquettes.The cookstoves reduce smoke and particle emissions, retain more heat and reduce fuel costs to provide families with the ultimate clean cooking experience.

Combined, these complementary products provide a complete household cooking environment, saving lives, money, and time.

Since last December, GreenChar has sold 4,300kg of eco-friendly charcoal briquettes, distributed over 400 clean cookstoves, saved over 100 trees, and impacted 6,000 lives.  


IV. Notable Awards and Recognition 

Below are a list of GreenChar's awards, recognitions, and notable articles. 
Awards:
  • Echoing Green Fellowship- GreenChar is one of 42 Echoing Green Fellows’ organizations. GreenChar will receive seed funding along with business and leadership support for a span of two years.
  • Donor's Circle Award for Africa- Awarded by the Silicon Valley Foundation at Anzisha Prize Awards Gala organized by the African Leadership Academy and the MasterCard Foundation.
Notable articles on GreenChar:
  • The Daily Nation- "Teens' Science Congress idea brings them close to continental prize"
  • truthAtlas- "Inventor of Green Charcoal Proves You're Never Too Young to Innovate"
  • The Christian Science Monitor- "Tom Osborn, inventor of 'green' charcoal, proves you're never too young to innovate"
  • Social Enterprise Buzz- "GreenChar is a social enterprise formed out of a high school science project"
  • Forbes- "Echoing Green's 2014 Climate Fellows"

V. Your Impact

GreenChar is currently using a manual handpress and employing a staff of 2 to produce its charcoal briquettes. This crude machinery and shortage of staff limits both the quantity and quality of charcoal briquettes.  

Your donation will directly help us:

  • Complete a production plant
  • Purchase a mechanical briquette press and binding machinery
  • Increase staff to 10 and hire a full-time engineer 
  • Design and produce our first line of cookstoves
  • Organize programs for women's groups in Kenya to train them how to make their own briquettes
Together, these will enable GreenChar to increase production from 80kg to  3 tons (~2700kg) of charcoal briquettes per day. Per 1kg of its charcoal briquettes produced, GreenChar saves 5kg of wood and 10kg of CO₂-related emissions. Therefore, your support will help us:

  • Save 15,000kg of wood/70 trees per day (1 tree = ~195kg)
  • Reduce 27,000 kg of CO₂-related emissions per day 
  • Make cooking safer for over 2000 families and over 10 schools per day

VI. We Are Stronger Together

You can also support us in many ways. Together, we are stronger. 

  • Make a contribution of any amount that will help GreenChar continue saving the environment and impacting thousands of lives. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools provided to share this project with your social networks (use the widgets located just below the video above).
  • Spread the word about GreenChar. The more people who know about us, the more impact we'll have. Let's make some noise to transform Africa's cooking environment.
Check out our Photo Gallery for a better understanding of GreenChar's mission and team, and Kenya's kitchens and families! 

Here's to transforming Africa's cooking environment and saving time, money and lives. Thank you for your support.

#StrongerTogether


Photo credits- Dominique Hessert

Video credits- Kelly Ranck and Global Minimum

Increase staff to 10 and hire a full-time engineer 
Design and produce our first line of cookstoves
Organize programs for women's groups in Kenya to train them how to make their own briquettes
Together, these will enable GreenChar to increase production from 80kg to  3 tons (~2700kg) of charcoal briquettes per day. Per 1kg of its charcoal briquettes produced, GreenChar saves 5kg of wood and 10kg of CO₂-related emissions. Therefore, your support will help us:

Reduce 27,000 kg of CO₂-related emissions per day 
Make cooking safer for over 2000 families and over 10 schools per day











VI. We Are Stronger Together
You can also support us in many ways. Together, we are stronger. 


Make a contribution of any amount that will help GreenChar continue saving the environment and impacting thousands of lives. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools provided to share this project with your social networks (use the widgets located just below the video above).

Spread the word about GreenChar. The more people who know about us, the more impact we'll have. Let's make some noise to transform Africa's cooking environment.


Check out our Photo Gallery for a better understanding of GreenChar's mission and team, and Kenya's kitchens and families!

story:
Bridging the gap between an existing zero waste network and those who choose to take action.

We take responsibility to create a zero-waste network in Europe by starting our Zero Van Europe Tour.

HERE IS A BIT ABOUT US
We are two young women from very different backrounds and cultures, combining all of our knowledge and passion to serve one purpose: making it easy for you to go zero waste !

Stefanie  is a zero-waste consultant based in Amsterdam, living and endorsing an eco-friendly way of living for more than 8 years. What drives her ? Her love to nature !
Elif wants people to experience a reconnection to what really matters. If you are ready to challenge yourself,  she is ready to support you.

WHY WE ARE DOING WHAT WE DO
Europe already offers an existent Zero Waste network. And we want to make it visible.

That's why we chose 5 cities this year to begin with - creating maps of sustainable businesses that everyone can access:

  • May: Athens, Greece
  • June: Berlin, Germany
  • July: Oslo, Norway
  • August: Amsterdam, Netherlands
  • September: Lisbon, Portugal
     

WHAT WE ARE DOING

We already identified over 340 shops that align with a Zero Waste lifestyle in Amsterdam. The selected stores allow for easy changes to a Zero Waste lifestyle, yet the awareness is missing. We are bridging the gap between the already existent Zero Waste infrastructure and those willing to take action with our zero waste maps.

Highlighting these spots makes going Zero Waste easy and helps small businesses to thrive. Thus spreading awareness and supporting local shops as we create a community.

HOW WE ARE DOING IT


We first localize businesses like Treasurehouse that align with the values of a Zero Waste lifestyle, making it easy for the consumer to find. And then categorise those businesses with coloured labels according to their current status quo (% of Zero Waste potential fulfilled). This makes the current practice visible and increases additionally the will for a business to commit to an even higher Zero Waste practice.

Furthermore, we connect to the business owners and their stories to further engage the community with local stores. Along the process, we guide the businesses interested into a more Zero Waste practice and at the same time we make it easy for consumers to change their consumption pattern.

WHAT IF YOU HELP US DOING IT ?
You save your own ass. We connect people who do good for the world and help them create a bigger environmental impact. In numbers that means our tour has the potential to influence over 6 million people in 5 european cities.

Cities are responsible for the biggest share of carbon emissions. By engaging urban customers into changes in behaviour and mindset, we have a great chance of achieving significant positive indirect impact.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Alright, let's speak about the hard facts.

THIS IS WHAT WE NEED TO GET IT ROLLIN'

  • Electric Camper Van:    € 30.000,-
    An electric camper van, serving as our carbon neutral home, rolling office and mobile spreading the word device. 
  • Marketing Budget:         € 10.000,- 
    A marketing budget to help further grow our community of zero wasters on social media channels - includes printing of compostable stickers to categorise and pin businesses.

We are completely transparent with our costs and invite everyone to have a look into our accounting books.

What we are contributing from our own pockets are our monthly fixed costs of about € 1000,- and all the women power we have. While we are connecting to businessowners and individuals ourselves, we are simultanously able to code and develop a zero waste networking platform.
 

SO, WHAT'S IN FOR YOU ?

Here is what you will get for your contribution to a bright & clean future !

  • Zero Waste Bike Tours: Join one of our zero waste bike tours to solve a few questions around the myths of a Zero Waste lifestyle being inconvenient, expensive, timely and not accessible.
  • Zero Waste DIY Kit: did you ever wanted to produce your own shampoo, deo or toothpaste ? We have everything it takes - go zero with us !
  • Homemade zero waste products: Too lazy to do that ? Alright :-D ! We got you covered ! Try our self-produced zero waste products and fall in love with nature's gifts.
  • Individual Zero Waste Consultancy: Convenience, money and time standing in your way of becoming a zero waster ? We help you get started.

 

  • Are you living in one of our targeted cities ? Whoop ! We would love to visit you at home and turn your life into a zero waste zone.
  • Zero Waste Consultancy for your business: Time for change ? Let's make it happen ! We help your business integrate zero waste practices to its strategy.
     

What happens, if we don't achieve the amount we wished for ?

We will do it anyway - and if we have to go by bike with a tent on our backs - we won't let mother earth down!

If we partly reach our goal, we have won already - we have more than we had in the beginning of our tour and will be able to make a bigger impact.
 

Our Impact

The maps we are creating are data-driven solutions and have thus the potential to be scaled up and benefit the many. Since the creation of our zero waste map Amsterdam we already had over 3.000 views without promoting it particularly. The map and the network has the potential to be implemented in every major city around the world, strengthening consumers and businesses in their will to a Zero Waste life.

Our Website can easily run for several cities. Ideally, each city would have a local consulting agency or ambassador who would be a contact point to ensure each business knows which steps to take to a more sustainable business practice. In collaboration with wegozero.co could we ensure that the criteria for each city stays the same, to allow for comparability among cities. Once again, connecting, embracing and strengthening the local, sustainable network.
 

Risks & Challenges

Did you know that 61% of the Millennials would like to live a more sustainable lifestyle? Whilst many believe it is important to take care of the environment, only few people follow through. The problem is: it is not made easy. Going for the better option typically involves a lengthy research leaving only the strong-willed to a Zero Waste lifestye.

We close this Value-Action Gap and make it easy for everyone to transform their daily routine to a Zero Waste lifestyle.  

But also we will face challenges and risks:

  • What if our Van gets stolen ?
  • What if one of us gets sick ?
  • What if we take too much responsibility on our shoulders?
  • What if Covid restrictions get more strict and we won't be able to travel ?

This is where we have trust in you and hope for the support of the community that we create. And this is what we wish for everyone that is part of our network. Creating a base of trust and transparency.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

In each city we are looking for volunteers, who can help us create a european zero waste network:

  • You can help us with mapping & marking the shops with zero waste potential with stickers
  • You can help us by becoming a zero waste bike tour guide
  • Make some noise about our campaign and share it on your social media channels

And this is all for now. Questions ?
story_txt:
Bridging the gap between an existing zero waste network and those who choose to take action.
We take responsibility to create a zero-waste network in Europe by starting our Zero Van Europe Tour.
HERE IS A BIT ABOUT US We are two young women from very different backrounds and cultures, combining all of our knowledge and passion to serve one purpose: making it easy for you to go zero waste !Stefanie  is a zero-waste consultant based in Amsterdam, living and endorsing an eco-friendly way of living for more than 8 years. What drives her ? Her love to nature !Elif wants people to experience a reconnection to what really matters. If you are ready to challenge yourself,  she is ready to support you.
WHY WE ARE DOING WHAT WE DO Europe already offers an existent Zero Waste network. And we want to make it visible.
That's why we chose 5 cities this year to begin with - creating maps of sustainable businesses that everyone can access:

May: Athens, Greece 

June: Berlin, Germany

July: Oslo, Norway

August: Amsterdam, Netherlands

September: Lisbon, Portugal  

WHAT WE ARE DOING 
We already identified over 340 shops that align with a Zero Waste lifestyle in Amsterdam. The selected stores allow for easy changes to a Zero Waste lifestyle, yet the awareness is missing. We are bridging the gap between the already existent Zero Waste infrastructure and those willing to take action with our zero waste maps.
Highlighting these spots makes going Zero Waste easy and helps small businesses to thrive. Thus spreading awareness and supporting local shops as we create a community.
HOW WE ARE DOING IT 
We first localize businesses like Treasurehouse that align with the values of a Zero Waste lifestyle, making it easy for the consumer to find. And then categorise those businesses with coloured labels according to their current status quo (% of Zero Waste potential fulfilled). This makes the current practice visible and increases additionally the will for a business to commit to an even higher Zero Waste practice.
Furthermore, we connect to the business owners and their stories to further engage the community with local stores. Along the process, we guide the businesses interested into a more Zero Waste practice and at the same time we make it easy for consumers to change their consumption pattern.
WHAT IF YOU HELP US DOING IT ? You save your own ass. We connect people who do good for the world and help them create a bigger environmental impact. In numbers that means our tour has the potential to influence over 6 million people in 5 european cities.Cities are responsible for the biggest share of carbon emissions. By engaging urban customers into changes in behaviour and mindset, we have a great chance of achieving significant positive indirect impact. 

What We Need & What You Get
Alright, let's speak about the hard facts. 
THIS IS WHAT WE NEED TO GET IT ROLLIN'


Electric Camper Van:    € 30.000,-An electric camper van, serving as our carbon neutral home, rolling office and mobile spreading the word device. 

Marketing Budget:         € 10.000,- A marketing budget to help further grow our community of zero wasters on social media channels - includes printing of compostable stickers to categorise and pin businesses.

We are completely transparent with our costs and invite everyone to have a look into our accounting books.
What we are contributing from our own pockets are our monthly fixed costs of about € 1000,- and all the women power we have. While we are connecting to businessowners and individuals ourselves, we are simultanously able to code and develop a zero waste networking platform. 
SO, WHAT'S IN FOR YOU ? 
Here is what you will get for your contribution to a bright & clean future ! 


Zero Waste Bike Tours: Join one of our zero waste bike tours to solve a few questions around the myths of a Zero Waste lifestyle being inconvenient, expensive, timely and not accessible.

Zero Waste DIY Kit: did you ever wanted to produce your own shampoo, deo or toothpaste ? We have everything it takes - go zero with us !

Homemade zero waste products: Too lazy to do that ? Alright :-D ! We got you covered ! Try our self-produced zero waste products and fall in love with nature's gifts.

Individual Zero Waste Consultancy: Convenience, money and time standing in your way of becoming a zero waster ? We help you get started.


 


Are you living in one of our targeted cities ? Whoop ! We would love to visit you at home and turn your life into a zero waste zone.

Zero Waste Consultancy for your business: Time for change ? Let's make it happen ! We help your business integrate zero waste practices to its strategy. 

What happens, if we don't achieve the amount we wished for ? 
We will do it anyway - and if we have to go by bike with a tent on our backs - we won't let mother earth down!
If we partly reach our goal, we have won already - we have more than we had in the beginning of our tour and will be able to make a bigger impact. 

Our Impact
The maps we are creating are data-driven solutions and have thus the potential to be scaled up and benefit the many. Since the creation of our zero waste map Amsterdam we already had over 3.000 views without promoting it particularly. The map and the network has the potential to be implemented in every major city around the world, strengthening consumers and businesses in their will to a Zero Waste life.

Our Website can easily run for several cities. Ideally, each city would have a local consulting agency or ambassador who would be a contact point to ensure each business knows which steps to take to a more sustainable business practice. In collaboration with wegozero.co could we ensure that the criteria for each city stays the same, to allow for comparability among cities. Once again, connecting, embracing and strengthening the local, sustainable network. 

Risks & Challenges
Did you know that 61% of the Millennials would like to live a more sustainable lifestyle? Whilst many believe it is important to take care of the environment, only few people follow through. The problem is: it is not made easy. Going for the better option typically involves a lengthy research leaving only the strong-willed to a Zero Waste lifestye.We close this Value-Action Gap and make it easy for everyone to transform their daily routine to a Zero Waste lifestyle.  
But also we will face challenges and risks:

What if our Van gets stolen ?
What if one of us gets sick ?
What if we take too much responsibility on our shoulders?
What if Covid restrictions get more strict and we won't be able to travel ?

This is where we have trust in you and hope for the support of the community that we create. And this is what we wish for everyone that is part of our network. Creating a base of trust and transparency. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
In each city we are looking for volunteers, who can help us create a european zero waste network:

You can help us with mapping & marking the shops with zero waste potential with stickers
You can help us by becoming a zero waste bike tour guide
Make some noise about our campaign and share it on your social media channels

And this is all for now. Questions ?

story:
What is The Gift Rebellion?

The Gift Rebellion believes in caring for our environment by sharing what we have rather than always buying new. We aim to change the way people feel about second-hand gifts and remove the 'stingy' stigma that's associated with them. 

How will our gift wrap make a difference?

By wrapping your second-hand gift in The Gift Rebellion gift wrap, you're reducing the production, packaging and shipping of one new thing. The gift wrap has been designed to help people feel comfortable about giving and receiving second-hand gifts. 

We offset every sheet of The Gift Rebellion gift wrap with one tree planted and donate 50% of profits to tree planting and conservation.

Why?

Many people want to give second-hand gifts, because they know it's better for our environment, but they're scared of being judged. In the past, people have looked at second-hand things as dirty and worthless. The Gift Rebellion aims to change this attitude and give people another tool they can use to reduce their impact on our precious Earth.

How will Indiegogo funds be used?

We'll use all Indiegogo funds to print the first run of The Gift Rebellion gift wrap and postcards which explain The Gift Rebellion concept to the receiver. Our paper is printed in Australia on 100% recycled paper and using natural vegetable based inks.

Rewards will be shipped to our backers then we'll sell the remaining gift wrap and postcards on The Gift Rebellion website. You'll be receiving the first edition of The Gift Rebellion gift wrap and postcards in the mail in December 2020. 

NOTE: Due to COVID and Christmas, we've been advised that production times may vary but this will be confirmed closer to printing date. Although we hope to ship the gift wrap to you in early December, unfortunately we can't absolutely guarantee it will arrive before Christmas.

If we don't reach our target, we'll reduce the size of the first print run and continue as planned to ship perks and sell the remainder of our paper on our website. 

During this process, we'd love your feedback, and to hear about your experiences using The Gift Rebellion gift wrap. For most of us, giving a second-hand gift is an act of bravery so THANK YOU! 

Our vision beyond Indiegogo

The Gift Rebellion has a lofty vision. We want to work ourselves out of business and contribute to the global acceptance of a sharing economy. Get ready for an eye-watering statistic: 2019 global retail spending was estimated at US$25 trillion with estimated growth of more than 4% per year over the next 3 years. It's an uphill battle for our environment. The Gift Rebellion aims to be a powerful social movement and a supportive community, breaking the taboo around second-hand gifts and supporting a sharing economy to help our planet thrive. 

Environmental sustainability

The Gift Rebellion wrapping paper is printed in Australia on good quality, 100% recycled paper using natural vegetable based inks. It can be reused to give again then recycled when it's no longer presentable. 

All of The Gift Rebellion materials (paper, postcard, envelopes etc) are reusable, recyclable and/or compostable.

While the paper needs to be shipped to you, it's very compact and is delivered as a letter. This is offset by one tree planted and by your second-hand gift which completely eliminates the production, shipping and packaging of a new gift. It's 'reduce, reuse and recycle' at its best.

While The Gift Rebellion already has a very small carbon footprint, we aim to be 100% carbon neutral within 2 years of commencement of business. 

Don't need our gift wrap but know someone who might?

If you're someone who's completely comfortable giving second-hand gifts without the need for our gift wrap OR second-hand giving just isn't your cup of tea (that's OK, each to their own!), we'd LOVE you to share this campaign with anyone you know who might like The Gift Rebellion. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We decided to make Dirt Rich while in the final stages of production on our award winning film Angel Azul after asking Dr. Thomas Goreau if there was any kind of machine that could vacuum carbon out of the air. Without hesitation he said, "Yes, we have the perfect machine, and.... it's called, a tree! " And with that he turned to point to a huge tree on the MIT campus and now, two years later, we are in the final stages of filming Dirt Rich! We are making this film because experts claim that we can literally reverse runaway global warming by practicing the strategies presented in the film within a very short timeframe. Your contributions help:

1- refocus public attention on drawing carbon down rather than simply concentrating on emissions

2- grasp regenerative agricultural/farming techniques that actually build soil

3- educate the public how soil is a living organism that feeds the world

4- reverse runaway global warming

5- pay for the music and graphics that distinguish this film and make it so enjoyable!

6- bring the film to high schools as a part of our Angel Azul Public School Outreach Progra

What We Need & What You Get

This particular fundraising campaign is focused on paying our musicians and graphic artists! We need $15,000 to accomplish this goal! We need to raise funds and spread the word as it won't be long before we embark on our festival tour and we want to invite all of our Angel Azul fans to join us at film festivals!

$25  Download of finished film

$50  Download of finished film, thank you in closing credits, 

$100  Signed Blu-ray of finished film, thank you in closing credits, poster designed by artist Rachael Hendel and Signed Tom Rhodes CD

$250  Signed Blu-ray of finished film, thank you in closing credits, poster designed by artist Rachael Hendel, Signed Tom Rhodes CD, Signed Blu-ray of Angel Azul

The Impact 

As environmental documentary filmmakers, our goal is to inspire and educate as many people as possible. To that end, with a grant from the Berkeley Film Foundation, we have been able to provide every public high school in the Bay Area with a copy of Angel Azul to use in classrooms, fundraisers, school screenings, and for use in their school libraries through our Angel Azul Public School Outreach Program. We believe that educating and inspiring students about how to live in the world more sustainably is extremely important. We will be adding Dirt Rich to our program upon its completion. We also plan to follow in the footsteps of Angel Azul with a full festival run lasting up to two years. Angel Azul won 12 awards and traveled to over 60 festivals and is now represented by EcoDox,  and distributed by Gravitas Films making it available OnDemand and on local cable. We plan to do the same with Dirt Rich.
