This party is about people all over the islands, dancing in THEIR place, to celebrate a shared vision of natural abundance for Hawaiʻi. = )

Q.Why an online dance party?
A. We do like in-person parties too! But we know that fundraising dinners and concerts can be expensive. We’re a small organization, and lower costs mean more of your gift goes directly to support the mālama ʻāina (stewardship) work of communities. Plus, it means that people from all over the paeʻāina -- and the world -- can “come” and party with us!
Q: I bought a perk to help with the fundraiser, but can I give more?
A: Yes! For example, if you choose a $65 perk, but would like to donate $100, you can. Select whichever perk you like, and there is an option at checkout to add more to your contribution. Thank you!
Q: What if I want to donate but don't want a perk?
A: Of course! That means 100% of your donation will go directly to the hana (work)!

Q. I think I'd prefer to donate a more traditional way. Can?
A. You can always make a donation at our KUA website at donate.kuahawaii.org or by mail:
KUA307A Kamani St, The Box JellyHonolulu, HI  96813checks can be made out to: KUA
Q. Is my donation tax deductible?
A. Yes! KUA is a 501(c)3 non-profit. Donations to KUA qualify as a charitable deduction for federal income tax purposes. In general, the IRS says that you can deduct the value of your donation MINUS the fair market value of any perks you choose. 

Q. I don't think I can give money this year, but I'd still like to show my support ... What can I do? 
A. If you can dance, join us! Get your friends and family to join too. Send us a video of your best dance moves, and weʻll add it to our video gallery! Whether you give financially or not, your movement expresses your support! Email videos to Kim Moa at dance@kuahawaii.org.
Q. Er, I don't speak Hawaiian... What does  Kuaʻāina Ulu ʻAuamo mean?
A.  KUA means back -- like a backbone that connects and supports. KUAʻĀINA are the grassroots, rural peoples of Hawaiʻi nei. ULU means to grow. ‘AUAMO is the carrying stick held on multiple shoulders of laborers who shared the burden of carrying something of great weight forward. By taking up the ‘AUAMO, our KUAʻĀINA communities share the sacred kuleana (responsibility) to better Hawaiʻi. 
Still have questions? You can reach Dance Party Coordinator Kim Moa at dance@kuahawaii.org or call KUA at 808-672-2545.




MAHALO 
To the families and communities of E Alu Pū and Hui Mālama Loko Iʻa and the Limu Hui for your participation in this party & your everyday hard work and sweat. You make Hawaiʻi better!


To Harold K.L. Castle Foundation, Office of Hawaiian Affairs, Wallace Alexander Gerbode Foundation, Swayne Family Foundation, Hawaiʻi People's Fund, Sidney E Frank Foundation, and Toyota TogetherGreen Fellows by Audubon, for your generous support of this movement in 2014! 

To Matt Ing, Jen Barrett, Deb Gowensmith & Sandy Huang whose advice & aloha helped make this party possible. We love you guys!



Thanks for dancing with us!  To learn more visit www.KUAhawaii.org.

story:
We hit our first goal in 1 hour! (You ROCK.) 

What's Next: Reach $4k for Reservation Manager's Conference!

Thanks to open data supporters around the world, Access Land will officially be speaking at the upcoming State Park Director's Conference!  But why stop here?

Another invaluable opportunity to explain the power of opening park data is just around the corner. We have been invited to speak at the upcoming annual Reservation Manager's Conference, where key representatives from each state meet to discuss best practices for camping contracts.

If we hit $4k, we can speak at this conference as well!

Any additional funding will go towards supporting volunteer policy advocates, who have successfully lobbied to change California and the Federal Government's camping contracts to require open data. 

Without advocates on the ground, Access Land wouldn’t be making waves. There are still 49 states who will soon decide if their park data should be open, accessible, and free.

Thank you for you joining us in our mission to improve access to our public land with public data.

Alyssa + Team Access Land


Open Data for Open Lands 

An Unprecedented Opportunity

My name is Alyssa Ravasio, I helped found Access Land a year ago when I learned about an upcoming contract from the Federal Government that planned to give a single private company ownership of valuable data about our public land.

I am proud to say that our coalition, which includes the Sierra Club, REI, and over 50 other outdoor organizations, has since succeeded in advocating for both the Federal Government and California State Parks to require open data in their contracts. 

This Fall, we’ve been invited to speak at the National Association of State Park Director’s Conference. This conference will bring together 30+ of the 50 State Parks Directors in the nation, creating an invaluable opportunity to explain the power of open data to those with the direct power to unlock it.

Though we are an ad hoc coalition campaigning for open data, we are required to pay the standard $2K registration fee for the conference.


The Impact

Opening park data to the private sector empowers any company or individual to build unique apps that will better connect the public to our land.

These apps can reach a wider and more diverse demographic than any one company can alone (the current contracts create an effective data monopoly). Increased visitation to our parks will boost revenue for the government, local economies, and entire outdoor industry.

As each state's contract expires, they have an opportunity to follow California and the Federal Government's precedent. But many states are hesitant to let go of their old systems and embrace this new platform of innovation.

At this conference, we will be able to address their concerns face to face, and explain why open data creates the best outcome for the government, the parks, and the public. 


Can’t Contribute?

If you are not financially able to support our cause, l encourage you to join our mailing list here. We will keep you up to date with the outdoors open data movement and ways you can help.

story:
How it began

I am Dimitri, a 25-year-old farmer. After studying economics at University, I realised I wanted to get my hands dirty and address directly some of the issues I cared about. I got bitten by the permaculture bug which quickly lead me to farming. I saw it as a meaningful way of combining my desire to contribute to society and interact with nature.

This dream became a reality when we started a family project in Greece, where my grandfather is originally from. Since then, family and friends have come together and dedicated huge amounts of passion and energy to make this project come out of the ground.

Mazi (μαζί) in Greek means "together" and our project has lived up to its name – it’s been heartwarming to see all the support received so far and how much our mission has resonated with so many people.

Our vision

We believe that agriculture can be a tool to regenerate ecosystems and rural communities whilst producing an abundance of high-quality food. There is a growing movement of farmers around the world seeking to increase nutritional food whilst returning carbon to the soil, increasing biodiversity, keeping our rivers clean as well as producing a decent income. Greece and the wider Mediterranean area is highly susceptible to degradation because of its climate and topography. This is why we are taking on the challenge of farming in a way that is both economically and ecologically functional and work hard to ensure regenerative agriculture has a future in Greece.

What we do

We are Mazi Farm, using agroforestry to regenerate farmland since 2018, focusing on the production of figs, pomegranates, pistachios and almonds.  So far, this is what we have achieved:

 

TIMELINE

-

Why we need your help:

Please follow this link to our business plan.

We need your help to regenerate an additional 1.5ha of land. This gives us an opportunity to create a 2.0 version of our agroforestry system, based on the insights gained this past year. We will focus on creating a design that is scalable and can be easily adopted by other farmers.

Here’s a break-down of what the funding will go toward:

-

 

 

*Breakdown of R&D costs

€1,200 - Courses and workshops to acquire necessary knowledge to improve systems (bio-fertilisers, AEA agricultural approach, fermented extracts, SAP analysis and more).

€1,000 - Consultancy for 'Dam & Earthworks' design and  fertility project (SAP analysis, soil analysis interpretations and fertility strategy). 

€1,000 - Visits to events, shows, regenerative farms, academic institutes and agro-ecological organisations to develop solutions and techniques. 

 

5 GOOD REASONS TO INVEST IN US

1. Support agriculture that provides nutrient-dense food

2. Support young farmers that rejuvenate rural communities

3. Invest in the regeneration of ecosystems through reforestation of farmland and the protection of biodiversity

4. Support human-scale farming that contributes socially and economically to a rural region

5. Support an innovative type of agriculture striving to create resilient food systems

 

Other ways you can help:

Beyond giving, we'd love for you to help get the word out to friends, family and your social media followers about the campaign: 

1. Please share this page with your followers to help us reach our goal

2. Follow the latest news on our website, Facebook and Instagram page.

 

 

 For more information please email us at contact@mazifarm.com. Thank you for your support!

Special thanks to the talented Ben Hudson for the crowdfunding video.

#MaziPledge #FarmingfortheFuture #TogetherwithNature

story:
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP ?

We are in Barcelona (Spain) and we have to fly to Central America. We need collaboration. We are a very young NGO, we spend all our time and resources to power up what today we have created. You are also important for this kind of steps can be given, and we can put a solution to this problem which needs and urgent reaction.

We need 4,500 $ to pay :

  • Flights
  • Meals
  • Insurances
  • Stay
  • Material rent 
  • Promote shark protection
  • Documentary production

The idea is to send 4 members of Nakawe Team :

  1. Our founder Regina Domingo (Dive Instructor).
  2. One biologist to collect all the scientific data during the expedition, on land.
  3. One Underwater photographer & filmmer to report all the expedition, on land.
  4. One Audiovisual & Graphic designer (also camera man) to develop all the media work (photos, banners, video edits etc.), on land.





Nakawe in action...



 ___________________________________________________________________________


SHARK FINNING 


Shark finning is the fishing practice of catching sharks, chop their fins and return the body to the bottom of the sea, where they inevitably will die by suffocation, bled or eaten by other fish cause they are unable to swim. 
These animals grow slowly; sexual maturity occurs after many years and have few offspring. A natural vulnerability must be added the fact that in recent decades, some shark species have declined to 90% due to over exploitation unsustainable fishing. This drastic decline is very dangerous to the health of the oceans because these animals play an important role in maintaining the Earth's ecosystem. 
The oceans cover 71% of the surface of the Earth and are essential to the functioning of our planet. 
The mass capture of sharks, illegal in almost everywhere, produces extinction triggering a cascading effect behaving a reduction of oxygen on earth directly affecting all living beings including humans. 

" As an organization one of our projects is to protect sharks, through awareness, education and action. We aim to be an international reference in the defense of sharks. "







 


SO LET'S...
Awareness and motivate people to stop consuming shark and shark fin soup . Spread the importance of sharks in our oceans to maintain the ecosystem. Show an alternative to the society as ecotourism; with it you can benefit economically without harming the environment . We hope that this economic argument inspire other countries to create new protected areas. Helping national parks or reserves where there's still hope to promote the exploitation of sharks by human hands. Working in the legal field to ensure that sharks are not tortured . Improving regulations and  with it get more protection of marine sanctuaries and heritage sites .


We are going to film different areas in central America.

We think eco-turism is the best way for everybody.
We are going to visit some places and dive centers ( partners of Nakawe Project) that use to see sharks during their dives.
Also we want to explore future collaborations and ways to help and protect places like COCOS ISLAND NATIONAL PARC,from the fishing sector, so threatening the biodiversity of this World Heritage Site.


  ___________________________________________________________________________



OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US


1.  Becoming a Nakawe member (60€ per year)
You will benefit from discounts from the companies that have supported the cause . Consult in our website the full list of our partner companies and our sponsors . You will receive environmental news , public actions, projects, etc. You can participate in activities such as volunteering campaigns. You can collaborate by sending suggestions , complaints and / or photos that you find interesting .
2. Making Donations 
3. Buying our merchandising 
You can also wear Nakawe !! Get your Nakat-shirt on www.nakaweproject.org // All the money will be reverted to the shark finning cause and the conservation of our oceans.



" Choose the future of sharks and help us to stop shark finning. About 100 million sharks are killed every year, 73 of this just for fin soup wasting the 98% of their bodies. 139 Sharks killed every minute, 2 every second… You choose. "

More info :

Twitter: @nakaweproject

Instagram: @nakaweproject

Facebook.com/NakaweProject

info@nakaweproject.org

www.nakaweproject.org

story:
About us

We are a group of three young friends. our plan is to plant lots of fast-growning trees for supporting wood industries. Thereby we use unemployed land which can't be used for planting grain, corn or sunflower and boost produce of oxygen and make cooler climates terms. To the end of the year we want to buy land and in spring we want to start with planting.

For environment

Your donates goes for purchasing land and seedlings. In our region there is a lot of unemployed land which is good for this. So we want to utilize it. Fast-growing trees can be fell five times. But we fell those trees four times and then we leave them behind for growing up and in this place full-fledged forest will arise and we will have sources to purchase another land and seedlings.

Safety for contributors

After reaching the goal we will make photos and videos and then post them on youtube channel - Green world SK. You will see the progress of this project.
If we don't reach our goal irrespective start this project. Althought it will be much harder to start it witouth help so we will be glad for your donate.

Risks & Challenges

Those trees are modest for planting. First year is hardest for seedlings.
There are not so many factors to "destroy" them. Only in summer there can be sometimes dangerous storms.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will be happy if you share this idea at social pages and tell it around.

If you want you can come to Slovakia in spring and help us with planting seedlings. :)

Here are fast-growning trees

Seedlings

2 years tree

4 years tree

story:
¿Qué es la COY 10?

La Décima Conferencia de la Juventud sobre cambio climático - COY10 es un evento que reúne a jóvenes de todo el planeta interesados en acciones frente al cambio climático y estilos de vida sostenibles, que se realizará del 28 al 30 de Noviembre en la ciudad de Lima, capital de la República del Perú.

Es un espacio impulsado por la organización juvenil de jóvenes y cambio climático - YOUNGO y representa una plataforma de aprendizaje, organización e intercambio de experiencias y buenas prácticas con la finalidad de fortalecer el movimiento climático juvenil mundial y comprometer a las siguientes generaciones en el desarrollo de acciones frente al cambio climático en el marco de la cooperación internacional.

Por esas razones, se convierte en el evento juvenil anual sobre cambio climático más importante a nivel global en días previos a la Conferencial de las Partes sobre Cambio Climático - COP.

What is COY?

COY stands for Conference of Youth, this year having it’s 10th edition. It will gather 1000 young people from all around the world, interested in Climate Change and in a sustainable way of living. It will be held from the 28th to the 30th of November in Lima, the capital of Peru.

It is promoted by Youth United for Climate Progress – YOUNGO, one of the eight official constituencies of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The COY represents a great opportunity for young people to gain compromises on their actions against Climate Change as they will have the chance to exchange their experiences and learn from the others activities and good practices. Making it the moment to strengthen the climate movement based on an international cooperation.

As a result, COY represents the most important venue for youth on climate change this year, just few days before the Conference of the Parties COP (Major UN Climate Summit of the year).


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes


Jóvenes de todo el mundo vendrán a Lima-Perú para trabajar la declaratoria juvenil ante el cambio climático, que será llevada a la COP 20, para que la voz de la juventud mundial sea escuchada y tenga un impacto relevante en las decisiones que se tomen en la Conferencia de las partes.

- Necesitamos 5 mil dólares para costear, gastos de talleres, alimentación para los participantes, hospedajes, materiales de difusión y materiales de audio y video, que se necesitarán para este evento de duración de 3 días

- Las recompensas por tu donación van desde una mención especial en los créditos del vídeo final de la COY, una postal personalizada, un polo del evento hasta un vídeo donde los líderes ambientales juveniles te saludan y dan las gracias por tu apoyo. En caso de empresas o instituciones, se les puede incluir en el fanpage como institución auspiciadora.

- De no llegar a la meta los fondos serían usados para recopilar la información de la COY 10 y tratar de generar todo el material posible de los acuerdos a los que lleguen los mil jóvenes participantes del mundo.

What we need and what you get

Young people from around the world will come to Lima-Peru to work on the youth declaration on Climate Change. The declaration will be taken to the COP 20 so the voices of the young people of the world can be heard and so they have a relevant impact on the decisions that the governments are going to make.

  • We need 5000 dollars to finance: workshops, food for the participants, lodging, media (video and microphones); which we will need for the 3 days of the workshop.

  • For your help you will be rewarded beginning with mentioning your name on the credits of the final video, a personalized postcard, a t-shirt or a video where young leaders will say hi and thank you for your support. If you are an enterprise or an establishment we will put you on our fan page as sponsor.

  • If we do not get to the 5000 dollars the money we do get will be used to gather all the COY 10 information. Also, it will be used to replicate and generate all the proper material so the world gets to see all the accomplishments of the thousand participants of the world


Queremos generar Impacto!

El objetivo central de la COY10 es establecer un espacio de información, articulación y organización de la juventud mundial para construir una Agenda Climática Juvenil hacia la COP20 y COP21.

Agrupaciones juveniles de Perú y de todo el mundo vienen trabajando en este proceso desde inicios de año, por ser jóvenes comprometidos con el medio ambiente y comprometidos a hacer el cambio, haciéndolo consciente de la gravedad del cambio climático y de sus efectos adversos.

Apóyanos y sé parte del cambio.. Haz hacer escuchar la voz de los jóvenes del mundo.. Ayúdanos a hacer de este mundo un mundo mejor..un mundo consciente y consecuente con sus actos!

We want to create a change!

The main objective of the COY is to establish an information space, a joint and an organization of the young people of the world to build a Youth Climate Agenda to the COP20 and COP21.

Youth organizations from around the world have been working on these process since the beginning of the year. As we are determined on making a change and conscious of the consequences of climate change.

Support us and be part of the change!... Help the voice of the youth to be heard.. Helps us make this world a better one.. a more conscious world consequent with its actions.

No será fácil!

Construir una agenda climática juvenil no es tan simple.
Es necesario contar con muestras representativas de cada continente para que así juntos podamos llegar a acuerdos en común. Debatir, discutir y consensuar, son actividades necesarias para llegar a acuerdos en común.
- El equipo organizador peruano se  ha sumado a distintas organizaciones internacionales que vienen trabajando temas de cambio climático desde años atrás. Así que contamos con la experiencia necesaria para poder encauzar las ideas y propuestas hacia un pronunciamiento común.
- El intercambio de experiencias e ideas es motivante, la declaratoria juvenil es también un paso pero no hay que olvidar que el proceso es largo y enriquecedor.

It won’t be easy!

Building a Youth Climate Agenda is not simple.

It’ll be necessary to have previous Agendas of the five continents so we can achieve a common agreement. Debate, discuss and consensus are activities that are necessary to reach this common agreement.

  • The Peruvian organizing team has reach for support to international organizations that have had years of experience on Climate Change in order to have the ability to gather the ideas and proposals through a common pronouncement.

  • The exchange of experiences can be very motivating as well as the youth declaration but we can’t forget that the process is long and enriching.


No hay forma de No ayudar!

Difunde nuestra campaña!!! Y ayúdanos a generar el cambio!
El cambio de conciencia necesario para cuidar nuestro Planeta!
 El cambio necesario para que la voz de los jóvenes del mundo sea escuchada!
Entra a http://www.coy10peru.com/ y comparte nuestro Fanpage..
Usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!

There is no way you can’t help!

Spread our campaign!! Help us make a change!!

The change of conscience we need to take better care of our planet!

The change is necessary so the voice of young people of the world is listened!

Go into Facebook http://www.coy10peru.com/ and share our Fanpage

Use the tools Indiegogo has for sharing
Ayúdanos a Convertir nuestras voces en Acción!
Help us turn our voices into action!

.
story_txt:
¿Qué es la COY 10? 
La Décima Conferencia de la Juventud sobre cambio climático - COY10 es un evento que reúne a jóvenes de todo el planeta interesados en acciones frente al cambio climático y estilos de vida sostenibles, que se realizará del 28 al 30 de Noviembre en la ciudad de Lima, capital de la República del Perú.
Es un espacio impulsado por la organización juvenil de jóvenes y cambio climático - YOUNGO y representa una plataforma de aprendizaje, organización e intercambio de experiencias y buenas prácticas con la finalidad de fortalecer el movimiento climático juvenil mundial y comprometer a las siguientes generaciones en el desarrollo de acciones frente al cambio climático en el marco de la cooperación internacional.
Por esas razones, se convierte en el evento juvenil anual sobre cambio climático más importante a nivel global en días previos a la Conferencial de las Partes sobre Cambio Climático - COP.

What is COY?
COY stands for Conference of Youth, this year having it’s 10th edition. It will gather 1000 young people from all around the world, interested in Climate Change and in a sustainable way of living. It will be held from the 28th to the 30th of November in Lima, the capital of Peru.
It is promoted by Youth United for Climate Progress – YOUNGO, one of the eight official constituencies of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The COY represents a great opportunity for young people to gain compromises on their actions against Climate Change as they will have the chance to exchange their experiences and learn from the others activities and good practices. Making it the moment to strengthen the climate movement based on an international cooperation.
As a result, COY represents the most important venue for youth on climate change this year, just few days before the Conference of the Parties COP (Major UN Climate Summit of the year).

    Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Jóvenes de todo el mundo vendrán a Lima-Perú para trabajar la declaratoria juvenil ante el cambio climático, que será llevada a la COP 20, para que la voz de la juventud mundial sea escuchada y tenga un impacto relevante en las decisiones que se tomen en la Conferencia de las partes.
- Necesitamos 5 mil dólares para costear, gastos de talleres, alimentación para los participantes, hospedajes, materiales de difusión y materiales de audio y video, que se necesitarán para este evento de duración de 3 días
- Las recompensas por tu donación van desde una mención especial en los créditos del vídeo final de la COY, una postal personalizada, un polo del evento hasta un vídeo donde los líderes ambientales juveniles te saludan y dan las gracias por tu apoyo. En caso de empresas o instituciones, se les puede incluir en el fanpage como institución auspiciadora.
- De no llegar a la meta los fondos serían usados para recopilar la información de la COY 10 y tratar de generar todo el material posible de los acuerdos a los que lleguen los mil jóvenes participantes del mundo.

What we need and what you get
Young people from around the world will come to Lima-Peru to work on the youth declaration on Climate Change. The declaration will be taken to the COP 20 so the voices of the young people of the world can be heard and so they have a relevant impact on the decisions that the governments are going to make.

We need 5000 dollars to finance: workshops, food for the participants, lodging, media (video and microphones); which we will need for the 3 days of the workshop.
For your help you will be rewarded beginning with mentioning your name on the credits of the final video, a personalized postcard, a t-shirt or a video where young leaders will say hi and thank you for your support. If you are an enterprise or an establishment we will put you on our fan page as sponsor.
If we do not get to the 5000 dollars the money we do get will be used to gather all the COY 10 information. Also, it will be used to replicate and generate all the proper material so the world gets to see all the accomplishments of the thousand participants of the world

   Queremos generar Impacto!
El objetivo central de la COY10 es establecer un espacio de información, articulación y organización de la juventud mundial para construir una Agenda Climática Juvenil hacia la COP20 y COP21.
Agrupaciones juveniles de Perú y de todo el mundo vienen trabajando en este proceso desde inicios de año, por ser jóvenes comprometidos con el medio ambiente y comprometidos a hacer el cambio, haciéndolo consciente de la gravedad del cambio climático y de sus efectos adversos.
Apóyanos y sé parte del cambio.. Haz hacer escuchar la voz de los jóvenes del mundo.. Ayúdanos a hacer de este mundo un mundo mejor..un mundo consciente y consecuente con sus actos!
We want to create a change!
The main objective of the COY is to establish an information space, a joint and an organization of the young people of the world to build a Youth Climate Agenda to the COP20 and COP21.
Youth organizations from around the world have been working on these process since the beginning of the year. As we are determined on making a change and conscious of the consequences of climate change.
Support us and be part of the change!... Help the voice of the youth to be heard.. Helps us make this world a better one.. a more conscious world consequent with its actions.   No será fácil!

- El intercambio de experiencias e ideas es motivante, la declaratoria juvenil es también un paso pero no hay que olvidar que el proceso es largo y enriquecedor.It won’t be easy!
Building a Youth Climate Agenda is not simple.

The Peruvian organizing team has reach for support to international organizations that have had years of experience on Climate Change in order to have the ability to gather the ideas and proposals through a common pronouncement.
The exchange of experiences can be very motivating as well as the youth declaration but we can’t forget that the process is long and enriching.

Difunde nuestra campaña!!! Y ayúdanos a generar el cambio!
El cambio de conciencia necesario para cuidar nuestro Planeta!

Usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!There is no way you can’t help!

story:
Below: an example of a page of the book 

Who We Are 

My name is Kathryn Curtis and I am passionate about health, food, and the environment. My research as a graduate student at the University of Michigan focuses on water security in Brazil. This will be my second book, and most ambitious project yet (click here to see my previous book, "Choose Your Health," for sale on Amazon). I believe a plant-able coloring book will serve as an impactful, fun and transformative way to share the information we all need to know about water scarcity. None of the money we raise through your contributions will go towards me, or any of the time I spend on the project. All of it will go towards printing the book, and paying the artist who illustrates it, Rogério Fernandes.

Rogério Fernandes is a Brazilian visual artist from Belo Horizonte. Born in the state of Piauí, his work was greatly influenced by the woodcarving styles of the Brazilian northeast. His work can be found across the world. He believes that his fantastical and emotion-centered style will help readers connect with the subject matter and imagine how to create a new water-secure future. To learn more about Rogério's work, check out his website here.


Quem Somos

O meu nome é Kathryn Curtis e eu trabalho com a saúde, comida, e o meio ambiente. Eu fiz uma pesquisa acadêmica para o meu mestrado na Universidade de Michigan focado na segurança alimentar e sua relação com a seca no Brasil. Esse livro será o meu segundo, e o projeto mais ambicioso até hoje (clique aqui para ver o meu livro prévio, “Choose Your Health,” no Amazon). Eu acredito que um livro para colorir e plantar servirá como uma maneira impactante, divertido, e transformativo para compartilhar a informação que precisamos saber sobre a escassez d’água.

Rogério Fernandes é um artista de Belo Horizonte. Nascido no Piauí, a obra dele é muito influído pelas gravuras do nordeste. As obras dele estão espalhados pelo mundo inteiro. Ele acredita que o seu estilo fantástico e emocional pode ajudar os leitores conectar com a historia e imaginar como criar um futuro melhor. Para aprender mais sobre o trabalho de Rogério, viste o site dele aqui.



What's Happening in Brazil?

In São Paulo, Brazil, city residents are thirsty. They dig wells in their back yard, drink dirty water, hoard what little they have. The Cantareira Reservoir System, which provides water to this enormous city, is drying up. But the problem isn't just in São Paulo - it's all across Brazil, and spreading fast. Water scarcity and water security affect us all. It is urgent that the public - not just experts or politicians - understand what is happening, and how to help. The image below is a concept illustration for the book that Rogério and I created with my writing and his visual wizardry, to give you an idea of what we plan to create together. 

O que está acontecendo no Brasil?

“O povo aqui [em São Paulo] foi criado para acreditar que a água é um recurso que nunca acabaria. Estamos tirando água das fontes mais do que elas conseguem repor por métodos naturais.” Mara Cecilia Brito, Aliança Pela Água

No São Paulo, os cidadãos estão com sede. A Cantareira, que fornece agua para a cidade, está se secando. Mas o problema não está somente no São Paulo – está espalhado pelo Brasil inteiro, e a dificuldades estão aumentando rapidamente. A escassez d’água nos afeta a todos. É urgente que o publico – não somente os técnicos nem políticos – entendem o que está acontecendo, e como ajudar. 


How You Can Participate

This campaign will raise money to produce a plantable coloring book to build awareness about the who-what-where-when-and why of the issue, and invite readers to dream up a new future. It will be a book to stimulate the head and the heart, harnessing imagination and knowledge for the the common good. We'd like this message to travel far and wide, so the first 100 people to contribute $25 will receive it. 

Your contribution will go towards supporting amazing art by Rogério, Portuguese translation, editing, binding, and publishing the books on the seed paper with some pretty incredible companies in the US and Brazil, and finally distribution. If the book is one day picked up by a publisher, we plan to donate many of the book sale proceeds to non-profits in Brazil working to re-forest the land, grow food sustainably, and support the construction of water catchment systems. If you'd like to see a more detailed break-down of costs, please scroll down to the bottom.

Thanks for your time and attention! Monetary contributions are awesome, and so is sharing our project on social media!

Como Você Pode Participar

A campanha vai juntar dinheiro num vaquinha para poder produzir um livro para colorir e plantar. Esse livro vai ajudar a nos informar sobre o problema, e convidar leitores a sonhar com um novo futuro. Será um livro para estimular a cabeça e o coração, fortalecendo a imaginação e conhecimento para o bem comum. A gente gostaria que viajasse longe esse livro, então os primeiros cem pessoas a contribuir ao redor de R$100 (exatamente $25USD) vão receber o livro. O livro será imprimido em inglês e português, dependendo do desejo da pessoa.

Sua contribuição apoiará o trabalho de Rogério, tradução do documento ao Português, edição, encadernação do livro, impressão no papel semente, e distribuição. Se um dia o livro é publicado por uma companhia profissional, pensamos em doar muito da renda do livro a ONGs no Brasil lutando para re-florestar e apoiar as pessoas sofrendo por falta d’água. Se você gostaria ver mais do orçamento, poder dar uma olhada aqui embaixo.

Muito obrigada por a sua atenção e tempo! Se você poderia nos ajudar com uma doação, compartilhar nosso projeto no Facebook, ou mandar para amigos e família, a gente estaria muito agradecido!

story:
It's time for another adventure!

Two years ago, I volunteered in Quito, Ecuador.

I had an amazing time with the UBECI program, the host family, and the other volunteers. The experience working with the market children was one I'll always value. This year, I'm working with the same parent organization (IVHQ) to volunteer in Cusco, Peru.

I'm still working out the logistics, but I'm planning to help out in both local orphanages and with abandoned dogs during my two weeks. There are lots of opportunities to help these kids improve their education, and throughout many countries, there are so many dogs without homes. I'm excited to participate in both programs.

I also felt fortunate to have the support of many wonderful donors through Indiegogo last time, and I'm excited to use this platform again!

 

This project is important to me for 3 reasons:

  1. Foreign Travel: I've never been to Peru and I'm excited to immerse myself in a new culture, meet new people, see different places, and leave with new ideas.
  2. Quality Time: staying with a host family and learning the culture from that perspective, along with working alongside others and developing relationships on a daily basis, is a fantastic way to create connection.
  3. Giving Back: to devote two weeks to this program, to work with these kids, to experience that connection, and to help them better their lives—that is going to be amazing!

By contributing to this project, YOU are directly connected to ALL THREE of these items—

  • you are supporting me in my quest to push my comfort zone and expand my perspectives
  • you are helping me meet and spend more time with wonderful people in the world
  • and you are allowing me time to put my life on hold and just focus on these programs

You're a pretty amazing person. :)


A bit more about the volunteering:

The aim of the Childcare project is for volunteers to provide individual attention and assistance to children from diverse backgrounds. Many children at the placements we work with do not receive the level of affection and education that they deserve, volunteers therefore play an important role in working alongside local staff to improve the educational, emotional and hygiene conditions of the children. Volunteers work in orphanages, community centers, schools and kindergartens. Work varies but generally consists of providing individual attention, playing with children, organizing games and activities, assisting with homework, English classes and educating children about hygiene.

The Animal Care project offers volunteers the opportunity to work with an organization dedicated to rescuing and caring for street dogs. The aim of this project is to assist in the protection of these animals, providing human company, medical treatment, and playtime. Tasks include bathing and brushing the animals, providing basic obedience training, cleaning cages, helping during feeding time, maintaining the shelter grounds, and walking and playing with the animals . Other activities may include some small construction projects (i.e. building dog runs and creating fences), along with photography, administration, and fundraising for the shelter's operations.

Program Cost Breakdown:

  • IVHQ Administrative Fees: $265
  • Fees for 2 weeks (room/board/programs): $590
  • Additional Expenses: transit, food not covered, etc.: $200
  • Travel Insurance (required by the program): $120
  • Indiegogo/Credit Card/PayPal fees: $140

Total Costs: $1315 

The programs through IVHQ have some of the LOWEST costs around; very often, when you look into volunteering abroad, it can be up to $2000-$3000 per week! 

This is only $1000 for two weeks!

The campaign is set up that WHATEVER is raised, I will receive—and I'm extremely appreciative for that. 

What happens if I raise more?

With any additional funds (beyond my expenses), I will make a donation to a local orphanage and/or animal rescue center in Cusco. 

From my volunteer experience in Quito, Ecuador:

They loved the uke, and it shall return: with hits from Johnny Cash, Elvis Presley, Neil Diamond, and all the other artists popular with young kids!!

And what about the perks?

Yes, I have some gifts for all of you!

For $10, receive a digital postcard (a hi-res image from my experience—something like the following, which was from my Quito project)
 


For $25, gain access to a Group Q&A through Google Hangouts, plus everything above. You can submit questions and watch it live or listen to the recording. We can talk about:
  • Travel hacking (how I've gone to Hawaii for $5, have ridden on Amtrak for free, and have flown to South America for less than $100)
  • The joys of housesitting and couchsurfing (aka, more traveling for free!)
  • Nutrition, food, and cooking: easy, health, and simple!
  • Meditation (every day for 5+ years!) and exercise (anywhere!)
  • Productivity and time management
  • Web sites, sales funnels, and landing pages
  • Shakespeare, vocal coaching, acting, and being on camera
  • Playing the ukulele
  • Any other topic that I can speak about!
And for $50, you can be IN the hangout with me and a few others (not just listening). [LIMITED SPOTS]


For $100, I'll send you a personalized video postcard during my trip in Cusco (plus everything above). [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $150, I'll do a one-on-one call with you on any of the topics I mentioned. We pick one and spend the hour discussing that, to tackle all your questions!  Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $250, I'll create up to 5 sales funnel pages for integration into your website (or stand-alone) using existing templates from either OptimizePress 2.0 or LeadPages (or comparable  service). This could include squeeze pages, webinar registrations, thank you or download pages, 404 pages, etc. Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $475, I'll design a WordPress website for you. I've created dozens of sites for clients and myself, and heck, I often do these for fun, so I'd be thrilled to work with you on this project. You can read more about the scope in the perk description.  Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]

(sample opt-in page/website)



Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute with dollars and cents, please consider:

  • Get the word out to others you know
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about this on Facebook, Twitter, email, etc!

And finally, once again... THANK YOU!!

Many children at the placements we work with do not receive the level of affection and education that they deserve, volunteers therefore play an important role in working alongside local staff to improve the educational, emotional and hygiene conditions of the children. Volunteers work in orphanages, community centers, schools and kindergartens. Work varies but generally consists of providing individual attention, playing with children, organizing games and activities, assisting with homework, English classes and educating children about hygiene.The Animal Care project offers volunteers the opportunity to work with an organization dedicated to rescuing and caring for street dogs. The aim of this project is to assist in the protection of these animals, providing human company, medical treatment, and playtime. Tasks include bathing and brushing the animals, providing basic obedience training, cleaning cages, helping during feeding time, maintaining the shelter grounds, and walking and playing with the animals . Other activities may include some small construction projects (i.e. building dog runs and creating fences), along with photography, administration, and fundraising for the shelter's operations.

Program Cost Breakdown:

IVHQ Administrative Fees: $265
Fees for 2 weeks (room/board/programs): $590
Additional Expenses: transit, food not covered, etc.: $200
Travel Insurance (required by the program): $120
Indiegogo/Credit Card/PayPal fees: $140


Total Costs: $1315 
The programs through IVHQ have some of the LOWEST costs around; very often, when you look into volunteering abroad, it can be up to $2000-$3000 per week! 

This is only $1000 for two weeks!

The campaign is set up that WHATEVER is raised, I will receive—and I'm extremely appreciative for that. 

What happens if I raise more?
With any additional funds (beyond my expenses), I will make a donation to a local orphanage and/or animal rescue center in Cusco. 

From my volunteer experience in Quito, Ecuador:



They loved the uke, and it shall return: with hits from Johnny Cash, Elvis Presley, Neil Diamond, and all the other artists popular with young kids!!

And what about the perks?
Yes, I have some gifts for all of you!

For $10, receive a digital postcard (a hi-res image from my experience—something like the following, which was from my Quito project) 




For $25, gain access to a Group Q&A through Google Hangouts, plus everything above. You can submit questions and watch it live or listen to the recording.

We can talk about:


Travel hacking (how I've gone to Hawaii for $5, have ridden on Amtrak for free, and have flown to South America for less than $100)
The joys of housesitting and couchsurfing (aka, more traveling for free!)
Nutrition, food, and cooking: easy, health, and simple!
Meditation (every day for 5+ years!) and exercise (anywhere!)
Productivity and time management
Web sites, sales funnels, and landing pages
Shakespeare, vocal coaching, acting, and being on camera
Playing the ukulele
Any other topic that I can speak about!

And for $50, you can be IN the hangout with me and a few others (not just listening). [LIMITED SPOTS]




For $100, I'll send you a personalized video postcard during my trip in Cusco (plus everything above). [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $150, I'll do a one-on-one call with you on any of the topics I mentioned. We pick one and spend the hour discussing that, to tackle all your questions!  Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $250, I'll create up to 5 sales funnel pages for integration into your website (or stand-alone) using existing templates from either OptimizePress 2.0 or LeadPages (or comparable  service). This could include squeeze pages, webinar registrations, thank you or download pages, 404 pages, etc. Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]

For $475, I'll design a WordPress website for you. I've created dozens of sites for clients and myself, and heck, I often do these for fun, so I'd be thrilled to work with you on this project. You can read more about the scope in the perk description.  Includes the digital postcard, video postcard, and invitation to the group Q&A. [LIMITED SPOTS]


(sample opt-in page/website)


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you're not able to contribute with dollars and cents, please consider:



Get the word out to others you know

Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about this on Facebook, Twitter, email, etc!

And finally, once again... THANK YOU!!

story:
www.BrightlyMedia.com


What if...

What if I was to say, there is a way to create a house, with no hard labor, no expensive technology, and yet could last thousands of years...  It would also have a positive impact on the environment, family culture, and be seamless with nature...  Would you be interested?


The Story


One day several years ago, when sitting in a tree, I was imagining creating a tree house.  Then I realized, "What if i just bent enough branches and trained them to grow as walls and floors?"  To me, this concept seems familiar to all of us in some ways, yet buried in our subconscous...  Elves, and fairies, all seem to have their homes in living trees and their stories abound even in our modern culture.  Just take the movie "Avatar" for example.  In a more practical sense, squirrels, owls, and other small furry animals are often found burrowing in hollowed out portions of trees.  Yet, today our human culture is seemingly devoid of what seems like a potential eco-friendly, and easy to use medium for creating a home- namely, living trees.

While this statement may come as a bit of a shock to you, let me explain a bit, and maybe, we'll come full circle...

People and Plants 

People have lived with plants, for the entirety of their existence.  Its obvious that we have a interwoven relationship.  Day to day, many are surrounded by plants.  They walk under trees, and have lunch by the bushes.  Then they go home, and buy some flowers for their wife.  Generations of people in western society have tended to plants, molding them into shapes.  And today a trip to Disney land, will present a number of cartoon characters sculpted right out of living plants.

The structural function of plants, and trees in particular has an even deeper tradition it seems.  Houses, shelves, equipment, instruments, all are known to be made out of plants, wood from trees in particular.  

For functional uses though, the cutting and processing of trees, requires a huge amount of labor, not to mention the extents we take to put them back together: mining metal, designing tools... glue, tape, measurements, architects...You get the picture.  It's a Lot of work.

The project that I have been working on over the last 4 years, aims at developing and making understandable techniques that avoid all the labor of this last step, by simply not cutting down the tree.  Instead, they are woven into strong and resilient structures that can last hundreds, and even thousands of years.  There is much I could say, and even more that I have to learn.  Yet, I am at a interesting point in my R&D, in which I have the skills and enough knowledge from which I can start presenting my findings.


What is getting funded?

My goal with this campaign is to start setting up 50 living tree houses, around the world, and in a variety of different climates.  This is to 1) provide diverse sites to research, and 2) leave a legacy to future generations of the world.  People can support this goal by picking up one or more of our awesome perks.

 

The Impact

What is the impact your campaign may have on others? 

My favorite aspect of Living Tree Houses, is that they are accessible to people of every age.  Children can start growing their own home, and by the time they are full grown, they will have their own full size house, perfect for their needs, and created by their own loving handiwork.  It will also empower future generations confidence, and skill in tending to their selves, and living in harmony with nature.

 

What if your campaign doesn't happen, what are the consequences? 

Living tree houses really don't cost anything to make.  They mostly just need land.  I have already started a couple simple test projects, and will continue to do so.  This campaign is really about exposure, and sharing it with people who feel in their heart this is something amazing, and would like to participate (in whatever ways they feel called).

 

What We Need & What You Get:


So, where is the money going?

Money donated mostly goes towards travel expenses.  There are a little bit of tools and resources which can be used for setting up the tree houses (e.g. rope), but it's not much compared to the expense of just getting me from point A to point B... safely.
I am setting a goal of about $5,000 - $6,000, to get a healthy start in setting up these 50 living tree houses, but basically... more money= more site visits & more Living TreeHouses... got it?

These are my estimates per site visit:

$500 per short term visit-
This covers the cost of getting to a relatively accessible location in the US (e.g. close to an airport). People will preferably be able to pick me up at the airport, and drop me back off there, I'll likely be able to pitch a tent or hammock on their land.  These will reduce costs greatly.  Also, I will arranging trips to take advantage of properties that are close to each other.

$1,000 per indepth visit -
This would be for a slightly remote visit, holding a workshop at a site, or possibly spending extra time in research or discussion.  Slightly remote visits, could be someplace not to far out of the US (e.g. relatively affordable to fly/travel to, such as parts of canada, mexico, central america, parts of south america, possibly parts of the South Pacific, and possibly even parts of the UK).  It could also be used isit/remote visitfor spending extra time, to really go into more depth for a living tree house in the US.  This time could be spent setting up multiple living tree houses that are very close to each other or on the same property.  It could also be used towards diving into much deeper discussion and education with the property owners.  And it could also be used towards facilitating a workshop at the site, or nearby.

$1000-$5000 per remote visit outside the US.  This price will vary, depending on the country, and the support offered from people within that country.  This could include parts of Russia, India, Australia, some parts of the UK, Japan, and all the rest of the world (I don't think Antartica is high on the list though, but Alaska definitely can work).

I realize that traveling IS an expense, and I don't expect every person to want, or be able to fly me to their place just to set up a living tree house.  These opportunities, are simply available for those who feel called.  But, I really don't want to leave everyone else out, who would like to stay intouch with the project.  So, to facilitate people in learning and participating from the comfort of their own home, I'll be taking plenty of video footage from these trips.  You will be able to access it at www.brightlymedia.com, as part of the yearly full access membership for $79.  If you sign up with this indiegogo campaign though, you can pick up a 1-year full access membership for just $49.

Money that is not specifically allocated towards a certain site, will go towards reaching the most benefit, with the least effort (pretty much my motto!).

Other Ways You Can Participate

Money is not the only currency of the world.  This is an inherently social project, since it involves multiple and potentially multiple generations.  Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and/or whatever your favorite social network sites are.  You can also 'like' the brightlymedia.com facebook page for basic updates, and more importantly check out: www.BrightlyMedia.com

If you are non-profit, or a environmental/social/educational organization of some flavor, and would like to start a living tree house at your place please get in touch with me.  Also, people or organizations that do not have the basic $500 funds for a site visit but, are very interested in this project, let me know.  I'll put you on my potential list, and and if I make it to your area, I'll stop by!

Please email your friends, and feel free to message me if you have a potential living tree house site. Thank you so much for checking this out :) You are awesome :)

story:
(Para el texto en español, baje el cursor)

Help us save 120.000 trees

We have the oportunity to increase our goal by saving 120.000 small trees which will die within few weeks if they are not replanted in bags with soil.

The money raised is used for:

  • plastic bags
  • soil
  • Plastic shade
  • tools
  • Payment for labor
  • fertilizers
  • transport
  • Logistics for reforestation

If we do not get the full funding of this urgent project, we will use the money we raised to save as many trees as possible, while still searching funds to save more trees.

Who are we

La Asociación Cultural Na Bolom A.C. is a private non-profit organization working to reforest the highlands of Chiapas in Mexico and we have been doing this since 1972.

Why reforesting is important in Chiapas

Trees dying is an urgent situation, but the long term reforesting program objective is to restore forested areas of the Highlands of Chiapas by strengthening the native tree nursery and a program of social and community reforestation.

Expected results of the Na Bolom reforesting program:

  • Reduce emissions from deforestation and degradation
  • Mitigate the effects of climate change
  • Recover and recharge natural water deposits
  • Decreased soil erosion
  • Decreased flooding in lower parts
  • Recovery of biodiversity

You can learn more about the programs of Na Bolom on www.nabolom.org and on Na Bolom Facebook

Other Ways You Can Help

We can also use your help in other ways:

  • Push this message to your social media networks and use the Indiegogo share tools
  • We need volunteers to help us replant the trees as fast as possible (February-June) - Please contact us if you are interested
  • If you are in Chiapas in the period of June till September, we invite you to help us plant the trees in the highlands of Chiapas - please contact us if you are interested

Thank you for listening

Na Bolom contact information

  • e-mail: proyectos@nabolom.org
  • Telephone: +52 967 6781418
  • Official website: www.nabolom.org
  • Facebook site: www.facebook.com/na.bolom

 

-------------

Ayúdanos a salvar 120,000 árboles

Para nuestra campaña anual, tenemos posilidad de salvar 120,000 arbolitos en riesgo de morir si no se siembran en bolsas.

El dinero recaudado se utilizará para:

  • Las bolsas de plástico
  • Tierra
  • Malla-sombra
  • Herramientas
  • El pago de mano de obra
  • Abonos
  • Transporte
  • Logística para la reforestación

Si no conseguimos el financiamiento total de este proyecto urgente, vamos a utilizar el dinero recaudado para salvar a tantos árboles como sea posible, mientras seguimos buscando fondos para salvar más árboles.

Quiénes somos

La Asociación Cultural Na Bolom A.C., es una organización privada sin fines de lucro trabajando para reforestar las tierras altas de Chiapas, en México y lo hemos estado haciendo desde 1972.

¿Por qué es importante reforestación en Chiapas

Los árboles en peligro de muerte son una situación urgente, pero a largo plazo el objetivo del programa de reforestación es la recuperación de áreas boscosas de los Altos de Chiapas mediante el fortalecimiento del vivero de árboles nativos y un programa de reforestación social y comunitario.

Los resultados esperados del programa de reforestación de Na Bolom:

  • Reducir las emisiones derivadas de la deforestación y la degradación
  • Mitigar los efectos del cambio climático
  • Recuperar y recargar los depósitos naturales de agua
  • Disminución de la erosión del suelo
  • Disminución de las inundaciones en las partes bajas
  • Recuperación de la biodiversidad

Usted puede aprender más sobre los programas de Na Bolom en www.nabolom.org y en Na Bolom Facebook

Otras maneras que usted puede ayudar

También podemos utilizar su ayuda de otras maneras:

  • Pulse este mensaje a las redes sociales y el uso de las herramientas de participación IndieGoGo
  • Necesitamos voluntarios que nos ayuden a replantar los árboles lo más rápido posible (febrero-junio) - Por favor, póngase en contacto con nosotros si está interesado
  • Si se encuentra en Chiapas en el periodo de junio a septiembre, lo invitamos a ayudarnos a plantar los árboles en las tierras altas de Chiapas - por favor póngase en contacto con nosotros si está interesado

Gracias por su atención

Na Bolom información de contacto

  • e-mail: proyectos@nabolom.org
  • Teléfono: +52 967 6781418
  • Sitio web oficial: www.nabolom.org
  • Facebook site: www.facebook.com/na.bolom

Teléfono: +52 967 6781418
Sitio web oficial: www.nabolom.org

Facebook site: www.facebook.com/na.bolom
campaign_city: San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Mexico

story:
IN' Tents Tours the National and State Parks of the  

                       USA Summer of 2012

An outrageously funny, FREE performance about the  awesomeness of nature!

You can bring the ARTS and PARKS together to provide fun, educational programming to younger generations.

THE BIG PICTURE: The National Park system is in crisis. Funding is “nearly $400
million less than it was 10 years ago (NCPA.org)."

NO money means:

  • Elimination of environmental education programs in parks
  • Reduction in park rangers and job loss in parks
  • Closure of trails, fewer hours, and a degradation of park facilities
  • Elimination of conservation research aimed to protect our natural habitats and wildlife

The eradication of educational programming and park access will affect children the
most, leading to irresponsible camping practices, a lack of respect for our natural
heritage, and a loss of future conservationists.

How do we ensure our children become the stewards of our common future?

To combat the domino effect, we, Meghan Frank (USA), Pratik Motwani (India), and
Janessa Johnsrude (Canada) have created IN’ Tents: A Conservation Comedy in the Great Outdoors!

Our international artistic team will offer FREE workshops and a chaplin-esque comedy
performance with a message of conservation.

IN’ TENTS: Through hilarious misadventures, Park Ranger Patricia Pinky and first time camper Chipotle learn how to camp, hike, and preserve their natural spaces. Fun for the whole family! Slapstick! Audience participation!

THE TOUR: July through August of 2012, we will visit the Prairie Creek, Mill Creek,
and Jedediah Smith State Parks of California, Yosemite National Park, the Grand
Canyon, Rocky Mountain National Park, among many others!

IN’ Tents had been funded in part by the Puffin Foundation and is presented in
partnership with the US National park system.

But the Puffin Foundation does not cover all costs and we need your help to make this project possible.

YOUR DONATION WILL CONTRIBUTE TO:

Transportation - from California to Colorado 

Essential Camping Supplies - including tents, a camping stove, first aid kit, rope to hang our bear bags and other neccessary items

Workshop Materials/Props and Costumes - stilts and juggling scarves, prop
hiking backpack, water bottles, maps, and red noses for young campers, costumes for Chipolte and Pinky

Food - Our plan is to cook all of our meals on our camp stove, eat healthy and local, and we need your help to do so!

You can make a difference by bringing the ARTS and PARKS together! 

BACKGROUND: IN’ Tents is an ongoing project started in 2010 in India with
Rangeelay Theatre Ensemble, a performance and workshop series that reached thousandsof street children, pediatric cancer patients, students and teachers in Delhi and Mumbai in partnership with 10 international aid organizations.

Find out more on our website: www.intents.snappages.com
story_txt:
IN' Tents Tours the National and State Parks of the   

                       USA Summer of 2012

An outrageously funny, FREE performance about the  awesomeness of nature!
You can bring the ARTS and PARKS together to provide fun, educational programming to younger generations.
THE BIG PICTURE: The National Park system is in crisis. Funding is “nearly $400million less than it was 10 years ago (NCPA.org)."
NO money means:

Elimination of environmental education programs in parks
Reduction in park rangers and job loss in parks
Closure of trails, fewer hours, and a degradation of park facilities
Elimination of conservation research aimed to protect our natural habitats and wildlife
The eradication of educational programming and park access will affect children themost, leading to irresponsible camping practices, a lack of respect for our naturalheritage, and a loss of future conservationists.
How do we ensure our children become the stewards of our common future?
To combat the domino effect, we, Meghan Frank (USA), Pratik Motwani (India), andJanessa Johnsrude (Canada) have created IN’ Tents: A Conservation Comedy in the Great Outdoors!
Our international artistic team will offer FREE workshops and a chaplin-esque comedyperformance with a message of conservation.
IN’ TENTS: Through hilarious misadventures, Park Ranger Patricia Pinky and first time camper Chipotle learn how to camp, hike, and preserve their natural spaces. Fun for the whole family! Slapstick! Audience participation!
THE TOUR: July through August of 2012, we will visit the Prairie Creek, Mill Creek,and Jedediah Smith State Parks of California, Yosemite National Park, the GrandCanyon, Rocky Mountain National Park, among many others!
IN’ Tents had been funded in part by the Puffin Foundation and is presented inpartnership with the US National park system.
But the Puffin Foundation does not cover all costs and we need your help to make this project possible.
YOUR DONATION WILL CONTRIBUTE TO:
Transportation - from California to Colorado 
Essential Camping Supplies - including tents, a camping stove, first aid kit, rope to hang our bear bags and other neccessary items
Workshop Materials/Props and Costumes - stilts and juggling scarves, prophiking backpack, water bottles, maps, and red noses for young campers, costumes for Chipolte and Pinky
Food - Our plan is to cook all of our meals on our camp stove, eat healthy and local, and we need your help to do so!
You can make a difference by bringing the ARTS and PARKS together! 
BACKGROUND: IN’ Tents is an ongoing project started in 2010 in India withRangeelay Theatre Ensemble, a performance and workshop series that reached thousandsof street children, pediatric cancer patients, students and teachers in Delhi and Mumbai in partnership with 10 international aid organizations.
Find out more on our website: www.intents.snappages.com

story:
The residents of Closter, a small town in northern New Jersey, need your help. What is going on in our Borough is a travesty that we feel helpless to prevent. It is affecting the safety and wellbeing of thousands of Borough residents.

Background

The Brooks Farm in Closter, the oldest continuously operating family farm in New Jersey, dates back to the 18th Century. It is also listed as a National Landmark recognized for its significance in American History and is also protected by the NJ State as a Historical site. In 2004 the State paid over $2.5 million to the then-owner of the farm for the conservation, preservation and development rights so that future generations would continue to enjoy it.

Stop the Greed

This changed abruptly when the farm was sold to a large chain of plant manufacturers in early 2012. Masquerading as a farm, this industrial enterprise is rapidly erasing this pristine chapter of the State’s history all while hiding behind the protection of the Right to Farm Act. In a short span of a few weeks they cut close to a hundred centuries old trees, began massive construction of industrial retaining walls to contain a huge amount of brought in soil affecting protected C1 streams, pounded the soil using heavy industrial equipment making it virtually impervious, re-graded the property, etc. No plans were presented to municipal authorities nor were any permits requested as the Act’s protections preempt local jurisdiction. The enterprise in development is being planned to support the supply chain of the wholesale and retail operations of the plant factory and will create heavy commercial traffic in the quaint historic district of town with all safety, environmental, flooding, and water contamination and pollution concerns stemming from it.

There has been a loud outcry from our residents to enforce our ordinances in order to protect their health, safety and welfare and yet we are superseded by the Farm Act. The Borough and a group of concerned residents filed a complaint with the County Board of Agriculture. In addition, the residents filed a lawsuit for restraining further development of the property until complaints are adjudicated.

A portion of the tax dollars of the residents of the Bergen County and the State of New Jersey were spent supposedly to preserve this land but instead have been used to subsidize the corporation's purchase of the property (tax dollars paid about 2/3 of the price of the land, corporation paid 1/3).

What We Need

We need your help and contributions so we can continue with our efforts to save this 302 year old farm from the hands of corporate greed. Unfortunately, the time and tireless effort of many concerned residents of Closter are not simply enough in this matter. Fighting corporations does not come at a low cost, and we are in desperate needs of funds to pay the group's attorney. It is a battle that needs to be fought in the courts, and as most know, legal fees are no bargain.

Any donations you can give would be greatly appreciated.

story:
[English below]

Une importante mobilisation contre les oléoducs et l’exploitation des hydrocarbures se prépare au Québec.

On se met en marche!

Du 10 mai au 14 juin 2014, des dizaines de personnes marcheront en moyenne 20 km par jour pendant 34 jours, de Cacouna à Kanehsa:tàke, afin de sensibiliser et renforcer la mobilisation contre l’arrivée des oléoducs de sables bitumineux et les projets d’exploitation des hydrocarbures au Québec. Les marcheurs.euses s’arrêteront chaque soir pour rencontrer les communautés par le biais de spectacles engagés et de discussions sur ces enjeux qui nous touchent tous et toutes directement.

         

C’est une marche créative et festive, où les citoyen.ne.s se rencontrent pour mettre un frein aux projets d’oléoducs d’Enbridge et de TransCanada, dans un esprit de solidarité entre les communautés et entre les peuples.

Cette marche veut continuer les efforts de sensibilisation, renforcer les réseaux de mobilisation et de résistance, bref, élargir le mouvement pour qu’on fasse de meilleurs choix énergétiques!


10 raisons pour soutenir la marche :

1. La compagnie Enbridge est responsable de plus d’une fuite par semaine depuis les 10 dernières années.

2. Enbridge est aussi responsable du plus grand déversement de pétrole en sol nord-américain, à Kalamazoo en 2010.

3. La ligne 9B d'Enbridge menace directement l’eau potable de près de 3 millions de citoyen.ne.s.

4. L’oléoduc Énergie Est de TransCanada transporterait 1,1 million de barils de pétrole par jour : 4 fois la consommation quotidienne du Québec. Les deux projets d'oléoducs transporteraient près des deux tiers de la production actuelle totale des sables bitumineux.

5. L’exploitation des sables bitumineux d’Alberta est le plus grand projet industriel de la planète et l’un des plus grands contributeurs aux changements climatiques.

6. La nation crie de Beaver Lake où se passe une partie de l’exploitation des sables bitumineux a recensé plus de 20 000 violations à ses traités territoriaux.

7. Le gouvernement fédéral subventionne l’industrie pétrolière à hauteur de 1,38 milliards de dollars par année.

8. 20 municipalités et 6 MRC ont adopté des résolutions sur les oléoducs. Plus de 100 groupes citoyens de partout au Québec refusent le passage des oléoducs et l’exploitation des hydrocarbures.

9. L’Office Nationale de l’Énergie vient d’approuver le renversement du flux de la ligne 9B d’Enbridge. Ni l’ONÉ ni le gouvernement québécois n’ont écouté les citoyen.ne.s. Il est temps de prendre la parole !

10. On pourra réaliser ce projet seulement avec votre aide!


Pourquoi le financement ?

Il est très important pour nous que la marche soit accessible à tous et toutes. C’est pourquoi nous travaillons en ce moment même avec les communautés tout au long de la route pour limiter le plus possible les dépenses.

Mais nous avons quand même besoin de vous! Nous aurons beaucoup de bouches à nourrir, de l’information et une trousse de mobilisation à diffuser, du matériel à acheter, des artistes locaux à encourager, et bien plus encore.

   

Si nous atteignons le but fixé avec un surplus (soyons optimises, on en est capables!), les fonds seront redistribués pour soutenir les communautés rencontrées dans leurs actions contre les oléoducs et les hydrocarbures.

Nous vous demandons de contribuer à la marche à la hauteur de vos moyens. Chaque cents aidera à faire de cette marche une réalité!

Le Québec, le Canada et les Premières nations sont mobilisés.

Rejoignez le mouvement!

Aidez-nous à faire de la marche une réalité!


Venez marcher avec nous, que ce soit un mois ou une après-midi!

Parlez de la marche autour de vous!

Et surtout… MERCI.


Restez à l’écoute pour des mises à jour tout au long
de la campagne Indiegogo!

Écrivez-nous à: peuplespourterremere@gmail.com

Carte interactive de la marche: https://mapsengine.google.com/map/edit?mid=zok0f8Eax0TI.kfqTiVk4c1L0



***  *** ***  *** *** ***


There is an important mobilization happening in Quebec against the pipelines and fossil fuels!

Let's start walking!


From May 10 to June 14, 2014, dozens of people will walk about 20 km per day during 34 days from Cacouna to Kanehsa:take to raise awareness and reinforce the mobilization against tar sands pipelines and fossil fuel extraction in Quebec. The walkers will stop in communities along the path: every evening, they will perform an activist-artistic show and hold discussions about these issues, which directly affect us all.

This will be a creative and festive walk. Citizens will meet to put an end to the Enbridge’s and TransCanada’s pipeline projects, in the spirit of solidarity between communities and between peoples.

This walk aims to continue awareness efforts already underway, to reinforce our networks of mobilization and to grow the movement so we can make better energy choices!


10 reasons why you should support the walk:

1. Enbridge is responsible for more than one spill a week over the past 10 years.

2. Enbridge is also responsible for the biggest spill on North American soil, which happened in Kalamazoo in 2010.

3. Enbridge's Line 9B directly threatens the drinking water of nearly 3 million citizens.

4. Transcanada’s Energy East pipeline will transport 1.1 million barrels of oil per day: that is 3 times the daily consumption of Quebec. The two pipeline projects would transport almost 2/3 of what's currently produced in the tar sands.

5. The tar sands of Alberta is the biggest industrial project on the planet and is a major contributor to climate change.

6. The Beaver Lake Cree nation, where part of the tar sands exploitation takes place, have documented 20 000 treaty violations.

7. The Canadian government subsidizes the oil industry up to 1.38 billion dollars per year.

8. 20 municipalities and 6 RCMs adopted resolutions against pipelines. More than 100 citizen groups everywhere in Quebec refuse the crossing of the pipelines and the exploitation of hydrocarbons.

9. The National Energy Board has just approved Enbridge’s Line9 project. The NEB and the government of Quebec have decided not to listen to us. It is time we take a stand!

10. We can make this happen, but only with your help!


Why crowdfunding?


It is very important for us that the walk is accessible to everyone. This is why we are working with communities along the road to help us on our journey and keep costs down.

Yet, we still need you. We have a lot of mouths to feed, an information kit to share, materials to buy, local artists to encourage and much more.

    

If we exceed our goal (let’s be optimistic, because we can!), the funds will be redistributed to the local communities that we have met during the walk, to help them in the actions they will take against pipelines and fossil fuel extraction.

We ask you to help us with what you can afford. Every penny will help in making this walk a reality!

First Nations, Québécois and Canadians are united and mobilized.

Join the movement!


Come walk with us a day, a week or a month. Talk about it to everyone around you!

And most of all...Thank you!


Stay tuned for updates throughout the Indiegogo campaign!

Write to us: peuplespourterremere@gmail.com

See an interactive map of the walk: https://mapsengine.google.com/map/edit?mid=zok0f8Eax0TI.kfqTiVk4c1L0

story:
The honeybee population is dwindling at very alarming rate. With such things as the overuse and misuse of chemicals such as pesticides and insecticides the honey bee population is suffering.

What many people don't take into consideration is that without bees for pollination our food supply will be change dramatically. Fruits, vegetables as well as many other crops all need pollination.

Over the past several years I have been slowly increasing the number of hives I maintain. As you can imagine this is not a cheap project but it is very rewarding at least trying to make a difference. The way the bee colonies function is nothing short of amazing. 

Our Goal:

With your support, we will be able to add several new honeybee colonies, including the purchase of honeybees and equipment to our current bee yard. We continually work to provide a protected permanent habitat for the honeybees by giving them plenty of hives to live in and each year planting more and more plants, trees and shrubs that provide them with pollen and nectar. We operate a produce stand during the summer which has been a great place to teach people of the importance of honeybees and the importance of their pollination to our food supply.  In addition to the extra colonies we want to purchase an observation hive that can be used at the produce stand to further teaching about bees. 

What do you get in return?

We will send you rewards of our pure honey, honey sticks and handmade lip balm from our hives.  You will be listed on our website as a supporter.  Most importantly is the satisfaction of knowing you have made a difference in helping to save the honeybees.

How can you help?

Click the Contribute button towards the top right of the page or any Claim this Perk button on the right  

If you can not help financially, we could also use help in spreading the word about our project, please tell your friends and share a link to our project.  Your support is greatly appreciated.

Here are some very informative links:

About  Honey Bees:
http://insects.tamu.edu/fieldguide/cimg341.html
 
 
Benefits of Bees:
http://www.new-ag.info/00-5/focuson/focuson8.html
 
  
Pollination Facts:
http://www.abfnet.org/displaycommon.cfm?an=1&subarticlenbr=14
 
 
Great resource pertaining to the Benefits of Honey:
http://www.benefits-of-honey.com/
