 (Español) en nuestro continente hay más de 563.000 caficultores los cuales se ven
afectados por la fluctuación del dólar, cuando venden sus productos, generando
bajos ingresos para sus familias. 

Re-using wastes to produce a substitute for wood tackles 3 key
environmental and social issues of our region of influence in Colombia:
1) 
CO2 emissions: In our first year of operations we
will recycle 300.000 kg of plastic waste and 192.000 kg of agro-industrial
waste thus preventing the production of 35.136 ton of CO2.  
2) 
Deforestation: As a substitute for wood for
furniture production, our mix saves the lives of more than 2.000 trees per
year.
3) 
Unemployment among the most vulnerable: 
a. 
We will create 300 indirect jobs
among recyclers from whom we will source plastic wastes. Recyclers are the
poorest and most vulnerable social group in the region.
b. 
We will create 250 indirect jobs
among Coffee farmers whom we will source coffee wastes from (Vegetable Fiber)
 (Español) en Diseclar reciclamos los desechos para producir un producto que reemplaza
a la madera, con lo cual generamos 3 impactos positivos ambientales y sociales
en nuestra región. 
1) 
Emisión de CO2: en el primer año de
operaciones esperamos reciclar mas 300.000 kg de desechos plásticos y más de
192.000 kg de desechos agro-industriales, con lo cual lograremos retenes más de
35.136 toneladas de CO2
2) 
Deforestación: reemplazando del uso de la madera en la fabricación de
mobiliario lograremos salvar más de 2.000 árboles. 
3) 
Empleo a personas vulnerables:
a.  Crearemos más de 300 empleos indirectos a recicladores quienes son nuestro
principal proveedor de materia prima. Los recicladores son personas de bajos
recursos y vulnerables en nuestra región.
b.   Crearemos más de 250 empleos
indirectos a caficultores, quienes son nuestro proveedor de la fibra
vegetal. 


News about Diseclar (Noticias sobre Diseclar)







 

 



 

 




 

 



 

 








Diseclar had been recognized by some international and national awards:


Innovation Javeriana Contest, Colombia.
Fondo Emprender, Colombia.
Ventures, Colombia.

CSR (corporate social responsibility) - Comfamiliar, Colombia

BID Juventud, BID, USA.
SEED Award, UNEP, Kenya.
Stephan Schmidheiny Awards, CIC, Costa Rica

 (Español) Diseclar ha sido reconcido por ciertos premios Internacionales y nacionales como:


Concurso de inovacion Javeriana, Colombia.
Fondo Emprender, Colombia.
Ventures, Colombia.
Premio a la Responsabilidad Social Empresarial - Comfamiliar, Colombia.
BID Juventud, BID, USA.
SEED Award, UNEP, Kenya.
Stephan Schmidheiny Awards, CIC, Costa Rica

Features (Características)


Contribution
Perks 



Electronic Certificate: 10 USD, an electronic certificate of your support.(certificado electrónico: 10 USD, un
certificado electrónico por su apoyo en nuestra campaña)


Your name in our company: 20 USD, your name and your country will appear in the wall of our new
headquarters. (Su nombre en nuestra compañía: 20 USD,
escribiremos su nombre y país en la portada de nuestra nueva sede).


Diseclar`s Candles: 35 USD, set of
3 candles produced with our material, they will have your name and Diseclar’s
Logo. (Velas de Diseclar: 35 USD, juego
de 3 velas producidas con nuestro material, las cuales vendrán marcadas con su
nombre y el logo de Diseclar.










Adopt a tree: 70 USD, we will
plant a tree on your behalf in our City Cali, Colombia. (Adopta un árbol: 70 USD,
sembraremos un árbol en nuestra ciudad Cali, Colombia).


WEAR “I am Green”: 60 USD, Limited
edition T-shirt (unisex) with Diseclar Logo and with a label that reads “I am
Green”. (Vístete con la campaña “I am Green”: 60 USD, Edición Limitada de una camiseta unisex con el logo de diseclar
y con la marca “I am Green”).








LIMITED EDITION Farallones Bench: 500 USD, Limited Edition Farallones Bench, produced with our material and
with your name and Diseclar’s Logo on it + T-shirt + Candle + Electronic
Certificate. (EDICION LIMITADA Banca Farallones: 500 USD, Edición
Limitada de la banca Farallones producida con nuestro material y marcada con su
nombre y logo de Diseclar + una camiseta + certificado electrónico).


Amazing trip to our factory: 3.000 USD, 4 day trip to our headquarters and production facilities.
The event will happen in 2016. Includes 5*Hotel
accommodation, local
transportation and a visit to the Coffee Park (www.parquedelcafe.co) in Armenia City (includes meals, entrance ticket and transportation).
Airplane tickets are not included. (Gran Viaje a nuestra fábrica: 3.000 USD, 4 días
de viaje a nuestra nueva sede. El evento se llevara a cabo en el 2016 en la
inauguración de la compañía. Incluye: acomodación en Hotel 5 estrellas,
transporte local y una visita al parque del café (www.parquedelcafe.co) en la ciudad de Armenia (incluye comidas, entrada al parque y
transporte). Ticket de avión no está include. 











Also,
please support us with your vote (también nos puedes ayudar con tu voto)

We are
currently participating in The Venture from Chivas Regal global contest. We
need your vote to support our venture. During 5 week you can vote up to 1 time
per week. You can use your Facebook or Google+ id to vote for us. To vote for
us go on https://www-staging.theventure.com/gb/en/finalists/diseclar. Voting starts on May 11th and ends on June 14th. 
 (Español) Estamos participando en el
concurso global The Venture de Chivas Regal. Necesitamos su voto, este proceso
dura 5 semanas donde puede votar cada semana. Con el usuario de facebook o de
Google + puede votar por Diseclar. Las votaciones se hacen en el siguiente link
https://www-staging.theventure.com/gb/en/finalists/diseclar e inician
el próximo 11 de mayo hasta el 14 de junio. 
Please share with your friends and family our campaign in Indiegogo.
Follow us: 
Instagram: @Diseclar
Twitter: @Diseclar
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Diseclar?ref=hl
Thanks for your help.
What We Need
We need to raise additional capital: USD 100.000 to open up new markets
and increase the social and environmental impact in our region. We have already
identified potential new clients in United States, Mexico and Costa Rica, but we
currently lack the production capacity required to meet this demand. An
increase in production capacity would also help us have a far greater impact
environmentally and socially, as we would be able to further help the waste
collecting community and coffee farmers of Colombia.
 (Español) Buscamos levantar USD 100.000 para abrir nuevos mercados e incrementar
nuestro impacto social y ambiental en nuestra región. Tenemos clientes
potenciales en países como Estados Unidos, México y Costa Rica, pero no
contamos con la capacidad de producción para atender esta demanda.
Incrementando nuestra capacidad de producción lograremos tener un impacto
social y ambiental más alto, ayudando a los caficultores y recicladores de
nuestro país. 
The Team (equipo de trabajo)


Our cofounder and CEO, an industrial engineer, he is a
specialist in CSR (corporate social responsibility). Born and raised in Colombia,
he will represent us at The Venture final.

 (Español) Fundador y Director Ejecutivo, ingeniero industrial, especialista en
Responsabilidad Social Empresarial. Nació y creció en Colombia, será la persona
que representara a Diseclar en el concurso de The Venture. 



Industrial engineer from Switzerland helps us reach
new markets throughout Central America

 (Español) ingeniero industrial, nació en Suiza, y nos ayuda en  la apertura de nuevos mercados en Centro
América. 


She is our business administrator, Monica has a Masters
degree in Logistic, she is from Colombia and helps us
improve all internal processes in Diseclar
 (Español) Administradora de empresas, tiene una maestría
en logística, nació en Colombia y nos ayuda en el mejoramiento de los procesos
internos de Diseclar.


Electronic engineer, from Colombia, leads our
marketing strategy
 (Español) Ingeniero Eléctrico, lidera las estrategias de mercadeo de la empresa.

story:
PROJECT DESCRIPTION

Target students: Aging 10-15 from a public school in Talbeya, Al Haram

Purpose: Students will take the water education and awareness message to the World Water Forum in South Korea in April 2015. Students will present the programme as an example of how to build children’s confidence – through education and awareness – and address water challenges facing communities and families, both locally and internationally.


Brief Outline of Programme Activities

1)  Work with partners to identify and invite the students to participate in our programme from Egyptian National and Experimental schools in impoverished areas.

2)  Have the students conduct field research and explore salient water issues in Egypt.

3)  Develop “Water Awareness Aids” as teaching tools for schools. The aids will offer relevant and meaningful materials to increase awareness and highlight needed changes in personal and community behaviors. The aids will be used by the “core students” to instruct students, teachers, and community members how to evaluate local water problems and help find solutions.

4)  Teach students about water awareness and how to approach water problems in an environmentally conscientious and sustainable way via a series of two workshops.

5)  Attempt to bring water related women’s issues, water equity, and water related health concerns to the forefront through education and awareness in schools, villages, and communities.

6)  Encourage students to be “agents of change” by promoting dialogue between Egyptian officials and Egyptian students.

7)  Empower students to appeal to the authority for policy changes that will alleviate specific local water issues.


P.S: If we fail to collect the needed amount of money, your contribution would still go to local fieldtrips for these students and your names would show on our annual review.

story:
Down for "ENGLISH VERSION"

 L'idée est de construire avec un budget et un temps réduit, un catamaran doté d'une motorisation électrique performante et pouvant compenser en continu une partie ou totalité de l'énergie consommée pour avancer. De cette façon, ce bateau à moteur sera aussi vertueux qu'un voilier sans devoir avoir de compétences particulières pour le manœuvrer. Il reprends à la fois les avantages d'un voilier (écologie et silence) et d'un bateau à moteur ( ligne droite et rapidité).

La solution globale utilisera toutes les sources d'énergies disponibles sur l'eau avec l'objectif d'en faire un démonstrateur écologique, éducatif et ludique . Pourquoi pas faire venir des écoliers pour leur donner l'envie de travailler dans ce domaine d'activité !... Ou d'en faire un projet pilote avec la commune qui accueillera le bateau (Place déjà en location personnelle)

Ce projet se veut collaboratif et constructif, il pourra susciter des envies de projets identiques sur la base développée, 

Je suis parti du constat que dans la grande majorité des "day boats" les utilisateurs font des sorties pour rejoindre leur point de baignade ou de pèche favori d'une demie journée. Cela se résume souvent à 1/2 voir 1 heure de navigation "allez" et idem "retour" . Entre deux, le bateau peut ainsi rester plusieurs heures sans bouger. Une fois le bateau rentré au port il est peut fréquent qu'il faille le réutiliser le jour même ou le lendemain .

La solution technique que j'ai choisie tient compte de ces paramètres.

The idea is to build with a low budget and a short time, a light catamaran with a powerful electric motor and self compensate energy.

The overall solution will use all available eco sources of energy with the aim of making an ecological and high performances demonstrator, educational and fun.

Why not bring schoolchildren to give them the desire to work in this field of activity! ... Or to make a pilot project with the town to house the boat (Place already own rental)

This project is collaborative and constructive; it may elicit cravings identical projects developed on the same basis.

I started from the observation that in the vast majority of "day boats" users make trips to reach their point of swimming or fishing favorite half a day. This often sail 1 or 1/2 hour "go" and same to  "back". The boat can remain several hours without moving. Once the boat returned to port it is not frequently that it should be use another time the same day.

The technical solution we chose reflects these parameters.



Afin de limiter les dépenses, je vais utiliser des coques déjà existantes. Mon choix c'est porté sur un modèle fabriqué en France dans les années 80 par un petit chantier maintenant disparu. Le FrenchCat est un catamaran de 7.10m x 3.55m de moins de 700kg, Il est insubmersible, robuste, et doté d'un pont plat  idéal pour y rajouter les infrastructures nécessaires . J''aime aussi le coté écolo de la récupération d'un viel objet pour le réhabiliter plutôt que de prévoir une construction totale ( en plus incompatible avec le petit budget et le temps que je me suis donné pour réaliser ce projet)

To reduce expenses, I will use existing shells. My choice is focused on a model  made in France in the 80s by a small shipyard now gone. The FrenchCat is a catamaran 7.10mx 3.55m less than 700kg, is unsinkable, robust and with a perfect dish bridge will add the necessary infrastructure. We like as the green side of retrieving an old object to rehabilitate rather than providing a total construction (in addition incompatible with the budget and the time I gave myself for this project)



Mes connaissances dans le nautisme sont élevées car j'avais 8 ans quand j'ai navigué pour la première fois ! Je suis né dans une famille de navigateurs....Depuis j'ai forgé une solide expérience .

Ma vision actuelle du monde ou nous vivons n'est pas très positive, mais je reste persuadé que l'homme pourra trouver les ressources et les idées pour mieux vivre dans le futur , surtout vis à vis de l'environnement . Je suis depuis 10 ans un petit constructeur de VTT électriques ( www.ecolostation.com) et j'ai développé un tas de solutions techniques sur vélos, scooters , trottinettes, voitures hybrides ou électriques ! Il ne manquait plus qu'un bateau ! , 


Le budget de ce projet est très réduit. Il n'inclus pas l'achat des coques qui a déjà été effectué. Cette somme va servir à choisir les meilleurs composants techniques pour que les objectifs soient atteints . 

  • Des panneaux solaires souples et légers ( choix de la techno en cours) pour une puissance de 3000w crête  environ
  • Des éoliennes  de 400w (2)
  • Une batterie de 9kw/H  lithium 
  • Un chargeur 3kw 220v
  • Un groupe électrogène 48v 2kw ( secours)
  • 2 moteurs Hors bord de 5kw chacun
  • Un bateau qui va rester léger

Ce projet comporte aussi des objectifs annexes :

L'esprit écolo du projet doit rester présent dans le fil conducteur des procédés utilisés

  • Peintures écoologiques sans solvants ou polluants
  • Peinture antifouling sans chimie agressive
  • Plancher du bateau en liége compressé
  • Filtration de l'eau de surface du port d'attache (hydrocarbures)
  • Tissus des sieges en fibres naturelles

Votre implication dans ce projet, va, à la fois vérifier que vous voulez contribuer à ce que de nouvelles solutions soient trouvées pour continuer à pratiquer nos loisirs mais sans pour autant rejeter du CO2 ( gaz à effet de serre qui détraque le climat...) mais aussi de pouvoir vous convaincre que l'électrique c'est le présent et non pas l'avenir ! 

Chacune de vos donations seront récompensées par une invitation à découvrir ce catamaran électrique pour un baptême, une journée ou davantage! Découvrir en live la sensation de glisser sur l'eau sans bruits ni vibrations, de contrôler l’énergie produite pas les panneaux ou les éoliennes et se dire ... c'est génial !

Le catamaran électro solaire en images !

My knowledge in boating is high since I was 8 years old when I sailed for the first time!

I am born in a family of browsers.... Since I have built a solid experience.

My current vision of the world we live in is not very positive, but I am convinced that man can find resources and ideas to live better in the future, especially with respect to the environment. I am 10 years a small manufacturer of electric bike (www.ecolostation.com) and I developed a lot of technical solutions on bicycles, scooters, scooters, electric or hybrid cars! It was missing was a boat! ,

 Visit my web site : WWW.ECOLOSTATION.COM

The budget for this project is very small. It does not include the purchase of the hulls which have already been taken. This amount will be used to select the best technical components for the objectives are achieved.

• Flexible and lightweight solar panels (choice of the current techno) for a power 3000w peak around

• Wind turbines from 400w (2)

• A battery of 9kw / H Lithium

• A charger 220v 3kw

• A generator 2kw 48v (emergency)

• 2 motors Outboard 5kw each

• A boat will remain light

The project also includes annexes objectives:

The green spirit of the project should remain present in the thread of the processes used

• ecologic paints without solvents or pollutants

• Antifouling paint without aggressive chemicals

• Boat compressed cork floor

• Surface Water filtration from home port (hydrocarbons)

• Cloth seats of natural fibers

Your involvement in this project will both confirm that you want to contribute to that new solutions be found to continue practicing our leisure but without rejecting CO2 (greenhouse gas climate haywire ... ) but also to be able to convince you that the power is the present and not the future!

Each of your donations will be rewarded with an invitation to discover the electric catamaran for a baptism, a day or more! Discover live the sensation of gliding on the water with no noise or vibration, control the energy not produced panels or wind turbines and say ... it's great!

The solar electric catamaran images!



Partager ce projet sur vos réseaux sociaux  , se sera déjà d'une grande aide !

Merci à tous

story:
Campaign Complete visit us at www.santatierra.com


Short Summary

 Let’s put conservation of primary rainforest into the limelight. An invitation to be a part of a long-term conservation project with revolutionary consequences.

Social Entrepreneurism

Given the conditions under which these trees grow, it’s hard to find a more “organic” product than the Brazil nut. With a yet to be popularized forest product at our finger tips, a food that originates from nature’s heights and vast wilds, infused with the potency of the rainy season, we have the essential ingredient to make this a successful business while meeting our first-line mission.

While there is no single or conclusive definition of social entrepreneurism, our intention in using it to capture our business model is to highlight Santa Tierra Castañal’s central mission of meeting important environmental and social goals. Protecting primary forest in Peru’s Mother of God region and increasing the value of our team’s expertise while preserving the art of Brazil nut harvesting are the first measures of our bottom line success. Yet, to be sustainable without on-going cyclical fundraisers beyond this crowd funding launch, (which would nudge it into the non-profit sector), we must make the venture healthy and profitable into the future. 


Paula Givan, the foundation and the vision

As a North American I’ve carried purpose and a passion to act as a change agent by ushering in an impactful project.

My relationship to Peru’s SE jungle started in 2008 with more than a decade of travels throughout the country already under my belt. The art, poetry and heritage of the Brazil nut trees touched me from the start.

Returning to Colorado from Peru in September of 2015, one of more than 40 trips spanning 20 years, I flew by way of El Salvador where decades ago, my relationship with Latin America began. My head nodded to my life-long commitment to Latin American studies and Spanish language fluency while my heart paused with the memories of people I knew and loved during my formative years in both El Salvador and  Guatemala. I’ve witnessed and studied the environmental devastation and multiple other effects of long-standing civil war in each of these countries over many years. I left El Salvador last September certain that my moment for launching this project is now.

With pleasure, I have the opportunity to focus eight years of working experience in the Madre de Dios region into this vision. With excitement, I’m ready to share it with those who want to join me in making a commitment to preserve in-tact forest.

I hold a degree in Small Business Management and Entrepreneurship from the University of Colorado in Boulder.

My Modern Languages degree comes from Metropolitan State University of Denver.

I’ve earned an unofficial Latin American Studies degree over decades of personal investigation and research, travel and direct experience.

Endorsement 

"Paula was my student over several years throughout her degree program.

In her projects Paula demonstrated that thinking of others is not something abstract, but rather a fascinating process of commitment.

Her managing this level of commitment helps me believe more firmly in creative solutions to the challenges of this folly of continuing to destroy our planet, still without thought or feeling."

Roberto Forns Broggi phd., Metropolitan State University of Denver,  author of Nudos como estrellas: ABC de la imaginación ecológica en nuestras Américas, Nido de cuervos, Lima, 2012.

English version: Knots like Stars: ABC of Ecological Imaginations in Our Americas. Cambridge Scholars, (NY - London)  publishing forthcoming, 2016.

Primary versus secondary forest

In our lifetime we cannot replace what has taken hundreds and in some cases thousands of years to grow naturally. Primary or virgin forest means forest that stands in-tact, a place that has managed to elude significant human logging activities. 

Brazil nut trees themselves are one of the indicators of primary forest in this part of the Amazon. The trees’ intimate and fertile dance with the orchid bee and agouti can only happen in the rich diversity of in-tact forest. Where there are thriving areas of Brazil nut trees, primary forest still reigns.

Reasons for taking a protective stance on behalf of the environment in this region include roughly 2773 resident vertebrate species comprised of: 

mammals – 460, birds – 1701, reptiles – 297, amphibians – 315. 

The jaguar and macaw are among the residents of this property, specifically.


Secondary forest is forest that has lost its integrity from heavy selective logging or in the worst of cases, from indiscriminate destruction.

Reasons for deforestation in the region include illegal clearing of the forest for fine wood and lumber exportation, conversion of the forest for agriculture and raising cattle, mining and petroleum exploration, urbanization and construction; all are human survival tactics with short term gains and long-term consequences.


The art and heritage of the harvest cycle

The Brazil nut trees’ unique relationship to humans arises from it being the producer of a non timber forest product that people have collected for hundreds of years from the very trees that have produced for hundreds of years. By comparison, most human activity in the forest that is not restorative (reforestation) or protective (conservation and tourism) is in the long-run, not sustainable, and most often harmful.


The annual Brazil nut harvest is an organic expression of cycles in the jungle and a celebration of the cooperative exchange between humans and nature. However, this exchange hinges on a delicate balance of variables that add up to the necessity for keeping the forest healthy. With the balanced activities of the agouti and the orchid bee, along with sustainable harvesting practices, the trees regenerate and thrive.

The collection process:

During the early months of the new year, the ripe Brazil nuts housed in wooden spheres called “cocos” weighing roughly 2 kilos free-fall in a dramatic showering from massive heights, slippery and wet with rain. Meanwhile in town, teams of harvesters purchase food and assemble sleeping and cooking supplies in preparation for the approaching 4-6 week work-period spent in the deep forest under the colossal canopy.

Once in the forest, the team spends nights sharpening machetes by the light of the fire while discussing the following day’s tactics in consideration of the intricate tree inventory map, a master plan that includes strategically placed collection centers spread over 3000 acres. Days are spent alternately, one day collecting the cocos into huge mounds, and the next, sitting on the forest floor, back-to-back with a partner or against a tree, opening the cocos that demand several hard machete strikes to yield.

For many who work the nuts the next step is to simply sell them to one of the large nut companies. This implies a limited value for their labor, falling to the whim of market prices for the year. For others, further efforts might be taken to dry and remove the nut’s inner shell, these steps increasing slightly, the value of their labor.



Post harvest:

Nuts will either stay local or be destined for international export markets. For those staying close to home they are sold in one of several markets taking center stage in several dishes and sauces popular in local cuisine. For those that are exported, the nuts go through rigorous processes including sorting, drying and periodic inspections, all necessary to meet US and European standards.

Human diversity in nature

Peru’s Madre de Dios region is a nexus of bio-diversity and a long-standing frontier for human diversity. Farmers and growers populate the same landscape that native groups and locals have survived in for centuries. Loggers and gold miners mix with many of the worlds leading scientists, conservationists and tour companies. The number of attorneys, copy centers, office supply stores and bureaucratic offices with long lines and brutal wait times intimate the defensive, survival of the fittest climate of living day-to-day against a priceless backdrop of one of the earth’s most critical landscapes. All these collide in a town that hums at the pace of a bee hive, where competing players from wide interests are known to eat and drink in the same restaurants and bars and to pray in the same churches.

Questions and Answers

What does it mean when I adopt a tree? Do I own it?

The benefit to you of putting your name on a plaque at the base of an ancient old growth Brazil nut tree in the rainforest is the knowing that you are making a statement that preserving primary forest is important to you. We do not “own” the trees.

What is innovative about this project?

Conservation projects in the region generally fall into non-profit work. The nature of the non-profit model implies depending on ongoing fundraising efforts to keep the vision alive. Instead, this is a pioneering business model that is asking for initial funding to get off the ground on the right foot. By raising awareness of the value of the product, and by maintaining the strength of our team through fair wages and quality working conditions we are standing on a strong foundation to be profitable into the future. In this way we are self-sustaining and Santa Tierra Castañal is positioned as a leader. Everything about this is innovative.

What does sustainability mean?

Endurance is a good synonym and related to this project it applies in three regards.

1. Sustainability of the forest implies longevity, diversity, and productivity of the intricately connected natural systems at play at all times.

2. Sustainable harvest practices imply an understanding that humans are the visitors, even while “working the land” while plants, animals and insects are the residents. Specifically, no hunting policies and consequent respect and care for all full time residents are priorities. Staff awareness of the delicate inter-connectivity of the above systems and allowing for the conditions necessary for regeneration of the trees are emphasized.

3. Sustainability of the business means not only keeping this area safe and protected by having the resources and security of staying in compliance with the government but also evolving our business  such that it stands independent of the need for constant or even periodic fundraisers. Sustainability of the business means that we stand out as a leader in the region and the industry.

Are you a scientist? 

Ha, that makes me laugh! Rather, I’ve spent a lion’s share of time in bureaucratic offices over 8 years while connected to several projects. I’ve tenaciously and successfully attended to paper work and requirements necessary to stay in compliance with government agencies, while forming forward reaching business relationships. I truthfully tell friends that I’ve spent more time with my Peruvian attorney in the last 8 years than with any other person in my life. However, I’ve met many scientists who do the important work of studying the region by carefully cataloging its rich resources while recording the impact and consequences of rapid change.

 Why are Brazil nut trees in Peru? Do they grow elsewhere?

In short, the tree does not recognize borders. The trees grow widely in healthy forest in Peru, Brazil, Bolivia, Colombia and Venezuela. In SE Peru, the tree and the nut are called “castaña”. The castaña trees are widely dispersed across the rainforest, growing in clusters of 50 to 100 or so individuals.. The harvesters are called “castañeros” and a high density area of the trees is called a “castañal”. Its’ scientific name is Bertholletia excelsa

The Impact

What are the benefits to the region and its people?

The people who depend on the forest for their livelihoods must be incentivized to preserve the forest instead of converting the land to other uses such as unsustainable timber harvesting, single crop farming or cattle ranching. Securing and maintaining a fair price for Brazil nuts through certification processes that bring a better price at market is a significant step forward towards assuring that the trees live, thrive, reproduce and produce.

Brazil nut oil in cooking

 Its delicate nutty flavor, texture and body makes the oil best suited for drizzling, salad dressings, pesto and lower temperature cooking. Drizzle over grains or veggies like asparagus and broccoli with a squeeze of lemon salt and pepper. Yum. 

Brazil nut oil has a smoke point of 408°F, compared to olive oil with a smoke point of 405°F and grape seed oil with a smoke point of 399°F making it safe for low to medium heat sautéing and baking in both savory and sweet dishes. Although safe for cooking the oil may lose some of the antioxidant health benefits when heated.

Brazil Nuts and Nutrition

A food that originates from nature’s heights and wilds it is infused with the potency of the rainy season and carries an obvious nutritional punch. Brazil nuts are high in minerals, healthy fats, and are a complete protein. Both a seed and a fruit, topical and internal uses of Brazil nuts are consistently producing astounding results.

Some highlights: go to www.santatierra.com for nutritional details

Our Team

Santatierra.com has current updates.

story:
Cheetah conservation status

The estimated number of wild cheetahs in South Africa is around 500 and there are only around 7500 remaining in the wild in Africa.  With wild cheetah populations are losing their fight for survival as a result of continued habitat destruction and the depletion of genetic viability, every wild cheetah is super important.  Each individual animal’s life should be protected and conserved as they could very well represent the last of their kind; they could just contain the genes necessary to ensure the survival of their species that has been fighting a losing battle for survival against the need of the super species; Man.

Who are we:

My name is Louise Joubert and I am the founder trustee of the SanWild Wildlife Trust in South Africa.  Our trust was formed in 2000 as a non-profit wild animal welfare and emergency rescue center and to provide a safe natural habitat sanctuary where wild animals could be giving a 2nd chance so that they can live wild and free amongst their own kind.  More about us on our website www.sanwild.org or our blog www.sanwildsite.wordpress.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/SanWild-Wildlife-Sanctuary/163363760361196?ref=hl

What we need:

Cheetahs in South Africa are under serious threat and it is essential to establish viable breeding populations in the wild. 

SanWild has successfully rehabilitated and released two male cheetahs in our reserve, but they lack female company and cannot contribute to the survival of their species and the overall genetic viability of their own kind. 

SanWild is one of only a handful of reserves approved as bona fide cheetah conservation project and with this comes a conservation responsibility to help increase the number of cheetahs in the wild.

We have managed to secure two suitable females that can be joined up with our males to start a breeding program in the wild that will allow us to help increase the population of cheetahs in protected private reserves. 

The required permits have been issued by the local nature conservation departments and we do have the endorsement and approval of one of South Africa's largest conservation bodies namely the Endangered Wildlife Trust.

The two female cheetah are ready for relocation and this will be done the moment the necessary funding has been raised.

We need to raise $12 000 US to relocate, rehabilitate and to introduce the females to the males before all four animals are returned to the wild to breed naturally.

The costs:

  • Temporary holding camp: $4 800.00

  • Transportation: 1300km:  $2 500.00

  • Rehabilitation and food:    $2 000.00

  • Ongoing support:                $ 2 000.00

  • Veterinary fees:                   $     700.00

 

The Perks you can claim:

$10 - A personalized thank you letter from our founder and a high resolution photograph of the SanWild cheetahs that will be emailed to you.

$20 - A beautifully designed Cheetah Donors certificate and a thank you from our founder that will be emailed to you

$50 - A stunning original Conservation Certificate that will be mailed to you.

$250 - A original exclusive photographic print of a cheetah female printed on canvass 1.2m x 500mm that will be mailed to you.

$500 - A original exclusive photographic print of a cheetah female printed on canvass 1.5m x 500mm that will be mailed to you.

$1500 - If you should like to visit the cheetahs; meet them and see how well they are faring in the wild with their new partners please do check out our amazing perks that will give you the opportunity to visit us and stay in the amazing Savannah Private Bush Camp  This perk will entitle you and 7 friends (8 people in total) to stay for 4 consecutive nights.  You may chose to take your vacation anytime from 1 Jan - 31 Dec 2015 subject to availability.

$3000 - If you should like to visit the cheetahs; meet them and see how well they are faring in the wild with their new partners please do check out our amazing perks that will give you the opportunity to visit us and stay in the amazing Savannah Private Bush Camp  This perk will entitle you and 7 friends (8 people in total) to stay for 6 consecutive nights.  You may chose to take your vacation anytime from 1 Jan - 31 Dec 2015 subject to availability.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please do share our campaign with your friends and associates.

Other Ways You Can Help Please do share our campaign with your friends and associates.

story:
Campaign cancelled


The feedback we get for this campaign isn't what we expected. We need to do better, so we are going back to the drawing board. We want to thank our backers (you will get 100% of your money back of course!) and all those who shared this project. We apologize for this and will come back with a better project. Thank you all!






Short Version: For several years now, honeybees and wild bees have been vanishing. But the pollination they provide is essential to the growth of numberless fruits and vegetables. We’re working on an educational card game and accompanying information kit about what we can do to protect the bees, and we need funds to print it and offer it to schools for free. (Scroll down for the long version)


The Card Game, Guide & Teacher's kit:




(Click to see more)

(Click to see more)



Perks:

$10 USD
Digital Edition (PDF files)
 Everything in ready-to-print PDF files, that is:
- The “Save the Bees” card game
- The guide to bee protection
- The teacher’s kit (student's booklet + teacher's booklet)


$16 USD + Shipping
STB game pack
 A copy of the "Save the Bees" card game (52 cards) in a lovely tuckbox
+ the digital edition (all in ready-to-print PDF files)


$30 USD + Shipping
STB game + guide pack
 A copy of the "Save the Bees" card game (52 cards) in a lovely tuckbox
+ our professionally printed guide to bee protection
+ the digital edition (all in ready-to-print PDF files)


$40 USD + Shipping
STB game + guide + WIS pack
 A copy of the "Save the Bees" card game (52 cards) in a lovely tuckbox
+ our professionally printed guide to bee protection
+ a copy of the "Women in Science" card game
+ the digital edition (all in ready-to-print PDF files)


Sponsoring a school

But if you really want to make a difference, we propose that you not only get your copy of the game, but that you have an educational kit sent in your name to the school of your choice – maybe the one you went to, or the one your kids attend.

Not only will the school receive the educational kits, we’ll follow through with them throughout the school year in order to help facilitate things and gather their feedback so that at the end of the year we can take into account what they think could be improved. And they’ll get free access to any and all modifications we make to the digital version, forever!

$120 USD + Shipping
Minimal school pack
 - 1 STB game pack for you
- 10 STB game packs for the school of your choice (a 160$ value!)
- Access to all the digital versions that can be downloaded and printed on your own, both for you and the school, along with all future updates
- Follow-up and support offered to the school

Printing the packs of cards is what would make the most work for the teachers if they had to do it themselves. With ten packs, a whole class of 30 to 40 students can play at the same time as well as be taught the educational side of things, and the activity can be passed from class to class to reach hundreds of students


$200 USD + Shipping
Regular school pack
 - 1 STB game + guide pack for you
- 10 STB game packs + 30 educationnal booklets + 1 teacher's guide for the school of your choice
- Access to all the digital versions that can be downloaded and printed on your own, both for you and the school, along with all future updates
- Follow-up and support offered to the school

This is the ideal choice for a typical school, with all the materials needed for a lesson for one classroom at a time. Since teachers don’t have to pay or waste time making copies, they can concentrate on their educational role.


$320 USD + Shipping
STB + WIS school packs
 - 1 STB game + guide + WIS pack for you
- Save the Bees: 10 packs of cards + 30 educational booklets + 1 teacher’s guide for the school of your choice
- Women in Science: 10 packs of cards + 30 educational booklets + 1 teacher’s guide for the same school
- Access to all the digital versions that can be downloaded and printed on your own, both for you and the school, along with all future updates
- Follow-up and support offered to the school

This is the same format as the previous option, but topped up with the "Women in Science" game and educationnal kits, allowing for two separate lessons on each of these topics.


$460 USD + Shipping
STB + WIS large school packs
 - 1 STB game + guide + WIS pack for you
- Save the Bees: 20 packs of cards + 60 educational booklets + 2 teacher’s guide for the school of your choice
- Women in Science: 20 packs of cards + 60 educational booklets + 2 teacher’s guide for the same school
- 10 posters (5 for each subject) for an educational exhibit or to decorate classrooms
- Access to all the digital versions that can be downloaded and printed on your own, both for you and the school, along with all future updates
- Follow-up and support offered to the school

For a larger school, for instance one that teaches both primary/elementary school and middle-grade or high school, it’s better to offer more in the way of supplies so that several classes can enjoy the activity at the same time. We also include a series of educational posters that can be used to mount an exhibit or simply decorate classrooms.


 

The project

Last year, we created the “Women in Science” card game, which fights against prejudice by highlighting some 44 remarkable women scientists. Thanks to the phenomenal support we received from the Internet, in just a few months we printed thousands of card packs and offered over 800 of them to schools and associations all over the world, for free. It was a great experience, and it showed us the road we’re going to keep following.

For our second game, we wanted to find a cause that would have the same kind of positive impact on society. Everyone’s heard about the problems bees are having right now: even if you’re not especially interested in insects, the collapse of bee colonies and the importance they have for food production are familiar facts.

And I think that most people would like to help, would like to do something. The problem is that we don’t know what to do to save the bees. As it happens, I studied entomology when I was younger – in fact, I almost became a beekeeper – and it occurred to me that a game could bring together everything that the man and woman in the street can do to save the bees.

Things as simple as letting part of the lawn grow, planting the right kinds of flowers at the right moment, or setting up a water source or a bee shelter in your garden, and so on.

But that isn’t all. Playing games is a great way to sensitise people: it’s not aggressive, and our natural curiosity does all the work. But where it really takes off – and this is what we learnt during our last fundraiser – is when teachers decide to use the game in the classroom. When that happens, you sensitise about thirty students per class, and often their parents as well. And should the teacher happen to share the game with a few colleagues, you just brought your message to several hundred people with a minimal investment.

And that’s what we’re hoping to do again here.


Risks & Challenges

We’ve already got experience when it comes to printing and distributing card games and books, so no problems on that front. When it comes to the scientific facts about protecting bees, we’ll be asking experts (entomologists, beekeepers, researchers) to check and validate the information we’re passing on. Lastly, when it comes to the game itself, we’ll be calling on beta testers to make sure that it’s not only fun, but that we’ve considered all possible outcomes before we release the finalised version.

The fact remains that this type of project can always suffer from unexpected delays. We’d rather deliver things a little late than to offer a product we’re not proud of. In our last campaign, supplementary delays tended to last about two weeks.


FAQ


When will I receive my perk ?

We plan to send them at the end of November, so you should get it before Christmas. The teaching kits will be sent later, we will contact the schools first and we plan to deliver the kits in spring.


I want to deliver the teaching kits to the school myself, is that possible ?

Yes, of course. When the kits are ready we will contact you to get the address you want us to deliver to. It doesn't have to be a school.


Can we see what the guide, card game and teacher's kit will look like ?

If you missed it earlier, here are the links to the preview of the card game and the bee protection guide + teacher's kit. Please keep in mind that it is just a draft, we are still working on the final look.


Will the guide and teaching kits be available in other languages ?

Yes, we plan to translate them in French and Spanish, and add them to the digital edition. If the campaign is a big success we will consider other languages.


Can I share the digital edition or the printed game with friends or colleagues ?

Yes, the digital edition will be released under a Creative Commons licence, which means you can share it in digital or printed format as much as you want as long as you do not sell it.


Won't you harm the environment by printing the cards and shipping them ?

An ecological footprint is inevitable but we make everything in our power to reduce it. We provide a digital version that can be read from already available computers and tablets, and printed when necessary (avoiding the shipping). The paper we use will be certified from well-managed sustainable forests, and we plan to compensate our CO2 emissions.


I have another question, how can I contact you ?

Please send us an email at savethebees@luanagames.com or use this form.

Thank you all!

story:
Breve reseña

Arepacore comenzó como una idea de un centro de investigación de la permacultura en Venezuela, luego con el tiempo y desarrollo de la misma alrededor de todo el país se ha ubicado en un terreno en la costa caribeña donde se realiza actualmente un diseño de permacultura, un espacio para un asentamiento ecológico sustentable, dispuesto a su vez para servir como camping ecológico para promover el ecoturismo en una zona muy rica en biodiversidad. Lo importante para nosotros es principalmente concluir el diseño para lograr la sustentabilidad del mismo, preservación, resguardo de la naturaleza, estudio de biodiversidad y brindar un espacio como reserva ecológica para un camping ecológico para promover el ecoturismo consciente en la región. Con la ayuda de los colaboradores podremos avanzar en nuestro diseño del espacio y poder brindar en corto y mediano plazo servicios de estadía a personas de todo el mundo, comida orgánica con alimentos producidos en el mismo lugar y servicio de ecoturismo con caminatas guiadas por bosque, ciénaga, playa y rios, avistamiento de aves y demás especies autóctonas en su habitat natural además contacto con animales domésticos.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Detalles:

  • En cuanto a financiamiento necesitamos básicamente alrededor de cinco mil dólares (USD $5000) para su uso durante un año, éste dinero sería destinado a cubrir los gastos de sustento de 5 trabajadores que estaremos presentes permanentemente en el lugar de trabajo y también con esa cantidad se cubren los gastos de materiales para la construcción de las infraestructuras ya previamente diseñadas y otra parte de ese financiamiento sería para los repuestos de las herramientas necesarias para culminar y reparar lo que se irá construyendo.
  • Como recompensa podemos ofrecer medias becas para participar en futuros cursos de capacitación en diseño de permacultura, bioconstrucción, diseño de bosques ecológicos, agroecología, diseño hidrológico, estructuras invisibles entre otras ramas de la permacultura. Podemos ofrecer estadía exonerada de pago en el camping ecológico y visitas guiadas al bosque del parque nacional, ciénaga con playa y ríos de la zona. Podemos ofrecer material bibliográfico conjunto al registro del trabajo de diseño del espacio desde su inicio, también podremos ofrecer souvenirs de recuerdo para los colaboradores que asistan, y lo más importante mucha diversión asegurada cada día en el ecocamping.
  • Importante es acotar que pesar de tener diferentes recompensas y una meta de financiamiento, aceptamos cualquier donación asi sea de 1 dolar o cantidades diferentes a las contribuciones por recompensas, actualmente recibimos donaciones de materiales y herramientas para su reciclaje y reutilización.
  • Los fondos serían destinados al diseño en su totalidad, en caso de ser culminado en su totalidad, el lugar sería rediseñado en pequeña escala luego de un tiempo prudencial, básicamente para mantener la biodiversidad. De no ser logrado culminar, lo principal es lograr la autosustentabilidad para poder proseguir con la culminación de lo diseñado para el terreno.

El impacto

La diferencia que hará su contribución:

  • Lo valioso del proyecto para los colaboradores es la riqueza natural de la cual podrán disfrutar, además del acceso a la capacitación en áreas de ecología y sustentabilidad, además como este espacio hay pocos lugares hay en el mundo, que su preservación ecológica y de biodiversidad es de suma importancia para la regeneración planetaria y seguridad de futuras generaciones. 
  • Como centro de investigación hemos logrado capacitar mas de 500 personas a nivel nacional e internacional en 3 años desde su creación y logramos dar comienzo a éste proyecto como un sueño que se está haciendo realidad.
  • Actualmente tenemos referencias nacionales e internacionales de nuestros trabajos previos y en el presente es tangible el crecimiento de dicho diseño que puede ser visitado por muchas personas a medida que vamos avanzando.

Riesgos y desafíos

Las personas valoran tu transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al proveer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

  • Durante 3 años hemos venido trabajando cuesta arriba debido a la situación económica en la que nos encontramos regionalmente, pero nuestra capacitación y experiencia nos ha ayudado a resolver los problemas de manera ingeniosa, ya que donde existen los problemas vemos soluciones, y es común que la naturaleza nos ha provisto de todo o necesario para seguir adelante en los momentos de adversidad.
  • Para solucionar los desafíos llevamos un estudio de los patrones naturales, el cual nos ayuda a proteger la naturaleza para poder dar uso a todos los recursos necesarios para proseguir con la construcción de nuestro diseño, también desarrollamos varias actividades socioproductivas para poder cubrir los gastos básicos de los trabajadores que vivimos en el lugar, conseguimos fabricar gran parte de los productos de primera necesidad los cuales también son ecológicos

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  • De no poder colaborar monetariamente pueden ayudarnos difundiendo nuestro proyecto, también pueden venir a nuestro espacio para ayudarnos con las tareas de cuidado del espacio y construcción de las infraestucturas restantes, siempre se aprenderá algo nuevo bilateralmente.
  • Recuerda usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Muchisimas gracias!

story:
Pour la version française, cliquez ici.

PLEASE USE THE SHARE TOOLS ABOVE TO SPREAD THE MESSAGE!

When sharing on twitter please add this link to your tweet: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/552440

Energy Access in Cambodia

Access to a reliable energy source is essential for development, but after decades upheaval the construction of energy infrastructure in Cambodia has been slow. Currently roughly a quarter of the population have access to the centralized electricity grid, meaning that roughly 10.6 million Cambodians, mostly in the rural areas, live without.

They resort to using kerosene lanterns, car batteries and diesel generators, which are expensive, time consuming, detrimental to health and often downright dangerous.

  • Kerosene presents a significant fire hazard, its fumes have adverse health effects, especially for women who may spend long periods of time indoors, and the light from kerosene lanterns is of poor quality which makes it difficult to study or perform other potential earning activities.
  • Car batteries require regular re-charging which can be very time consuming as the nearest charging station is often several miles away, again taking up valuable time which could be better spent on other activities.
  • The use of diesel generators is expensive and rquire constant purchase of fuel.

Solar Power is Part of the Answer

As Cambodia is located in one of the sunniest areas of the world, solar power provides an excellent solution to these problems: it’s safe; reliable; and easy to use. Also, after the initial expenditure the running costs are negligible.

The quality of light from our solar lighting kits empowers people by allowing them to continue studying or engaging in other earning activities (such as making handicrafts or running a local shop) after the sun has gone down.

The lighting kits we provide are plug-and-play which means they are easy to install and easy to use. They are also expandable which means that it is easy for customers to add to their system when the have the money and their needs grow.

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to increase customer access to these technologies by building a distribution service to reach these rural communities. This is where we need your help. 

By creating a network and having a local presence, we can start to build trust for solar products and show their benefits over existing energy solutions. We want to start with a shop in Kampong Thom where we have a partnership with a local MFI to make the products more affordable. 

We will employ a local entrepreneurs to run the shop and sell in the field, and hope to cover the costs to run for a 6 month pilot period, in which time we hope to be an established part of the community and a trusted  source of clean energy solutions.


We will use your money to open our "Solar Shop", our base for supporting our network of entrepreneurs. We will host trainings and provide education and awareness raising about solar. We will also have technical support staff to provide (after-)sales support and maintenance for the end-user.

Cost Breakdown:

- Office Setup $967

- Staff Salaries (6 Months) $3000

- Operation Costs (6 Months) $2196

- Inventory $3450

-----------------------------

Total $9613

More info on this project: http://nrg-renewables.com/category/distribution-network/

We are passionate about this project as it is the best way to go spread solar throughout Cambodia. We are will work tirelessly to make it happen with whatever funding we can raise, but obviously the more the better!

If you have ANY questions, or would like to know more about this project, please email us today.

Our Story

NRG Solutions was established with the goal of providing appropriate and affordable solar energy solutions to Cambodia.

We are a small entrepreneurial mix of Khmer and International staff, we started 4 years ago as part of an NGO, and after testing different models and approaches to the distribution of solar energy into remote areas, we took the decision to transition into a social enterrise, order to make the model more sustainable and scalable.

We are building networks of entrepreneurs to whom we offer constant training and support and push our emphasis on quality and service. By engaging local people in our model, not only do we create jobs and give people new skills, but also expand our reach deeper into the remote rural areas where solar can make the most difference.

We have quickly gained a reputation for  this focus on top quality products and for  providing excellent after-sales service and  maintenance for the end-customer. This  allows us to gain trust from the  communities we work, which is especially  important when bad products and poor  service have given solar a bad name.

Learn about previous projects: http://nrg-renewables.com/category/projects/


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

You help us make the project a success by  using the  share tools to spread the word using social media, or by emailing and speaking with your friends and colleagues. 

Thanks everyone for your support!

P.S. If you do donate, please use PayPal if you can - this will help us get the project going before the Campaign finishes!

Learn More on our website
Visit us on Facebook



----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

« NRG – Empowering Cambodians with Solar Power. » est membre de l’Energy Access Practitioner Network (Réseau des Professionnels de l’Accès à l’Energie) soutenu par la Fondation de l’ONU. Ce réseau sert de plateforme aux organisations promouvant l’accès à l’énergie pour tous et contribuant à l’initiative de l’ONU « Sustainable Energy for All » fixant les objectifs de l’accès à l’énergie pour 2030.

FAITES PASSER LE MOT EN PARTAGEANT LE LIEN CI-DESSUS !

Si vous partagez ce lien sur twitter, ajoutez le lien suivant à votre tweet : http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/552440

Notre Histoire

NRG Solutions a été établie avec pour but de proposer des solutions d’accès à l’énergie solaire abordables et appropriées au contexte cambodgien.

Nous sommes une jeune structure entrepreneuriale portée par une équipe internationale composée à la fois de khmers et d’étrangers. Nous avons débuté voici 4 ans sous le couvert d’une ONG. Après avoir testé différentes approches et modèles de distribution de l’énergie solaire en zone isolée, nous avons pris la décision d’évoluer en entreprise à caractère social afin d’inscrire notre modèle dans la durée.

Actuellement, nous construisons un réseau de micro-entrepreneurs à qui nous apportons formation et support tout en accentuant plus particulièrement sur la qualité du service. En engageant les populations locales dans notre modèle, nous ne créons pas seulement de nouveaux emplois,  nous apportons à nos entrepreneurs de nouvelles compétences et nous forgeons un solide réseau qui nous permettra, à l’avenir, d’atteindre des zones de plus en plus isolées pour lesquelles les solutions solaires peuvent faire une vraie différence.

Nous avons rapidement forgé notre réputation en nous focalisant sur la qualité de nos produits et en proposant à nos clients finals un service après-vente irréprochable. Ceci nous permet de gagner doucement la confiance des communautés avec lesquelles nous travaillons. Cette approche est d’autant plus importante car des produits de mauvaise facture et un service inexistant ont, par le passé, donné aux produits solaires une très mauvaise réputation.

Apprenez-en plus sur nos précédents projets : http://nrg-renewables.com/category/projects/

L’accès à l’énergie au Cambodge

L’accès à une source d’énergie pérenne est essentiel au développement. Cependant, le pays demeure encore en reconstruction à la suite du régime khmer rouge et le déploiement des infrastructures énergétiques au Cambodge reste très limité. Actuellement, à peine un quart de la population à accès au réseau électrique. 10,6 millions de Cambodgiens, la majorité en zone rurale, n’ont donc pas accès à l’électricité du réseau.

Pour s’éclairer, ces populations ont recours à des lampes à kérosène, des batteries de voitures ou des générateurs diesel. Ces solutions, souvent plus onéreuses que l’électricité du réseau, peuvent également s’avérer dangereuse :

·  Les lampes à kérosène représentent un risque d’incendie majeur. Elles émettent des fumées nocives, surtout pour les femmes au foyer et les enfants en bas-âge restant de longues heures à l’intérieur. Ces lampes apportent de plus un éclairage faible ne suffisant pas aux enfants pour étudier le soir et ne permettant pas aux adultes de travailler à la nuit tombée.

·  Les batteries de voiture nécessitent des recharges régulières. La station de recharge la plus proche se trouvant généralement à plusieurs kilomètres, chaque recharge prend un temps précieux pendant lequel aucune autre activité lucrative ne peut être envisagée.

·  L’utilisation de générateur diesel est quant à elle complètement hors de prix pour la plupart des personnes et demande un apport constant en kérosène.

L’énergie solaire en partie une réponse

Le Cambodge est un des pays les plus ensoleillé au monde, l’énergie solaire représente donc un excellent palliatif à ces problèmes : durable, sans risque pour la santé, et facile d’utilisation. De plus, à la suite de l’investissement initial, les coûts d’entretien sont très faibles.

La qualité de la lumière d’un kit solaire est suffisante pour lire, et donc étudier, mais aussi pour cuisiner, et donc pour envisager d’autres activités après la nuit tombée : comme garder un magasin ouvert ou confectionner de l’artisanat.

Les kits solaires que nous proposons sont simples d’installation et faciles d’utilisation. Ils sont également adaptables très facilement, nos clients peuvent ainsi facilement ajouter un nouveau kit à leur système existant dès qu’ils en ont les moyens ou que leurs besoins augmentent.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous y gagnez

Notre but est de rendre cette technologie accessible au plus grand nombre. En mettant en place un réseau de distribution efficace, nous pourrons ainsi toucher les communautés jusque dans les zones les plus reculées du pays. C’est ici que nous avons besoins de vous !

En créant ce réseau à l’échelle locale, nous pourrons nous impliquer davantage dans les communautés, montrer les bénéfices des produits solaires par rapport à d’autres sources d’énergie et bâtir cette confiance qui fait encore défaut. Nous voulons commencer par ouvrir un atelier dans la ville de Kampong Thom, à 200 km au nord de Phnom Penh. Nous pourrons ainsi assurer le suivi de nos produits et d’en assurer le support technique. Notre partenariat avec un institut de micro-finance local nous permettra aussi de facilité l’accès à ces produits aux plus démunis.

Nous emploierons un entrepreneur, responsable de l’atelier et représentant de l’entreprise sur le terrain. Grace à cette campagne de don, nous espérons pouvoir couvrir une période pilote de 6 mois d’activité pendant laquelle nous espérons impliquer les communautés et devenir un partenaire de confiance pour les solutions d’énergies propres dans la région.

Vos dons nous permettrons d’ouvrir un Atelier Solaire, la base de notre réseau d’entrepreneurs. Nous pourrons ainsi accueillir des séances de formation à l’entreprenariat, promouvoir les solutions d’énergie durable et assurer le support technique auprès de nos utilisateurs finals.

Répartition des coûts :

- Aménagement de l’atelier $967

- Salaire d’un entrepreneur (6 mois) $3000

- Coûts opérationnels (6 mois) $2196

- Équipements $3450

-----------------------------

Total $9613

Plus d’information sur nos projets: http://nrg-renewables.com/category/distribution-network/

Nous sommes engagés dans ce projet car il représente pour nous le meilleur moyen de promouvoir l’énergie solaire au Cambodge. Nous mettrons tout en œuvre pour y arriver en fonction des dons que nous pourrons récolter.

Si vous avez des questions, ou souhaitez en savoir plus sur ce projet, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter par email dès aujourd’hui.

D’autres manières de nous aider

Faites passer le mot !

Votre aide pour rendre ce projet réalisable commence par le partage de notre initiative, sur les médias sociaux, par email ou tout simplement en en discutant avec vos amis et collègues.

Merci pour votre support !

P.S. Si vous le pouvez, utilisez la plateforme Paypal pour votre don – ceci nous permettra de lancer le projet avant même que la Campagne se termine !

En apprendre plus sur notre site

Suivez-nous sur Facebook

story:
Our Company

We are passionate about developing products that can help us improve the environment. Either by replacing traditional products which damage the environment - for example our peat free compost made from unwanted organic material or producing completely new and unique products by recycling damaging waste products.

 

Our Team

Graham Cooper - CEO

A seasoned entrepreneur with a track record of creating innovative companies in the technology sector. Has successfully floated two technology companies on the junior stock markets in the UK  leading to a sale to a larger group. Took three technology businesses from start up to private sale - one subsequently floated on Nasdaq. International business experience across Europe and USA. Angel investor and business mentor to high growth companies. Now leading this latest investment project.

Geoff Nutland - Production Director 

An experienced entrepreneur with history of creating successful businesses and in particular in agriculture and industrial absorbents. Strong technical skills.

Geoff is a natural born inventor and has successfully filed a number of patents which are now being commercialised. His passion is for environmental products that really make a difference but equally offer a great commercial opportunity. 

John Reeve - Chairman

John was one of two founders of Severfield - Reeve which changed its name to Severfield Rowen when it joined the London Stock Exchange.

The growth of the Severfield-Rowen Group is undoubtedly one of the success stories of the construction industry.

From its inception in 1978 the company has attained the unrivalled position as the largest and most successful structural steelwork contractor in the UK.

Products we have already brought to market 

 

The Fat Trap - the no hassle, fat collector!

Millions of pounds each year are wasted in the UK unblocking pipes of congealed fat. This is due to the increasing number of people tipping cooking fats and oils down drains, which leads to many environmental risks, including flooding.

Waste fat and oil in the kitchen can be harmful in so many ways. Even though you may not see it, fat and oil will harbour germs and make surfaces dangerous.

 

 

Now we have the answer… Fattrap

The super absorbent cooking oil disposal pouch ‘Fat Trap’ (Fattrap) locks in waste fats and oils from health grills, BBQs, frying, roasting dishes and kitchen spillages into it’s honeycomb structure. This turns the waste into a solid, for easy and safe disposal into the bin.

 www.fat-trap.net

 

  

The new way to buy, use and store compost ...

Wet and Grow introduce a fantastic new range of eco friendly compost products designed to make gardening easier and more enjoyable for the experienced gardener, the complete novice and everyone in between of all ages!

Our products are a unique blend of the highest quality substrates, seeds and fertilizers available in horticulture

The base is Coir - the new peat and when mixed with our patent-pending lightweight formula, makes a superb growing medium for the best results in your garden.

This amazing product can change the way you garden and grow your plants and vegetables.

No more lugging heavy bags of compost from the garden centre - Wet & Grow is so ultra lightweight it comes in either a box, a small Handy Pack and even the 50 litre is an easy to carry Bag with handle!

  • Just add water
  • Expands 3 times in volume
  • Make & use just what you require
  • Peat free
  • Nutrient enriched
  • 100% natural fibre

  www.wetandgrow.co.uk

Welcome to Spill Solutions

An amazing new and 100% organic product made from coir pith and an incredible super absorbent polymer mix that can absorb 300 times its own weight.

Instantly cleans up spills in the home or office.

It’s easy, quick and environmentally friendly but best of all... IT WORKS!

This revolutionary product uses ‘pouches’ to soak up even the most damaging of spills.  You won’t believe the power of this 100% organic product until you see it with your own eyes.  Every home and business in the UK should have this product – and be ready to cope with any emergency:

  • Spilled wine
  • Leaking pipe
  • Pet mishaps
  • Condensation
  • Spilled milk!

Any liquid spill can be cleaned up in seconds using our incredible 100% organic spill solution.

 

www.spill-solutions.co.uk

 

Our latest innovation!

From The Happy Bird Company comes Eco Bird Biscuit

 

 

THE BIRD FOOD MARKET IS HUGE. IN THE UK OVER £300 MILLION PER YEAR AND OVER 55 MILLION AMERICANS FEED WILD BIRDS AND SPEND OVER $3 BILLION A YEAR ON BIRD FOOD. 

At the same time in the UK alone households pour an estimated 170,000 tonnes of waste cooking fat and oil down the kitchen sink each year using hot water and detergents to flush down into the waste pipes where once cooled it will solidify.In the USA it is estimated that 40-60% of all preventable Sewage System Overflows nationwide are fats,oils and grease (FOG)-related. The environmental impact is huge and can even lead to extensive flooding.

Recycle your waste cooking fat and oil into nutritious and safe food for the birds - how good is that!

A new and innovative product that not only makes birds happy, but also makes the environment happy.

Bird lovers and gardeners alike will love this interactive and addictive new way to feed the birds

It's a simple and fun way to make high nutrition biscuits in the home…biscuits guaranteed to have all kinds of birds flocking to the garden.

 

Eco Bird Biscuit can help feed the declining wild bird population by providing safe and highly nutritious food whilst diverting 000's  tonnes of waste cooking fats and oils from our sewer systems and landfill.   

What is Eco Bird Biscuit -a patented ready-made mix of natural proteins and starches along with premiumbird seed, mixing tray and mould provide a complete do-it-yourself kit. All that’s needed is some water but better still for extra nutrition add some waste cooking fat or oil. 60 seconds in a  microwave binds all the elements together to literally bake a fantastic high energy biscuit that birds love.

There’s nothing quite like Eco Bird Biscuit available anywhere else. It’s the only complete kit of its kind. The fact that the biscuit when made is hard and dry means that—unlike ready-made fat balls and suet cakes — they don’t melt in hot weather and the birds don’t smear their feathers on the fat.

 

It's fun for all the family, it's interactive and addictive, a new product that not only makes birds happy, but also makes the environment. happy!

 

What We Have, What We Need & What You Get

The product is ready for manufacture following extensive research,testing and design reiterations. We have also commissioned a scientific study by York University Bio Renewables Development Centre who concluded "that the use of eco bird biscuit product may actually provide more control over the amount of microbes wild birds are exposed to when made following the method suggested on the packaging"

We now need to complete manufacture of stock product and launch the sales and marketing campaign to major retailers in the UK initially and then roll out to Europe and USA

 
 
 

Retail Format Designs

 

Single Pack with POS 

5 Pack Range

 

 

Collectors Kit

 

£100k is needed.

We have invested a lot of our own money to bring us to this stage so we are commited to making this a success. Help us to complete the journey.

This is what we will use the funds raised for:

  • Final design £15,000

  • Packaging - die cutting £10,000

  • Plant and machinery additions £25,000

  • Raw materials and packaging £35,000

  • Production Overheads £15,000

 

 

 

  

Great Perks

Become an Eco Bird Biscuit fan and enjoy feeding the birds and helping to save the planet!

  • Packs of Eco Bird Biscuit to thank you for your help

  • We will send you pack/s of biscuits every month for a year

  • Quantity depending on contribution

  • Enjoy watching the birds devour your  biscuits

If we don't recieve the full amount we will use the available funds to produce limited quantities of product to exhibit and to show retailers the finished product in order to gain orders. 

 

FEED THE BIRDS NOT THE SINK!

Over 50% of the population of the UK and over 55million Americans feed wild birds in their gardens. The bird population has been decimated over recent decades and supporting wild birds has never been more important. 

 

 FROM THIS

 

 TO THIS 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

We hope you can help us to get this great idea to market but if finances don't allow then please tell everyone you know about us - Facebook, Twitter,Text,Email - visit our website www.thehappybirdcompany.co.uk for more information.

Let us know what you think.

customercare@thehappybirdcompany.co.uk

Thank you for your time.
story_txt:
Our Company
We are passionate about developing products that can help us improve the environment. Either by replacing traditional products which damage the environment - for example our peat free compost made from unwanted organic material or producing completely new and unique products by recycling damaging waste products.
 
Our Team
Graham Cooper - CEO
A seasoned entrepreneur with a track record of creating innovative companies in the technology sector. Has successfully floated two technology companies on the junior stock markets in the UK  leading to a sale to a larger group. Took three technology businesses from start up to private sale - one subsequently floated on Nasdaq. International business experience across Europe and USA. Angel investor and business mentor to high growth companies. Now leading this latest investment project.
Geoff Nutland - Production Director 
An experienced entrepreneur with history of creating successful businesses and in particular in agriculture and industrial absorbents. Strong technical skills.
Geoff is a natural born inventor and has successfully filed a number of patents which are now being commercialised. His passion is for environmental products that really make a difference but equally offer a great commercial opportunity. 
John Reeve - Chairman
John was one of two founders of Severfield - Reeve which changed its name to Severfield Rowen when it joined the London Stock Exchange.
The growth of the Severfield-Rowen Group is undoubtedly one of the success stories of the construction industry.
From its inception in 1978 the company has attained the unrivalled position as the largest and most successful structural steelwork contractor in the UK.
Products we have already brought to market 

 

The Fat Trap - the no hassle, fat collector!

Millions of pounds each year are wasted in the UK unblocking pipes of congealed fat. This is due to the increasing number of people tipping cooking fats and oils down drains, which leads to many environmental risks, including flooding.
Waste fat and oil in the kitchen can be harmful in so many ways. Even though you may not see it, fat and oil will harbour germs and make surfaces dangerous.
 

 
Now we have the answer… Fattrap
The super absorbent cooking oil disposal pouch ‘Fat Trap’ (Fattrap) locks in waste fats and oils from health grills, BBQs, frying, roasting dishes and kitchen spillages into it’s honeycomb structure. This turns the waste into a solid, for easy and safe disposal into the bin.
 www.fat-trap.net

 
  

The new way to buy, use and store compost ...
Wet and Grow introduce a fantastic new range of eco friendly compost products designed to make gardening easier and more enjoyable for the experienced gardener, the complete novice and everyone in between of all ages!
Our products are a unique blend of the highest quality substrates, seeds and fertilizers available in horticulture
The base is Coir - the new peat and when mixed with our patent-pending lightweight formula, makes a superb growing medium for the best results in your garden.
This amazing product can change the way you garden and grow your plants and vegetables.
No more lugging heavy bags of compost from the garden centre - Wet & Grow is so ultra lightweight it comes in either a box, a small Handy Pack and even the 50 litre is an easy to carry Bag with handle!

Just add water
Expands 3 times in volume
Make & use just what you require
Peat free
Nutrient enriched
100% natural fibre
  www.wetandgrow.co.uk

Welcome to Spill Solutions
An amazing new and 100% organic product made from coir pith and an incredible super absorbent polymer mix that can absorb 300 times its own weight.Instantly cleans up spills in the home or office.It’s easy, quick and environmentally friendly but best of all... IT WORKS!
This revolutionary product uses ‘pouches’ to soak up even the most damaging of spills.  You won’t believe the power of this 100% organic product until you see it with your own eyes.  Every home and business in the UK should have this product – and be ready to cope with any emergency:

Spilled wine
Leaking pipe
Pet mishaps
Condensation
Spilled milk!
Any liquid spill can be cleaned up in seconds using our incredible 100% organic spill solution.
 

www.spill-solutions.co.uk
 
Our latest innovation!
From The Happy Bird Company comes Eco Bird Biscuit

story:
About Us 

The Coalition to Fight Factory Farming is dedicated to empowering people to save the environment, animals, and our own health through our daily food choices.  

Since 2010, we have given over 100 presentations to schools, student groups, and community organizations about the widespread ecological, public health, and social justice hazards of factory farming.

The BART Ads

In May, CFFF participated in the BART Blue Sky Contest.  The three non-profits that received the most votes on Facebook each won $40,000 worth of advertising on BART, San Francisco's subway system.  We came in 2nd place with over 800 votes!  Our ads will run in 40 stations, and on 120 subway cars.

What We Need

  • In order to run the most fantastic, effective ads possible, we need to hire a graphic designer.  The total cost of designing the ads will run about $500.

  • Additional funds will go towards expanding our educational outreach program.

  • Donations of as little as $5 are hugely helpful in spreading this important message.

The Impact

  • With your help, 300,000 people per day will learn about the impact of factory farming on animals and the environment!

  • Livestock produce more greenhouse gases than all transportation combined

    • The ad in BART stations will empower people to reduce their carbon footprint by participating in Meatless Mondays

  • 95% of people want farm animals to be well-treated.  99% of farm animals are not.
  • The ad on BART cars will empower people to save animals from factory farms by participating in Meatless Mondays.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!  Every dollar puts us closer towards our goal.

  • Get involved with our organization!  Visit www.cfff.info to learn more about our group, sign up for a presentation, or volunteer.
