story:
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO HELPED US REACH OUR GOAL!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you missed the crowdfunding campaign, but still want to donate, you can do so through Prison Legal News (Please make note that you want to direct the funds towards the Prison Ecology Project) .  CLICK HERE TO DONATE.

Become a part of this growing movement to end mass incarceration and defend the earth. Your money will go towards:

1.  Exposing

the prison system for poisoning incarcerated people and destroying the environment

2.  Organizing

to engage local communities and create new tools, including a national database of toxic prisons and prison pollution

3.  Fighting

The construction of new prisons that tear apart human communities and damage ecosystems

4.  Protecting

Wildlife, waterways and the habitat of endangered species, such as the Indiana bat threatened by a new federal prison in southern Appalachia

$15,000 will give us resources to move forward on these four fronts. Read on for more details... 

Summary

The Human Rights Defense Center’s Prison Ecology Project is creating tools to dismantle toxic prisons. We are focused on organizing at the intersection of environment and mass incarceration. Your contributions will provide needed start-up funds for on-the-ground work to bridge the gap between criminal justice reform and environmental movements. 

The prison industry has a long history of ecological violence. Rikers Island prison in New York City was literally built on a trash heap, and evidence suggests a high incidence of cancer among guards and prisoners. In California and Texas prisoners have little recourse but to drink arsenic-laced water. In Alabama, an overpopulated prison habitually dumps sewage into a river where people fish and swim. In Kentucky, construction of a new prison is poised to clear 700 acres of endangered species habitat. Stories like these are too common. The issues impact millions of people in and around prisons across the US but are largely ignored. 

Prison Ecology Project is uncovering these abuses and building a clearinghouse of data you can use to fight toxic prisons in your community. 

We are a project of the Human Rights Defense Center (HRDC), a national non-profit that advocates for protecting the fundamental rights of people held in U.S. detention facilities, including their access to communications from outside sources. For 25 years, HRDC has published Prison Legal News, a monthly publication with subscribers in all 50 states and internationally. HRDC engages in litigation, conducts media and educational campaigns, provides testimony before legislative and regulatory bodies, and also does significant work around government transparency and accountability issues. Read more about HRDC’s history, staff, and extensive work on its website.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $15,000 to boost our research and data analysis work in this chronically understudied area, and to keep pressure on an industry notorious for its lack of transparency.

If we meet our stretch goal of $25,000, your donations will also fund our organizing work to halt the construction of new prisons. Our first target? A federal prison planned for Letcher County, Kentucky whose construction would demolish 700 acres of endangered species habitat in Appalachia while imprisoning people hundreds of miles from their families. If we raise these funds, we will plan an organizing tour across the southeast to mobilize against the permitting of this prison.

We are offering special gifts to our backers! Check out our list of perks available as thanks for your contributions. You can find out more about the perks in our gallery. 

The Impact

Prison Ecology Project is building a database of the five thousand prisons and jails around the country, finding the weak points in the environmental realm, and providing tools to organize locally. 

Incarcerated people are one of the most vulnerable and uniquely over-burdened demographics in our nation. Prisons have become a big business. One fourth of the world’s prisoners are locked up in the US, where the the number of prisons has shot up by 500% in the last thirty years. Almost all of the prison population is low-income, and people of color are disproportionately represented by wide margins in every state. 

Most people whose lives have been impacted by the criminal justice system have not engaged with the environmental movement up to the present time. The Prison Ecology Project creates an entryway for them, as we are able to illustrate that the environmental toll of building and operating prisons indicates yet another reason to massively reduce the nation’s prison populations and send people back to their families. Thus, an additional result of the project: the growth of the environmental movement.

Risks & Challenges

The prison industry is entrenched in US government and society, but is not untouchable. The Human Rights Defense Center (HRDC) already succeeded in wielding large scale influence in the regulatory arena through the Prison Phone Justice Campaign, which zeroed in on price gouging by telecom companies in collusion with prisons and jails. Its data collection and analysis were central to getting the FCC to reduce inflated prison phone rates and safeguard the lifeline between the incarcerated and their loved ones. HRDC is also the publisher of Prison Legal News, which has exposed environmental problems and covered stories of whistleblower litigation in prisons for well over two decades. The Prison Ecology Project aims to build on this kind of success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! A crowdfunding campaign is as good as the crowd behind it. Use the Indiegogo social media tools. Tell your friends. Talk to your family. Share our campaign with your networks! Your efforts are key to our success.

Check out some news coverage of our efforts thus far:

  • Mass Incarceration vs. Rural Appalachia, by Panagioti Tsolkas, Earth Island Journal, Aug 2015
  • How Mass Incarceration Takes a Toll on the Environment, by Linda Poon, CityLab (The Atlantic), July 2015
  • Federal Agencies Ignore Environmental Health Risks for Millions of Prisoners, by Mike Ludwig, Truthout, July 2015 

  • Ninety-Three Organizations Challenge EPA to Consider Prisoners in Environmental Justice Plan, by HRDC, Nation Inside, July 2015

  • GEO Group’s Gulags Grasping for Green Approval, by Panagioti Tsolkas, Prison Legal News, May 2015

  • In the Face of Drought, California Prisons Are Restricting Inmates' Shower and Toilet Use, by Jessica Pishko Vice, July 2015

  • Proposed Letcher County federal Prison brings opposition, by Ryan Adams, WYMT, March 2015 
  • New Federal Prison Proposed on MTR Coal Mine Site in Eastern Kentucky, by Nick Szuberla, Medium, March 2015 
  • Panel Explores Prisons, Ecology And Police, by Camilla Mortensen, Eugene Weekly, March 2015
  • Prisons, Ecology and the Birth of an Empire, Panagioti Tsolkas, Earth First! Journal, July 2015

Check out some news coverage of our efforts thus far:



Mass Incarceration vs. Rural Appalachia, by Panagioti Tsolkas, Earth Island Journal, Aug 2015


How Mass Incarceration Takes a Toll on the Environment, by Linda Poon, CityLab (The Atlantic), July 2015


Federal Agencies Ignore Environmental Health Risks for Millions of Prisoners, by Mike Ludwig, Truthout, July 2015 						
					



Ninety-Three Organizations Challenge EPA to Consider Prisoners in Environmental Justice Plan, by HRDC, Nation Inside, July 2015

GEO Group’s Gulags Grasping for Green Approval, by Panagioti Tsolkas, Prison Legal News, May 2015

In the Face of Drought, California Prisons Are Restricting Inmates' Shower and Toilet Use, by Jessica Pishko										Vice, July 2015

Panel Explores Prisons, Ecology And Police, by Camilla Mortensen, Eugene Weekly, March 2015

story:
www.thebritish10klondon.co.uk

Short Summary

On the 13th July 2014, I am running my next 10km run, this time for a charity and it is a charity close to my heart. Throughout my life I have been privileged to take many things for granted, including the access to an endless supply of clean water in Zambia and the UK.

I would like to share this. This is my way of supporting many families and people in Zambia who don't have access to clean water. I am doing this run in support of the Waterempowerment charity which "seeks to educate, build and sustain safe clean water projects within Zambia".

http://waterempowerment.org/

This is a US based charity (my cousin Manena Ng’ambi is one of the founders).

I have set a goal to raise at least $500 to support this amazing team and their efforts. With your support through sponsorship or simply sharing the link for this charity we can support their hugely important work.

Thank you in advance for support.

Rudo.

story:
CLIMAFY'S MISSION: To “make green happen”, boost the value of a home, and shrink or eliminate personal carbon footprints by providing an online software platform to help simplify the complex process of making a home more energy efficient.

 

Upgrading your house to improve its energy efficiency can be hard. Climafy makes it easy.

Climafy is a  new service that helps you to save money on your utilities, raise the value of your house, and lower your carbon footprint. Upon sharing a few details about your house, we will help you to improve your property's energy efficiency from start to finish. You might be surprised by how much money you can save in the future by installing appropriate insulation, wind turbines, furnaces, and other upgrades now.

We want to empower as many homeowners as possible to take control of their energy use. Unanswered questions about costs, savings, incentives, and technology should not stop anyone from making changes important to their financial well-being. Climafy gathers more information about prices and incentives than is available in any other place. Through Climafy, you will be able to quickly and easily make financial decisions that are right for you and your home.

Our partnerships with contractors and lending institutions will enable a smooth process of selecting, financing, installing, and monitoring the upgrades that will create the most meaningful difference for your house and your utility bills. Climafy accommodates everyone, including those deeply interested in the details of energy efficiency. Others, on the other hand, would rather let us figure everything out, and that's okay. With Climafy, you can go at your own pace and still make green happen at the click of a button.

Climafy is an ambitious project with significant outstanding development to prepare for our first customers. We are a small dynamic team, and have been developing Climafy's technology over the past three years without any outside investment. With your help, we can launch the service in Spring, 2013. We would like to maintain the highest standards of quality from the first moment we help anyone to Climafy their home. We must focus as much of our time as possible on Climafy and set up an office to facilitate the hard work that will make it a success.

In exchange for your support, we are offering an opportunity to experience the highest level of Climafy service, called Direct Access. Starting at a pledge of only $25, you will have access to a member of our team whenever you decide to Climafy your home. Larger pledges will allow you more time with us when you decide to use Climafy. Starting at the $50 pledge level, you can give the gift of resource efficiency and personal service to anyone you choose.

Once the project is fully funded, we will send you a code by email for each Direct Access account associated with your pledge. We will also send you instructions for activating your code.

In the future, Direct Access will comprise our top-tier level of service.  We will never again be able to offer it at the prices we are offering now to our Kickstarter supporters. We want to show our sincere appreciation for your help in funding the development of Climafy.                                                               

Our pilot cities are Pittsburgh, PA, and Hartford, CT; homeowners in those two areas will currently experience the greatest ease-of-use because we have incorporated detailed property information into our database, but homeowners elsewhere can still use Climafy by providing a few more inputs than their street address and zipcode.  Both work equally well with our industry-standard energy efficiency modeling engine.

We truly appreciate the support; keep an eye out for updates throughout our campaign.

Please note: Climafy is currently available for properties in the United States. At this time, we cannot serve customers in Puerto Rico, other U.S. territories, or other countries.   

______________________________________________________________

THE CLIMAFY TEAM:

Scott Powell - Founder and CEO

Scott Powell grew up in Northwestern Montana. He completed high school in Germany, outside Cologne. He received his undergraduate degree in Economics at the University of Chicago, with a minor in East Asian Studies. After serving a term in the Japan Exchange and Teaching (JET) program on Japan's southern island of Kyushu, he returned to the University of Chicago to earn a Master's in Social Science, with a focus on East Asia. In preparation for PhD study he undertook a Mandarin-immersion program in Beijing and Harbin where he earned his certificate in Mandarin and became a paid lecturer at-large. Upon returning to the United States, events led him to work in Finance, where he taught himself to program and had success automating key processes in private banking. He translated those skills into progressively more robust positions in Technology in New York, where he built some of the most successful e-commerce sites of the dot-com era, including Tiffany & Co's website. The bulk of his career has been spent in the Interactive field wearing the various hats of Information Architect, Project Manager, and Interactive Strategist, and gaining increasingly greater responsibilities and titles. In recent years, however, his need to bend his skills and experience toward the greater good has led him toward social enterprise. He assumed leadership of the Digital department at the Clinton Foundation, where he in 48 hours he built logistical systems and relief websites for the people of Haiti in the wake of the devastating earthquake in Port-au-Prince that raised more than $60 million and routed food, water, medicine, and temporary shelters to survivors. That experience confirmed his resolve to do something better and led him to found Climafy.com in 2010, whose mission is to “make green happen” by translating the impossibly complex process of retrofitting your home for energy efficiency into something that anyone can do and thereby save money, boost the value of their homes, and shrink or eliminate they personal carbon footprint.  Climafy.com is poised to launch the advance prototype of their system in October 2012.

 

Justin Giles - Co-Founder and Director of Marketing, Media, and Relationships

Justin Giles Has degrees in Psychology and Social-Organizational Psychology from Hampton University and Columbia University, respectively.  After he completed his education, he immersed himself in the non-profit arts world; sometimes as a performer, but more often working in production, administration, marketing, creative and social media.  He has worked primarily in artistic organizations such as the Metropolitan Opera, the Kaufman Center, and Opera Singers Initiative in addition to The William J. Clinton Foundation, TCC Group, and Inc. Magazine.  As a member of Climafy since its inception, he brings his skills in social-media and traditional media, as well as his facility with media strategy.  He coordinates media schedules, social media, interviews and everything media/creative related for Climafy.

 

Greg Hedger - Co-Founder and CTO

Greg Hedger is a software architect with over twenty years’ experience building large scale enterprise software systems to spec. Getting an early start in games programming, Greg has long sought to bring his skills to bear in a broader context of social awareness. His commitment to Climafy and his passion for engineering top-notch software are equaled only by his unshakeable belief in its potential to effect positive change for real people in hard times.

 

  • http://climafy.com
  • http://facebook.com
  • http://twitter.com
  • http://linkedin.com
  • http://youtube.com
  • http://pinterest.com

________________________________________

The Climafy video was produced by:
story_txt:
CLIMAFY'S MISSION: To “make green happen”, boost the value of a home, and shrink or eliminate personal carbon footprints by providing an online software platform to help simplify the complex process of making a home more energy efficient.

 
Upgrading your house to improve its energy efficiency can be hard. Climafy makes it easy.
Climafy is a  new service that helps you to save money on your utilities, raise the value of your house, and lower your carbon footprint. Upon sharing a few details about your house, we will help you to improve your property's energy efficiency from start to finish. You might be surprised by how much money you can save in the future by installing appropriate insulation, wind turbines, furnaces, and other upgrades now.
We want to empower as many homeowners as possible to take control of their energy use. Unanswered questions about costs, savings, incentives, and technology should not stop anyone from making changes important to their financial well-being. Climafy gathers more information about prices and incentives than is available in any other place. Through Climafy, you will be able to quickly and easily make financial decisions that are right for you and your home.
Our partnerships with contractors and lending institutions will enable a smooth process of selecting, financing, installing, and monitoring the upgrades that will create the most meaningful difference for your house and your utility bills. Climafy accommodates everyone, including those deeply interested in the details of energy efficiency. Others, on the other hand, would rather let us figure everything out, and that's okay. With Climafy, you can go at your own pace and still make green happen at the click of a button.
Climafy is an ambitious project with significant outstanding development to prepare for our first customers. We are a small dynamic team, and have been developing Climafy's technology over the past three years without any outside investment. With your help, we can launch the service in Spring, 2013. story:
A SUSTAINABLE FOREST PROJECT
State of Hawaii – Island of Kauai

This campaign is about closing “the sustainability loop” on an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. Specifically, a unique facility on Kauai Island involves the application of a proprietary pyrolysis technology to process Albizia wood chips into heat energy, gas and oil distillates, and carbon fractions. The heat energy will be used by a planned cold storage facility, the bio-derived gas and oil will be used by the power plant to generate electric power, and the carbon fraction will be packaged and sold as value-added carbon products.

We seek this funding to complete the initial project development work and create a viable project prospectus to present to interested investors. To date, we have completed:

  • Legal Formation
  • Design Level Engineering
  • Pyrolysis Oil Testing
  • Carbon Product Testing

The development work that remains includes:

  • Begin Project Permitting
  • Additional Engineering
  • Advanced Oil and Carbon Testing
  • Legal and Accounting
  • The Project Funding Campaign

This project features the physical completion of a dream that began more than 20 years ago, and opens the door to a truly Sustainable Forest - an environmental oasis on the island of Kauai - a system that is in keeping with a fair helping of each of the classic elements required for true human sustainability:

Social – Environmental – Economic

Please help us to create a “sustainability model” on Kauai that nurtures the nature of the island, builds community, and makes profitable products.

PROJECT DETAILS

For more information, please visit Kauai Sustainability Project

Check out the Biochar Bob goes to Hawaii video!

 

PERKS

Sustainability Poster

Challenge Coin

 

 

 

 

 

 

Albizia Club

Champion Club

story:
Campaign Description

In Africa there are millions of unemployed and a lot of arid wasteland. Green Self Reliance, Inc. (GSR) has demonstrated the power of it is possible to alleviate and reverse both conditions with its rural development business model based on a successful prototype village project in The Democratic Republic of Congo. Prior to launch in 2005 of the prototype, the entire province of South Kivu was embroiled in civil war. The land was barren and laid waste due to constant conflicts, and there was well over 98% unemployment. Today, the prototype has spread across several villages in Ruzizi Valley and has thousands of a prosperous and thriving members growing over 40+ varieties of with an average of three to four harvests per year. We now hope to continue this success by extending our operations to cover thousands of villages in order to bring better work opportunities and living conditions. GSR will work with millions of small farmers to rapidly improve the rural economy. These small farmers have the motivation, energy and skill necessary to engage in restorative agriculture.


GSR’s Sustainable Restorative Agriculture (SRA) model makes it possible for small farmers in rural Africa to more than triple their income within a few years. Restorative agriculture is a hybrid system using many cutting edge techniques from permaculture, sustainable agriculture, appropriate technologies, and organic farming practices. It is ideal for making the soil more fertile and increasing crop yields substantially. Because operations are small scale and keep sustainability in the forefront of our minds, SRA has an added benefit of being a practical solution for making agriculture environmental. Small farmers can therefore conserve and even reduce the total amount resources needed for optimal farming.

GSR helps empower rural communities to build adaptive sustainable green economies, to help them resolve the most pressing global economic challenges and environmental, such as the food crisis and land degradation (due to climate change and desertification). We offer education, training, infrastructure, and commercial, financial, and consulting services to ensure the growth of rural economies. Here is our formula for success:
  • Increase productivity and food quality significantly by introducing cost-effective organic farming techniques to improve substandard and depleted soil
  • Enable farmers to connect to markets by improving processing, storage, transport, warehousing and water retention infrastructure
  • Provide financial services and establish cooperative market systems
  • Introduce efficient, renewable green energy for a prosperous green economy
Given sufficient funding, GSR’s target is to ramp up our project to support 1,000 villages within seven years of initial funding, and in the process help rural communities enhance income and job opportunities for hundreds of millions of people. Our restorative agriculture model is replicable, which means the more financial support we get, the faster the project can grow.

For more details see our website – www.greenselfreliance.com.

What will be done with the campaign funds?

$50,000 is the barebones minimal funds needed for GSR to conduct a proper assessment in Africa and apply for $100 Million development funds. Without providing proper assessment data, it is difficult to get the necessary funding and support for running our operations. We are currently in talks with several African countries about running projects with them. Some of these potential project sites are in Cameroon, Cote d’Ivoire, Ghana, Sierra Leone and Gambia.

Stretch Goals

If contributions exceed $100,000, GSR will start working on the ground immediately after running the assessment. If our campaign receives $200,000, GSR will expand our development project to a much larger area.

Regardless of stretch goals, we will keep contributors informed about the success of the project sites that they have supported. Connect with us on social media and subscribe to our newsletter to get regular updates.

Who is GSR working with?

GSR may be a new player in the development community; however we have already made very critical connections to some of the world’s leading business, governance and academic experts, some of whom sit on the board of advisors for GSR. Our project proposals are currently being reviewed by a number of international development agencies, including the IDC (Industrial Development Corporation) and the DBSA (Development Bank of Southern Africa).


We’ve recently received a letter of intent from IDC and look forward to working with them to improve the manufacturing process of palm oil for small producers in Ghana that is both sustainable and viable for local and global markets. We have already over 25,000 small farmers ready to partner with GSR and this number will grow. We’re also preparing a proposal for the Government of India, Ministry of External Affairs for major funding support for our development projects in Africa.

GSR has already received a number of invitation letters from governments in Africa (including Sierra Leone) to help them sustainably expand their agricultural production. We look forward to building a network of rural economies in Africa to bolster the economic growth of rural communities so that they can become a significant participant in the global market.


For this crowdfunding campaign, GSR has teamed up with a number of socially conscious organizations just to make sure we provide you with some of the best quality green perks available on the market. When you contribute to our campaign, you will not only be supporting GSR but our partners as well. By helping us, you’ll be helping the green economy grow!


Akshar Choudree Fine Jewelry


Organic Solve

OM Environmental Products

TheGreenOffice

Enviro-Save, Products, Inc.

Eros Creative and Sound

Krisit Organic Agricultural Institute

Additional Information

This is a sampling of some resources about restorative agriculture and its role in reversing climate change.

Helpful Links:

Holistic Management International 

Savory Institute

Quivira Coalition 

Soil Carbon Coalition  (GSR Advisory Member)

Christine Jones 

Tony Lovell 

Judith Schwartz

Articles/Videos:

Holistic Management

Allan Savory

Michael Pollan

Tony Lovell

Judith Schwartz

Examples of Practitioners:

Colin Seis

Gabe Brown

Belcampo Farms

Ian Mitchell-Innes:

June 2013 Interview 

On reversing land degradation 

On managing chaos (managing for what you want, not for what you don't want)

Contact us:

Headquarter Office:

16200 Maricopa Hwy

Ojai, CA 93023

David Dawes

Email:  david@greenselfreliance.com

FAQs

What?

1.  What is GSR?

GSR is a California corporation that is transitioning to what is called a Benefit Corporation that partners with villages to develop flourishing prosperous zero carbon (or carbon negative) communities. We’re not a charity or an aid organization. GSR is a for-profit company that is proposing a new form of business that partners up directly with rural communities. It is a new business paradigm that empowers people, builds strong, resilient local economies from the ground up, and is restorative to both communities and the land. This business structure is based upon GSR’s development model is based on the highly successful prototype project in Democratic Republic of Congo.

2.  What is VDC?

The Village Development Corporations are legal entities set up by GSR’s legal team working in close cooperation with village leaders. VDCs help chart the most effective course for local development and protect their members from fluctuations in the global market.

3.  What is the history of the GSR model?

GSR is the brainchild of two people. David Dawes has many years of experience in community empowerment in Africa. Govinda Rubin is a social media marketing wiz and practitioner. The synergy of their experience and international networks in restorative agriculture, community empowerment and social media networking makes possible this crowdfunding campaign and the GSR’s business model a success.

4.  What is the timetable for GSR operations?

GSR expects to achieve its Phase One goals (100  flourishing agricultural based communities)  by the end of 2016, its Phase Two goals (1000 communities) by 2020, and Phase Three (10,000 communities) by 2025.

5.  What can I do to help?

There are many ways that you can help:

·  Invest directly in GSR as we develop exciting methods and systems to achieve successful ventures and get excellent ROI.

·  Invest your influence and tell everyone you know about GSR. Introduce GSR (and our crowdfunding campaign page) to the people in your social media network.

·  Invest your sweat – take our one year training program in sustainable organic agriculture (see the Rewards Section)

·  Invest your inspiration by working with us as per your skill, there is plenty of opportunity and GSR is sure there is some niche in this business that you can fill in!

6.  What is my benefit?

You get to help save the planet. In the course of saving the planet, you may get the opportunity to make your own life a success story.

7.  What happens after this project is successful?

Once GSR has successfully completed a development project, we will be a self-sufficient company. At that point we will begin acting on behalf of our partners as a broker for their surplus goods which we will sell on our online store, tentatively called The Green Planet Store.

Where?

1.  Where will most GSR projects take place?

Phase One will focus on rural Africa.

2.  Where will GSR get its backing/funding from?

GSR is applying for funding from India’s Ministry of External Affairs, the Industrial Development Council, the Southern Africa development Bank, private investors, and other sources.

3.  Where does GSR see itself in a few years from now?

GSR expects to see our sustainable village development projects go viral all across Africa, with several hundreds of millions of small farmers participating.

We will develop an online network of thousands of communities, a major online TV network broadcasting and live streaming a wide variety of events such as development conferences, inter-village sports events, educational and training shows, etc.

4.  Where is GSR HQ located?

Ojai, CA.

5.  Where is the prototype village for the GSR model?

The Democratic Republic of Congo.

When?

1.  When will GSR receive its other funding?

The success of this crowdfunding campaign will make it possible for GSR to invest the time and energy into performing the preliminary assessments, and then writing a proposal for major funding. Funding could be received in as little as three months after the crowdfunding campaign is complete.

2.  When will GSR do the preliminary assessment?

As soon as the crowdfunding campaign is over, the first assessment team will go out.

3.  When will GSR come to my country?

Work with us. Help us to build a GSR project in your country!

4.  When will we hear news about GSR projects?

GSR will be putting constant updates on our social media sites and website. Sign up for the GSR newsletter and get the monthly news. Follow us on all our Social Media sites and communicate with us and our supporters in near real time.

5.  When can I join the GSR team?

Now.

Why?

1.  Why is GSR doing this?

We want to have a happy, peaceful and prosperous life. However, that kind of life shouldn’t be at the expense of others’ prosperity. We would like the world our children live in to be as prosperous and exciting for as many people as is possible.

2.  Why should I be interested?

You are important. You have the potential to do great things in your life. Join GSR today and help create the right economic conditions to protect life on Earth.

3.  Why is the assessment process important?

For GSR to properly help the local communities, we need to be well-informed of the local socioeconomic situation, climate, and environmental conditions. We can then inform our partners and investors and acquire the appropriate capital and resources determined to be necessary for a successful venture.

4.  Why is GSR focusing on rural development solution for environmental and economic issues?

All life subsists on food. The rural life has been downplayed for a long time – restorative agriculture starts in the countryside.

5.  Why does GSR need your help? Why can’t we do these ourselves?

The challenges facing us are massive. Working together will allow us to tackle the problems more cost-effectively.

How?

1.  How confident is GSR of meeting success?

100%. This will work because it resonates with millions of people.

2.  How viable is its model?

This model makes a prosperous yet totally green middle class life possible

3.  How much does GSR need for the entire project?

The more funding we get, the faster the project can grow. The GSR model has very low capital requirements relative to the scale being proposed. This is because the model will unleash the creative potential of millions of people whose energy and skill will make the project successful.

4.  How do I know this is a legitimate enterprise?

GSR has received acclaim from some of the world’s most renowned sustainable business and development thought leaders.

GSR
has already received a number of invitation letters from governments in Africa
(including Sierra Leone) to help them sustainably expand their agricultural
production. We look forward to building a network of rural economies in Africa
to bolster the economic growth of rural communities so that they can become a
significant participant in the global market.

For
this crowdfunding campaign, GSR has teamed up with a number of socially
conscious organizations just to make sure we provide you with some of the best
quality green perks available on the market. When you contribute to our
campaign, you will not only be supporting GSR but our partners as well. By helping
us, you’ll be helping the green economy grow!


Akshar Choudree Fine Jewelry
Organic SolveOM Environmental Products
TheGreenOffice
Enviro-Save, Products, Inc.
Eros Creative and Sound
Krisit Organic Agricultural InstituteAdditional InformationThis is a sampling of some resources about
restorative agriculture and its role in reversing climate change.Helpful Links:

Management International

Institute

Coalition  (GSR Advisory Member)

Jones

Schwartz

Holistic
Management

Pollan

Schwartz

Belcampo
Farms
Ian Mitchell-Innes:
June 2013 Interview  
On reversing land degradation  
On managing chaos (managing for what you want, not for what you
don't want)
Contact us:

Headquarter Office:
16200 Maricopa Hwy
Ojai, CA 93023

David Dawes
Email:  david@greenselfreliance.com


FAQs



What?
1. 
What is GSR?

GSR is a California corporation that is transitioning to what is called a Benefit Corporation that partners with villages to develop flourishing prosperous zero carbon (or carbon negative) communities. We’re not a charity or an aid organization. GSR is a for-profit company that is proposing a new form of business that partners up directly with rural communities. It is a new business paradigm that empowers people, builds strong, resilient local economies from the ground up, and is restorative to both communities and the land. This business structure is based upon GSR’s development model is based on the highly successful prototype project in Democratic Republic of Congo.
2. 
What is VDC?
The Village Development Corporations are legal entities set up by GSR’s legal team working in close cooperation with village leaders. VDCs help chart the most effective course for local development and protect their members from fluctuations in the global market.
3. 
What is the
history of the GSR model?


GSR is the brainchild of two
people. David Dawes has many years of experience in community empowerment in
Africa. Govinda Rubin is a social media marketing wiz and practitioner. The
synergy of their experience and international networks in restorative
agriculture, community empowerment and social media networking makes possible
this crowdfunding campaign and the GSR’s business model a success. 
4. 
What is the
timetable for GSR operations?


GSR expects to achieve its Phase One goals (100  flourishing agricultural based
communities)  by the end of 2016, its Phase Two goals (1000 communities) by
2020, and Phase Three (10,000
communities) by 2025.
5. 
What can I
do to help?
There are
many ways that you can help:
· 
Invest directly in GSR as we develop exciting
methods and systems to achieve successful ventures and get excellent ROI. 
· 
Invest your influence and tell everyone you
know about GSR. Introduce GSR (and our
crowdfunding campaign page) to the people in your social media network. 
· 
Invest your sweat – take our one year
training program in sustainable organic agriculture (see the Rewards Section) 
· 
Invest your inspiration by working with us as per your skill, there is plenty of opportunity and GSR is sure there is some niche in this business that you can fill in!
6. 
What is my benefit?
You get to help save the planet. In the course of saving the planet, you may get the opportunity to make your own life a success story.
7. 
What happens
after this project is successful?
Once GSR has successfully completed a development project, we will be a self-sufficient company. At that point we will begin acting on behalf of our partners as a broker for their surplus goods which we will sell on our online store, tentatively called The Green Planet Store. 
Where?
1. 
Where will
most GSR projects take place?
Phase One will focus
on rural Africa.
2. 
Where will
GSR get its backing/funding from?
GSR is applying for funding from
India’s Ministry of External Affairs, the Industrial Development Council, the
Southern Africa development Bank, private investors, and other sources.
3. 
Where does
GSR see itself in a few years from now?
GSR expects to see our
sustainable village development projects go viral all across Africa, with
several hundreds of millions of small farmers participating. 
We will develop an online network
of thousands of communities, a major online TV network broadcasting and live
streaming a wide variety of events such as development conferences,
inter-village sports events, educational and training shows, etc. 
4. 
Where is GSR
HQ located?
Ojai, CA.
5. 
Where is the
prototype village for the GSR model?
The Democratic Republic of Congo.
When?
1. 
When will
GSR receive its other funding?
The success
of this crowdfunding campaign will make it possible for GSR to invest the time
and energy into performing the preliminary assessments, and then writing a
proposal for major funding. Funding
could be received in as little as three months after the crowdfunding campaign
is complete.
2. 
When will
GSR do the preliminary assessment?
As soon as the crowdfunding
campaign is over, the first assessment team will go out.
3. 
When will
GSR come to my country?
Work with us. Help us to build a GSR project in your
country!
4. 
When will we
hear news about GSR projects?
GSR will be putting constant
updates on our social media sites and website. Sign up for the GSR newsletter and get the
monthly news. Follow us on all our
Social Media sites and communicate with us and our supporters in near real
time.
5. 
When can I
join the GSR team?
Now.
Why?
1. 
Why is GSR
doing this?
We want to have a happy, peaceful
and prosperous life. However, that kind
of life shouldn’t be at the expense of others’ prosperity. We would like the world our children live in
to be as prosperous and exciting for as many people as is possible.
2. 
Why should I
be interested?
You are important. You have the potential to do great things in
your life. Join GSR today and help
create the right economic conditions to protect life on Earth.
3. 
Why is the
assessment process important?
For GSR to properly help the
local communities, we need to be well-informed of the local socioeconomic
situation, climate, and environmental conditions. We can then inform our partners and investors
and acquire the appropriate capital and resources determined to be necessary
for a successful venture. 
4. 
Why is GSR
focusing on rural development solution for environmental and economic issues?
All life subsists on food. The rural life has been downplayed for a long
time – restorative agriculture starts in the countryside.
5. 
Why does GSR
need your help? Why can’t we do these
ourselves?
The challenges facing us are
massive. Working together will allow us
to tackle the problems more cost-effectively.
How?

1. 
How
confident is GSR of meeting success? 
100%. This will work because it resonates with
millions of people.
2. 
How viable
is its model?
This model makes a prosperous yet
totally green middle class life possible 
3. 
How much
does GSR need for the entire project?
The more funding we get, the
faster the project can grow. The GSR
model has very low capital requirements relative to the scale being
proposed. This is because the model
will unleash the creative potential of millions of people whose energy and
skill will make the project successful.
4. 
How do I
know this is a legitimate enterprise?
GSR has received acclaim from some of the
world’s most renowned sustainable business and development thought leaders.

story:
Short Summary

Who is I.D.E.A.S. for UF?

I.D.E.A.S. for UF is a chapter of the international non-profit organization I.D.E.A.S. (Intellectual Decisions on Environmental Awareness Solutions). IDEAS is a youth-led movement that strives to advance sustainability and solve environmental problems through research (R&D), action and awareness at universities, K-12 schools and communities across the World. At IDEAS for UF we nurture the talents of youth leaders to enact innovative ideas and solve the integrated energy, environmental and economic problems in their community. Through a network of educational institutions, green businesses and community organizations, IDEAS provides the resources and support needed for young people to create positive environmental change and bring a culture of sustainability on campus and in the community.

FUN FACT: At Power Shift 2011 the I.D.E.A.S. organization held their own seminar on Kill-a-Watt Energy Challenge and how it was able to spread across Florida and expand into other states.  Also featured were the unique initiatives that I.D.E.A.S. coordinates, such as Upcycling, Ecosystem clean-ups, and IDEAS for Education.

Why are we a part of the Power Shift movement &what will we achieve?

Power Shift 2013 will bring together over 10,000 youth leaders to learn, brainstorm, and ultimately develop a movement for a clean energy economy.  Power Shift 2013 will launch hundreds of sustained campaigns and mass actions to demand climate justice.

With your help we will return from Power Shift with the resources, knowledge, and support needed to stop the environmental and economic downward spiral we are currently in with the fossil fuel industry. We will take action at the University of Florida and Gainesville area, then in the surrounding Alachua county area and beyond, to reinvest in clean energy and socially responsible alternatives to fossil fuels.  Both the University of Florida and the City of Gainesville’s energy contract will be up for renewal soon.  One of our immediate goals will be to start a campaign that will allow for more forms of alternative to be included in the new contracts. Your donations will help empower us so we make our plans a reality, and help build a future we can all be proud of.

What We Need 

Our goal is to get 50 students from the University of Florida and the surrounding Gainesville area to Pittsburgh to attend Power Shift 2013, but we need YOUR help! 

To accommodate this large group we will need to rent a bus for transportation and book a hotel for lodging.  With this campaign we are specifically trying to raise money to cover our lodging, which we have estimated to be about 5000 dollars.  We plan to book 10 rooms with 5 people per room for Saturday and Sunday night.

We are working on other ways to raise money to cover transportation costs.  One of our fundraising techniques will involve our bike-powered sewing machine that we use to turn old t-shirts into handy, reusable tote bags!  We plan to set up at the Union Street Farmers Market Downtown on Wednesday afternoons and at the Alachua County Farmers Market on Saturday mornings on to give people the opportunity to use the bike-powered sewing machine and make their own reusable tote bags that can be used while they shop.  While we will be collecting donations, this will also be an educational and outreach event to get people to use less plastic bags while showing them alternative forms of energy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute you can still help our cause!

Spread the word about this campaign! 

Share our link on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other social media website.


For any other info, contact us at: ideas4uf@gmail.com

story:
Plastic pollution is a vast emerging problem which threatens the health of our oceans and the sustainability of our future. You only need to type in the 'Great Ocean Garbage Patch' into google or simple look around to notice that plastic is everywhere! But what about the sorts of plastics that you cannot see as easily?

Microbeads are small plastic beads which are added to cosmetic products such as scrubs and toothpastes and marketed for their exfoliating properties. Due to their small size they are not filtered out by water treatment and end up in our oceans. As foreign materials in this environment animals are unable to recognise them and avoid them and so unintentionally consume these beads. When inside these animals they are not digested properly and build up in their digestive systems resulting in fatal consequences for not only themselves but also animals who prey upon them. 

Considering we eat seafood, microbeads also pose threat to us. 

Microbeads are totally unnecessary additives and there are many natural alternatives available which they could easily be replaced with. President Obama has already committed to phasing out microbeads in all US produce by 2017 so why are other governments not doing the same? What do we need to do to make something happen? 

Media influence has skyrocketed in the past decade with the development of social media and youtube and it is much more difficult to capture people's attention. It's well known that globally our marine environment is becoming increasingly degraded. Conservation campaigns often try to spread awareness using horrifying images of what's happening all over the world like turtles getting plastic tubes pulled out of their noses and dead birds with plastics in their stomachs. Whilst these are most certainly memorable and often effective are they contributing to the global phenomenon of eco-fatigue? How many more birds with plastic filled stomachs will it take for us to become disengaged and numb?

So is there another way that we can really get people to engage in conservation issues in a more positive manner? 

We want to create a parody video of 'Uptown Funk' by Bruno Mars the most played record of 2015 to get people talking about microbeads. We believe that by taking this approach which has never been done before we can capture the attention of the media and public and draw attention to the impact these beads are having on our oceans by making everybody laugh. The aim of the video is to simply spread public awareness and get people to sign the petition to get these beads banned from products in the UK. However, we also hope this will translate to other countries further afield. 

However to gain the media coverage and publicity we are aiming for, this video must be produced to a high standard. We require funding for:

  • Film equipment
  • Film insurance
  • Production costs
  • Crew costs
  • Location costs
  • Additional props
  • Van hire
  • Campaign t-shirts

If you would like to donate to this cause and would like to see a breakdown of our costs please email me on : ditchthosebeads@gmail.com and I will send you over the budget sheet. 

If you donate £18 to our campaign you also get to receive one of our campaign t-shirts and will be a huge contribution to helping us spread awareness about microbeads! Though our iconic logo is the fish we also have designs with other animals including manta rays, sharks, turtles and penguins so send us an email for more details! 

We really do not need these beads in our oceans and we do not need them in our products! Help us to create this unique campaign video unlike anything done before in conservation so we can generate the publicity we need to get these beads banned!

story:
Our family owned custom cloth diaper company, Eco Existence has decided to changed it's name to Diaper Days and grow our small home based custom cloth diaper service in to a larger space with a new look and new equipment to increase our customer load. We know the more babies Diaper Days will provide custom cloth diapers to, the more babies Diaper Days will keep out of disposables. Diaper Daysneeds your help to expand so we can expand the number of people we reach, allowing us to make an even bigger difference on both an individual and a global level.

The main challenge we experience is being able to keep up with the number of customers (babies) as we grow. Diaper Days provides excellent products and care to every customer we have and we want to continue to do so as we grow. The Diaper Days family knows this biz is ready to a grow a care team that with the same passion and knowledge about custom cloth diapering babies. Diaper Days can only hope we grow so quickly that keeping up is difficult. We have put everything into getting Eco Existence, soon to be Diaper Days up and running and will continue to make EVERY effort to move and grow in the right direction. This isn't something that has been easy so far. We aren't looking for easy :) It's a challenge and we are in it for the long haul.

story:
(scroll down for English)

Bu Haziran KuzeyDoğa için Andorra Ultra'da hiç durmadan 112 km koşuyorum.
2010'dan beri dünyanın farklı coğrafyalarında insanın fiziksel ve zihinsel sınırlarını zorlayan, aralarında 250 km’lik dört çöl yarışının (4Deserts Challenge) da bulunduğu sayısız ultra maratonunu tamamladım. Bir sonraki yarışım içinse rotayı İspanya ile Fransa arasında Doğu Pirene Sıradağlarında kurulu Andorra Prensliği’ne çevirdim.

Andorra Ultra yarışının 112 km’lik Mitic parkurunu hiç durmadan koşacağım, bitiş çizgisine vardığım anda prensliğin en yüksek tepesi olan 2942m’lik Comapedrosa zirvesini ziyaret etmiş, 9,700m tırmanmış (ve inmiş) ve ülkenin etrafında tam bir daire çizmiş olacağım.

Bugüne kadar koştuğum her yarışta amaçlarına ve çalışmalarına inandığım organizasyonlar için çeşitli kampanyalar yürüttüm, Andorra Ultra’da insanların, doğanın korunmasından en az yaban hayat kadar fayda sağladıkları bir dünya vizyonu ile hareket eden KuzeyDoğa Derneği’nin doğa koruma, ekolojik araştırma ve yaban hayatı rehabilitasyon projelerini destekleyeceğim.

KuzeyDoğa ve Kurucusu Çağan Şekercioğlu - National Geographic Kaşifi - derneğin kurulduğu 2008'den beridir sayısız başarıya imza attılar. Türkiye'nin Kars-Ardahan-Iğdır ve Ağrı illerinde yaptıkları çalışmalarla birçok uluslararası ödüle layık görüldüler;

  • Kuyucuk Gölü Yaban Hayatı Geliştirme Sahasını Türkiye’nin 13., Doğu Anadolu’nun ilk ve tek RAMSAR alanı ilan ettirdiler, 
  • İngiltere’nin Çevre Nobeli olarak da bilinen Whitley Altın ödülünü kazandılar, 
  • Kars-Kuyucuk Gölü’nü Avrupa’nın Seçkin Turizm Cenneti (EDEN) ilan ettirdiler,
  • Türkiye’nin doğa koruma amaçlı ilk yapay adasını inşa ettiler, ve 
  • Türkiye’nin ilk akbaba lokantasını açtırdılar

Sizden, KuzeyDoğa'nın bu başarılarının devamı için desteğinizi istiyorum.

Ayrıca destek veren herkese göndereceğimiz özel bir soruya en iyi üç cevaptan birini vererek aşağıdaki ödüllerden birini kazanma şansı yakalamış olacaksınız;

  • Bir destekçimiz bizimle birlikte Andorra’ya gelip destek ekibiyle Andorra Ultra heyecanını yerinde yaşama şansını yakalayacak.
  • Bir destekçimiz Kars'ta KuzeyDoğa’nın çalışmalarını yerinde deneyimleme fırsatı kazanacak.
  • Bir destekçimiz ise Raidlight Profesyonel Koşucu sırt çantası sahibi olacak.



EN

This June I will be running 112km for KuzeyDoğa in Andorra.
Since 2010, I took part in many events that challenged both physical and mental boundaries, including the 4Deserts Challenge and many other ultra marathons. For my next event I am turning to the Principality of Andorra on the Eastern Pyrenees at the border of Spain and France.

When I reach the finish line after having run non stop for 112km I would have passed the Principality's highest peak Comapedrosa, 2,942km, climbed 9,700m (and descended) and covered its entire perimeter.

Thus far, almost in every event that I took part, I have supported causes whose objectives and projects that I believed in.

At Andorra Ultra, I will be supporting KuzeyDoğa Society that aims to prevent extinctions and consequent collapses of critical ecosystem processes while making sure that human communities benefit from conservation as much as the wildlife they help conserve.

Since the Society's foundation, KuzeyDoğa and its founder Çağan Şekercioğlu - a National Geographic Explorer, have completed many successful projects. Their projects in the Kars-Ardahan-Iğdır and Ağrı districts of Turkey have been rewarded with a number of international awards;

  • They had Lake Kuyucuk Ramsar Site designated as Turkey’s 13, eastern Anatolia’s first RAMSAR site, 
  • They received the Whitley Gold Award which is known as environmental Nobel Prize of UK, 
  • They have Lake Kuyucuk designated as European Destinations of Excellence (EDEN) site of Turkey in 2009,
  • They have  Turkey’s first artificial island constructed at Lake Kuyucuk Ramsar site to create a safe haven for birds, and 
  • started Turkey’s first vulture restaurant in Igdır.

I ask you to support KuzeyDoğa with your donations so that they can continue with the wonderful work they have been doing. 

This time with your support you will have the chance of winning one of the three main awards by giving one of the top three answers to the question we will share with all our supporters;

  • One of our lucky supporter will join us in Andorra as part of the support crew and get to experience first hand Andorra Ultra.
  • Another supporter will get to visit KuzeyDoğa in Kars to experience their projects in person.
  • Finally, our last prize will be a Raidlight runners backpack.

9,700m tırmanmış (ve inmiş) ve ülkenin etrafında tam bir daire çizmiş olacağım.
Bugüne kadar koştuğum her yarışta
amaçlarına ve çalışmalarına inandığım organizasyonlar için çeşitli kampanyalar
yürüttüm, Andorra Ultra’da insanların, doğanın korunmasından en az yaban
hayat kadar fayda sağladıkları bir dünya vizyonu ile hareket eden KuzeyDoğa
Derneği’nin doğa koruma, ekolojik araştırma ve yaban
hayatı rehabilitasyon projelerini destekleyeceğim.
KuzeyDoğa ve Kurucusu Çağan
Şekercioğlu - National Geographic Kaşifi - derneğin kurulduğu
2008'den beridir sayısız başarıya imza attılar.
Türkiye'nin Kars-Ardahan-Iğdır ve Ağrı illerinde yaptıkları çalışmalarla
birçok uluslararası ödüle layık görüldüler;

Kuyucuk Gölü Yaban Hayatı Geliştirme Sahasını Türkiye’nin 13., Doğu Anadolu’nun ilk ve tek RAMSAR
     alanı ilan ettirdiler, 
İngiltere’nin Çevre Nobeli olarak da bilinen Whitley Altın ödülünü kazandılar, 
Kars-Kuyucuk Gölü’nü Avrupa’nın Seçkin Turizm Cenneti (EDEN) ilan
     ettirdiler,
Türkiye’nin doğa koruma amaçlı ilk yapay adasını inşa ettiler,
     ve 
Türkiye’nin ilk akbaba lokantasını
     açtırdılar

Sizden, KuzeyDoğa'nın bu başarılarının
devamı için desteğinizi istiyorum.
Ayrıca destek veren herkese
göndereceğimiz özel bir soruya en iyi üç cevaptan birini vererek aşağıdaki
ödüllerden birini kazanma şansı yakalamış olacaksınız;

Bir destekçimiz bizimle birlikte Andorra’ya gelip destek
     ekibiyle Andorra Ultra heyecanını yerinde yaşama şansını yakalayacak.
Bir destekçimiz Kars'ta KuzeyDoğa’nın çalışmalarını
     yerinde deneyimleme fırsatı kazanacak.
Bir destekçimiz ise Raidlight Profesyonel Koşucu sırt
     çantası sahibi olacak.


EN
This June I will be running 112km
for KuzeyDoğa in Andorra.
Since 2010, I took part in many events that challenged both physical and mental
boundaries, including the 4Deserts Challenge and many other ultra marathons.
For my next event I am turning to the Principality of Andorra on the Eastern
Pyrenees at the border of Spain and France.
When I reach the finish line after
having run non stop for 112km I would have passed the Principality's highest
peak Comapedrosa, 2,942km, climbed 9,700m (and descended) and covered its
entire perimeter.
Thus far, almost in every event that
I took part, I have supported causes whose objectives and projects that I
believed in.
At Andorra Ultra, I will be
supporting KuzeyDoğa Society that aims to
prevent extinctions and consequent collapses of critical ecosystem processes
while making sure that human communities benefit from conservation as much as the
wildlife they help conserve.
Since the Society's foundation, KuzeyDoğa
and its founder Çağan Şekercioğlu - a National
Geographic Explorer, have completed many successful projects. Their projects in
the Kars-Ardahan-Iğdır and Ağrı districts of Turkey have been rewarded with a
number of international awards;

They had Lake Kuyucuk Ramsar Site designated as Turkey’s 13, eastern Anatolia’s first RAMSAR site, 
They received the Whitley Gold Award which is known
     as environmental Nobel Prize of UK, 
They have Lake Kuyucuk designated as European Destinations of Excellence (EDEN) site
     of Turkey in 2009,
They have  Turkey’s first artificial island constructed
     at Lake Kuyucuk Ramsar site to create a safe haven for birds, and 
started Turkey’s first vulture restaurant in
     Igdır.

I ask you to
support KuzeyDoğa with your donations so that they can continue with
the wonderful work they have been doing. 
This time with your support you will
have the chance of winning one of the three main awards by giving one of the
top three answers to the question we will share with all our supporters;

One of our lucky supporter will join us in Andorra as part
     of the support crew and get to experience first hand Andorra
     Ultra.
Another supporter will get to visit KuzeyDoğa in
     Kars to experience their projects in person.
Finally, our last prize will be a Raidlight runners
     backpack.

story:
Early Adopters Huge Perks By helping us achieve our goal each & every one of you will receive a days pass F.O.C. Free Of Charge to one of our Global Events irrespective of perk size. Without any Eco ✩VIP✩ Perks or Privileges. However as one of the Founding Members of The QU Consortium & The ARK Foundation with or without a T-Shirt or Umbrella you will be recognised & rewarded, trust us you will be remembered. That's a surprise we will withhold for later on further down the Green Road for All Our Giants, mighty or small, matters not it's the caring effort & thought that counts. "Accommodation & Transportation not included. Furthermore any upgrades to weekend extravaganzas or any other future list of events, will be discounted by 50%. Subject to achieving our goal & is limited to initial perk offering targets being achieved. "Do You Believe In Miracles, Every Miracle Starts With The Faith To Believe" 

What Do Points Make They Make Prizes For every $1 contribution & ethical share certificate obtained we will effectively be holding a draw were each & every entrant will be raffled like a prize draw with the chosen winner joining myself the Visionary/Founder & the Jollier Green Giant via Perk 11 which consists of:- Weekend Eco ✩VIP✩ privileges concert/festival setting off in a hot air balloon. Meals & accommodation included, transport not. Signed photo & poster of weekend event. Name in lights which will be included in the film's closing credits. You will also be invited to attend the world premiere Eco VIP (T's&C's as perk 5). Plus perk 1, 2 & 3 fully inclusive. Digital Download with updates pre-production to release delivered to inbox & our sincerest gratitude. +100,000 ethical share certificates!!! What better incentive!!!

QU Consortium Quintessentially or Quality for you ARK Foundation Architecture Responsibility Kudos QU signifies more about you than it does about itself, it's an allocentric brand who's primary purpose is to serve you, for the people by the people. It's modus operandi "mode of operation" is to be socially responsible & enterprising by providing simple but inspiring newtech, cleantech & renewable solution for complex problems. Specific & particular apparatus the likes of which have never been seen or experienced anywhere in the World to date. Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we know & understand, while imagination embraces the entire World & all there ever will be to know & understand - Albert Einstein.

Our Story If you are a fan/admirer of Rob Roy/Braveheart/ David & Goliath Rocky Balboa story you've come to the right place. Since time memorial a single person for the people by the people can make a significant difference & evoke huge change for the benefit of all. Myself & a sophisticated team that I identified, qualified, quantified & rectified a long long time ago. To design & build green communities totally self sufficient & sustainable from newtech, cleantech & renewable apparatus the likes of which have never been seen or experienced anywhere in the World to date. Wherever the natural elements of earth, water, fire, air, are abundant, plus plentiful, whilst ideally retaining or restoring existing heritage & legacy via historical buildings that need some tender loving care. Locally sourcing each & every material, plus component that are indigenous to that vernacular, where Mother-Nature & it's preservation & protection is the universal language. Intertwined with minimal ecological & environmental impact, with the political will to support sustainable change & difference. As soon as a country publicly steps forward recognising the global significance & importance, as we have already identified quite a few sites/locations already, one historical site has even been offered virtually for free but there are limitation with the land. We hope to succeed initially via this process, short term via a concert/festival again reiterating the likes of which have never been experienced of conceived anywhere before. Not another LiveAid or LiveEarth & certainly not a controversial failed Scottish Home Coming Event either but hugely entertaining, invigorating  & unique, plus innovative. More to the point educational by opening our minds & our eyes to the infinite possibilities via inspirational events & extravaganzas central to ecomagination, earthlymagination, caremagination, diffmagination, wellnessmagination, changemagination. Why it's self pretty explanatory!

Sharing The Story Message & Journey We all spend our life's telling them, about this about that, about people but some stories are so good we wish they'd never end. Their so gripping that we'll go without sleep, just to see a little bit more, some stories bring us laughter & sometimes they bring us tears but isn't that what a great story does "MAKES YOU FEEL". Stories that are so powerful, they really are with us forever!!! It's pretty evident & obvious by now that this social enterprise, will not reside nor will any event likely take place in Aberdeenshire, Scotland. Unless there is another miraculous miracle & radical shake up of local & national politics but it is hoped that the success of this alternative ethical business model will be adopted & a lesson learnt in Scotland. Even though it may be an expensive one for Aberdeenshire Council & the SNP Government but not as costly as it has already been for the residents of Balmedie, Aberdeenshire, Scotland. There is a twist to this tail & it already has a happy ending with a historical site & location, offered virtually "Free" yes "Free" consider the aim, goal & objective via our ethical stance. Why wouldn't a party or entity accommodate or assist us with our overall theme, good question.

The Impact Changing the paradigms of the current built environment for a truly bigger & meaningful bigger society via ethical communities at one with its people, ecology, environment & truly sustainable in every abstract phrase, term & interpretation of the philosophy & ideology of heaven on earth. A sense of sustainable well-being for our children's futures & their children's futures. Professor James Blyth a stubbed Scottish Academic had the idea, concept, vision but his drive, passion & philosophy was suppressed by a carbon ideology in 1887 oppressing even depressing us today in 2011 one hundred twenty four years later. Energy is all around us but what's important is how we capture, harness & harvest that energy in a socially responsible manner befitting these fragile & sensitive times. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Blyth_(engin... In which each & every resource is becoming finite or infinitesimal & subject to future limitations or conditions, even circumstances out with our control. It's all our responsibilities & task we should all be charged with during our stewardship & the laws of nature via man's limited existence on earth to be socially conscientious & trustworthy custodians of our ecology, plus environment. I don't think of the consequences of what if this does not happen, for it has to & must happen for all our sakes as we are all accountable ultimately liable for the consequences or rather lack of our actions. We are now sadly realising that it's not about what life brings to us but what we bring to life. God isn't making any more land therefore we need to protect what we have, conservation is the new allocentric consumerism of change.

What We Need & What You Get 

  1. Firstly QU & ARK 2nd Animation Changing Built Environment Paradigms similar lines to Sir ken Robertson's RSA - Animation Changing Education Paradigms. Animation will provide illustrated solutions to the problem http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDZFcDGpL4U We hope to accomplish the same level of recognition & awareness, plus impact.
  2. Secondly a tailored & bespoke QU & ARK Socially responsible Eco Environmentally Sustainable Platform/Web Site specifically sharing subscribers/members stories & contributions to our Ecology Environment & Sustainable Issues. Ecobook-Facebook, My Space-My Environ, Bebo-B-Eco similar to other social platforms making Earth day every day exclusively concentrating on green agendas & issues, plus topics. Making it chic, hip & trendy, plus fun to be a member/subscriber.
  3. Thirdly Eco World Tour filming of green community exemplars via visionaries geniuses & futurists leading by example. Taking value from these people & communities throughout the World. Whom have raised the bar & broken down barriers in how the built environment should sustainably evolve & mature at one with its people & nature.
  4. Fourthly arranging a Global event or events concerts & festivals that entertain but specifically create awareness, concern & apathy, plus sympathy towards our fellow humans impacted or affected via climate change or corporate & governance stupidity or dumbness. A particular example being the residents at Balmedie, Aberdeenshire, Scotland whom I have supported from the outset. Educating, awakening, plus awareness of the more viable & sustainable alternatives.
  5. Fifthly & finally it's something that concern us all & is so blatantly obvious. How can one mature an idea of an allocentric brand to design, create, own, produce, manufacture each & every component utilised in an ethical green community, via local traceable materials. You create your own ethical entity, by the people for the people!!!

We have an intent & support via an ethical funder, we are hopeful that every dollar we raise is matched by & through this this funding channel $ for $. Furthermore we have identified, qualified, quantified & rectified iconic stewards & ambassadors who will not only endorse but support our ethical stance, theme, aims, goals & overall socially responsible objectives.  

Engaging & Care Sourcing  

The World is a very small place, for what happens in Japan now impacts everybody around the globe, whether that be nuclear waste which lands on the not so far flung shores of America were nuclear radioactive iodine 131 turned up in Maryland. Or the essential export of parts for the assembly line don't arrive in Swindon, Wiltshire, England & the workforce has now gone onto a 2 day week with full pay, thankfully I hear them say & their families. Who ultimately pays? Well there are obviously potential health hazards that goes without saying, our ecology is becoming more & more fragile, that then has a knock on affect via food commodities etc due to shortages & scarcity. You are only all too aware when you go the the supermarket, again who ultimately pays? "You do, we all do" everyone in our very small place we call Mother Earth but do we care for her as we would do for our Mother? An idiom I coin is the cart before the horse, build build build, devour devour devour, consume consume consume, oh yeah the horse isn't even attached to the cart & we're not even in the race, why? Because our Eco Environmentally Sustainable Revolution hasn't even begun but it can begin right here right now!!! Surely it seems illogical & totally irrational but more to the point irresponsible to treat our energy needs as a donkey let alone a thoroughbred race horse that needs to be put at the front of the cart & not behind the cart, especially now that we have a hill to climb. A lovely quote I've made my own adaptation of is "It's not what life brings to you but what you bring to life, said the farmer to the banker"  

Help Bring Something hugely Meaningful & Potentially Significant To Life!!!

Whilst The Visionary/Founder is Sharing The Only Thing He Retains Are the Intellectual Copy Rights Of The Brand Of The QU Consortium & The ARK Foundation, otherwise referred to as QU & ARK the "Allocentric Brand You Help Create"

story:
“If the bee disappeared off the face of the earth, man would only have four years left to live.”
Albert Einstein

“The life of man would be made extremely difficult if the bee disappeared.”
Charles Darwin

We want to open up a bee sanctuary where bees have access to organic and pesticide free pollen and nectar and can multiply naturally.

Our goal amount is based on opening one sanctuary, if we go beyond that we can open more.

Our timeline is:
December: Find land.
January: Build bee hives.
March-May: Plant flowers. Buy bees and attract bee swarms.
End of May: Sanctuary is fully setup.


The Problem

We are on the brink of a biological disaster. Bees who are essential for pollinating many fruits and vegetables have been dying off in massive numbers since 2006. Beekeepers have been losing on average around 28-34% of their hives every year with some farmers experiencing losses up to 90%. Some commercial beekeepers say losses have expanded drastically in the last year, wiping out 40 percent or even 50 percent of the hives. Losses of this magnitude are not sustainable for beekeepers or the ecosystem. Bees are in such high demand they are trucked all over the country to pollinate crops.

Honeybees are the most important insects to the human food chain their role in our diet goes beyond honey production. These tireless creatures pollinate about one-third of crop species in the United States, bees pollinate about 100 flowering food crops including apples, nuts, broccoli, avocados, soybeans, asparagus, celery, squash and cucumbers, citrus fruit, peaches, kiwi, cherries, blueberries, cranberries, strawberries, cantaloupe, melons, as well as animal-feed crops, such as the clover that’s fed to dairy cows. Essentially all flowering plants need bees to survive.

Bees are a highly valued resource around the world. They are prized for their honey and wax production and depended upon for pollination of many important crops. By far the most important contribution honey bees make to modern agriculture is the pollination services that they provide.

A continued massive bee die-off will imperil world food supplies and devastate ecosystems that depend on them. The loss of these creatures might rival climate change in its impact on life on earth.

Studies have shown us that there are number of factors that are weakening the bees. We have to assist those amazing creatures that have helped our agriculture in so many years.

Crop pollination by insects is estimated to be worth $19 billion to the economy of the USA. There are estimated 2.4 million hives in the United States. The increased use of pesticides, the reduction in the number of wild colonies and the increased value of both bees and pollinated crops have all added to the importance of protecting bees.

We are currently at the minimum level of bees required for food production. For the almond crops in January and February in California, 1.8 million bees are trucked to the fields from all over the United States. In January this year the only reason the almond farmers were able to complete the pollination is because the weather was perfect. That means that in 2 months time we could have reached the tipping point and the bee shortage becomes very real for everyone. There is no other viable alternative to bees when it comes to pollination

There have been many researches done into this area, but no real solution has been found and bees are still dying at the same or faster rate as before. We need a new approach.


Bee hive built in our research facility


The solution

We need the money for land and building bee hives to create a bee sanctuary. bees need long-lasting, undisturbed nesting sites in sunny, relatively bare patches of ground with a diversity of nectar and pollen-rich plants nearby. The greater the variety of flowering plants, the greater the number of bee species that will be attracted. One of the major risks, to both bee and plant diversity, is their separation through increasing fragmentation of wild uncultivated areas. Without bees, many flowering plants fail to set seed and without flowering plants, there is no food for bees. Leaving field margins, ditches, roadside verges and woodland edges unsprayed with chemicals, and undisturbed, does much for bee conservation.

Beekeeping has changed a lot in the past few decades and the number of commercial beekeepers has declined fast. Because of the bee die-offs commercial beekeepers are losing money and there are no incentives for new people to get into beekeeping.

The sanctuaries will allow us to conduct research and build a knowledge base that beekeepers can use to take better care of their bees, help with returning beekeeping to a profitable business and attract new people into beekeeping.

We need to concentrate on what we can do today so there will be a tomorrow. We need to help the bees gain their strength to fight another day.

Who we are

We are an independent research group based in Minnesota. Our passion for the environment and our business experience creates a unique mix that we believe can be used to make a difference.

Much of our research and production of hives will be conducted in our 144,000 sq ft facility in Minnesota.

Help us make this a reality so we can help the honey bee and at the same time the health and survival of the human race.

Thank you for your support.
